Thereby transgressions and defilements are dissolved, and wisdom arises of itself. One escapes the perils of birth and death and attains the realm of non-action. One deeply contemplates the arising of phenomena and examines their cessation. According to the affliction, one applies the medicine of wisdom. If one sees forms of profit, one covers the eyes with precepts; if one hears evil speech, one stops the ears with precepts; if one craves sweet fragrances, one seals the mouth with precepts; if one indulges in passions, one subdues the heart with precepts; if one inclines toward evil deeds, one restrains the feet with precepts. If the body does not transgress the precepts, one transcends the snares of the dusty world and may be called one who perfects the hundred practices and establishes the ten thousand virtues. Only after receiving and upholding the pure precepts may one engage in fasting, still the thoughts, and turn the hearing inward to introspect. The mouth does not speak idly, the body does not move recklessly. Thus, the color of the colorless is seen; the sound of the soundless is heard; the sweetness of the tasteless is savored; the response of the wordless is received. The divine spirits descend, and blessings arrive. For blessings not yet manifest, no wish remains unfulfilled.

If, however, one outwardly fails to uphold dignified deportment and inwardly neglects the precepts, with conduct unworthy of record and merit unworthy of manifestation, lacking sincerity and harboring doubt, with inner and outer not in accord, heart and mouth at variance, temper hasty and disposition perverse, secretly envious and arrogantly jealous—if the thoughts are wearied by external distractions and the spirit consumed by excessive desires—then even if one engages in fasting, one will gain no blessing throughout life. For the mind is not inwardly present, and the hun and po are labored by external affairs. Without the harmonious *qi* as master, nothing can be moved to response.

In the rituals of fasting and reciting precepts, both the altar officers and the fast’s sponsor must each uphold their duties—how can distinctions be made? Ziyun Guang claims never to have seen the *Sutra of the Supreme Precepts of Wisdom*, asserting that merely listening to the precepts’ words does not accord with the intent of the fast, and that one should first receive the precepts of ordination before proceeding. Yet those who conduct fasts, from the outset seeking novelty and indulging in extravagance, have thus introduced transgressions such as slackening in dignified deportment when ascending the altar or causing commotion at the outset of entering stillness.

Burning incense and pacing the Dao, repenting sins and confessing faults—this is called a *zhai* (fast). Inviting the perfected and descending the sages, beseeching grace and requesting blessings—this is called a *jiao* (offering). The ritual protocols of *zhai* and *jiao* must not be conflated. Yet Ziyun Guang claims that the *zhai* is simply an audience with the perfected, equivalent to the state’s sacrifices, differing only in the use of incense, vegetables, and ritual meats—this is a complete failure to recognize the origins and development of the fast’s Dharma. How can this not be astonishing?

The selection of the six offices, if following the old texts of Master Lu, admits no dispute. Yet in recent times, the *doujiang* (lecturer) has been allowed to fill the six offices, and beneath the offices, clauses such as “after discussion by the upper and lower assemblies, so-and-so is appointed” have been added, which is highly problematic. How can the *gaogong* (high priest) be a position that can be filled by popular consensus? Now all is to be reverted to Master Lu’s original regulations, to spare later generations from confusion.

Next, the *doujiang* chants, and the assembly of officers sits in order. The thirty-six prohibitions of dignified deportment are proclaimed, drawn from the *Sutra of the Supreme Ultimate’s Dignified Deportment*. The Dharma Master says: The Dharma of the fast is pure and empty, and its prohibitions are most weighty. The sponsor must sweep and purify the halls, striving for utmost cleanliness. They must command all, within and without, to be silent. They must not allow incense or oil to be lacking, nor the ritual implements to be deficient. Daoists entering the fast must each bring their own towel, robe, tablet, and shoes; they may not exchange them at the last moment. If there is a deficiency in public duties, they must not appropriate the garments of others.

When Daoists enter the fast, in all their movements—rising, sitting, coming, and going—they must report to the *jianzhai* (fast supervisor), bow once to the Dharma Master, and bow three times to the incense before departing. The same is observed upon returning. Master Zhang Wanfu says: One does not presume to point to the Three Treasures, hence one bows to the incense.

If one arrives at the fast hall with disordered shoes, one is fined two *jin* of oil, equivalent to twenty bows. The recipient of the bows may choose to accept the fine in its original form or in incense and oil. For those who comply with the fine, it is permitted. If one’s sitting and rising are disorderly, one is fined half a *sheng* of oil, equivalent to five bows. If one does not sit properly, one is fined half a *liang* of cinnabar, equivalent to five bows. If, during the performance of rituals, one speaks with outsiders, one is fined one *jin* of incense, equivalent to twenty bows. If one disturbs the incense fire, one is fined half a *jin* of incense, equivalent to ten bows. If one discusses worldly affairs, one is fined one *jin* of incense, equivalent to twenty bows. If one engages in frivolous speech or laughter, one is fined one *liang* of cinnabar, equivalent to ten bows. If one speaks coarsely or dozes, one is fined half a *liang* of cinnabar, equivalent to five bows. If one spills lamp oil, one is fined five *sheng* of oil, equivalent to fifty bows. If one’s towel or robe is disordered, one is fined half a *jin* of incense, equivalent to ten bows. If the *doujiang* errs in chanting, one is fined one *jin* of incense, equivalent to twenty bows. If the enforcer of discipline sees a transgression but does not admonish private faults, one is fined six *sheng* of oil, equivalent to sixty bows. If one attending the scriptures does not properly adorn the high seat or damages objects, one is fined half a *jin* of incense, equivalent to ten bows. If one attending the incense allows the incense smoke to break off, one is fined four *sheng* of oil, equivalent to forty bows. If one attending the lamps allows the lamp fire to extinguish, one is fined one *jin* of incense, equivalent to twenty bows. If the fast’s sponsor fails to supervise within and without, causing loud voices, one is fined five *sheng* of oil, equivalent to fifty bows. If one listens to the scriptures while leaning or not holding a tablet, one is fined one *sheng* of oil, equivalent to ten bows. If one’s attention is not fixed on purity and emptiness, and one’s thoughts and mind grow weary, as noticed by the assembly, one is fined three *sheng* of oil, equivalent to thirty bows. If one enters or exits the fast hall without reporting to the *jianzhai*, one is fined two *jin* of oil, equivalent to twenty bows.

If one lets their hair hang loose and walks hurriedly, one is fined one *jin* of incense, equivalent to twenty bows. If one recites scriptures in disorder, asks questions that disrupt the verses, one is fined three *sheng* of oil, equivalent to thirty bows. If the chanting voices are not in unison, one is fined two *sheng* of oil, equivalent to twenty bows. If one ascends the altar without washing hands or rinsing the mouth, one is fined two *jin* of oil, equivalent to twenty bows. If one’s sitting, rising, bowing, or yielding lacks proper decorum, one is fined half a *sheng* of oil, equivalent to five bows. If one circles the altar out of order or walks against the flow, one is fined half a *jin* of incense, equivalent to ten bows. If one rises, approaches, or returns to their seat without bowing to the scriptures three times before departing, one is fined one *jin* of incense, equivalent to twenty bows. If one rushes forward while burning incense, one is fined one *sheng* of oil, equivalent to ten bows. If the fast’s sponsor fails in their preparations, leaving matters incomplete, one is fined one *jin* of incense, equivalent to twenty bows. If one receives a report but does not relay it to superiors, one is fined three *jin* of oil, equivalent to thirty bows. If during the fast one leaves and does not return, having been reprimanded by the assembly, one is fined five *jin* of incense, equivalent to one hundred bows. If one violates the rules of decorum and refuses to accept the penalty, one shall report to the Three Treasures and be expelled from the fast.

If the lower-ranking officials in attendance neglect the rites, penalties shall be imposed as follows: for one to three offenses, fines shall be levied according to the regulations; for more than three offenses, one shall be expelled from the fast. Those responsible for enforcement who fail to report violations shall be punished equally with the offenders. If the presiding Dharma Master neglects their duties, they shall acknowledge their fault and submit a tablet to the *jianzhai*. For one to three offenses, fines shall be levied according to the regulations; for more than three offenses, their merit shall be revoked for three hundred days, and they shall not again occupy the Dharma seat.

The Supreme Master of the Great Ultimate states: All these prohibitions and regulations are ancient statutes from the Mysterious Capital’s Upper Palace, meant to restrain laziness and negligence and to correct transgressions. When establishing a fast, the Four Heavenly Kings and the Perfected Saints of the Celestial Realms personally descend to the fast’s location to witness the rites and circumambulation. They observe one’s conduct and examine one’s sincerity. If faults are found, they command the Four Departments and Five Emperors to report to the Three Officials, who shall investigate and impose punishment accordingly. The Heavenly Worthy, in great compassion, pities the foolishness of the world and does not wish for them to incur guilt through the fast. Thus, the path of penalties and corrections is opened, allowing one to recognize their faults. If one can reform, their sins shall also be dissolved. Those who receive penalties must accept them willingly, listen respectfully, and not conceal their wrongdoing or contend against the divine. In this way, discipline is upheld, misfortunes are averted, past sins are absolved, and future blessings are extended. One must proceed with utmost care, reverent and vigilant day and night.

If one personally serves the Great Sage or attends the sovereign in person, the divine spirits shall respond, and blessings shall gather abundantly. Those who participate in the fast must take heed and be warned.

From the *Lingbao Regulations of the Mysterious Capital*.

Next, the *dujiang* chants, and the *jianzhai* receives the penalty tablet. The *jianzhai* bows three times upon receiving the tablet and rises.

Next, the incense is replenished. The Incense Official, the Left and Right Dragon-Tiger Lords, and the various spirit officials of the incense shall cause the site of the Yellow Register Fast altar to naturally produce golden liquid, cinnabar, and azure mushrooms, where the hundred spirits and perfected beings gather before the incense burner. May the merit of the fast be accomplished, and may both the living and the deceased receive its grace. May the jade maidens and immortal youths of the ten directions guard the incense smoke. May the prayers just offered be transmitted directly to the presence of the Most High, the Limitless Dao, the Perfectly Real Jade Emperor.

Next, the *Hymn to the Empty Cavern of Immortal Learning* is recited, exiting the altar. From the *Scripture of Pacing the Void* and the *Scripture of the Empty Cavern’s Numinous Chapters*.

Next, the Dharma Master exits the door, recites the spell, and waits for the officials to leave the earthen portal. Facing the altar, they recite the secret incantation within the portal.

Next, they pay respects at the curtain before the Mysterious Master. The High Priest offers three pinches of incense and makes a brief report. They acknowledge their faults with three bows. From the *Du Guangcheng Ritual*.

Next, the dedication of merit.

Next, the *dujiang* chants, and the *jianzhai* reports any violations. The *jianzhai* speaks if there are any, remains silent if there are none.

Next, the *dujiang* chants the conclusion of the fast’s proceedings, and the officials return to their positions.

Next, the decorum for welcoming the Master back to the hall, where the fast’s sponsor and disciples offer thanks to the Dharma Master.

Master Du Guangcheng states: Once the fast’s conclusion is announced, the officials, the fast’s sponsor, and the disciples shall offer thanks to the Dharma Master and congratulate one another. The disciples must offer their reverence sincerely and not behave arrogantly or with self-importance. From the establishment of the fast until its dispersal, when the Dharma Master ascends the altar to recite scriptures and circumambulate, they shall don court robes and wear the *yuan* crown. Upon completion of the rites, the officials shall be regarded as the altar’s hosts. Even if the officials bow, the Dharma Master shall not return the gesture. This practice has long been observed on Mount Mao and the Five Peaks. In the regions of Min and Shu, it has not yet been fully implemented. If mutual bows are exchanged, how can the proper decorum be maintained? For now, we shall follow this practice to preserve the regulations. After the altar is dispersed, all may return to normal.

The sixteenth scroll of the *Complete Ritual for the Supreme Yellow Register Great Fast* is concluded.
The seventeenth scroll of the *Complete Ritual for the Supreme Yellow Register Great Fast*.

The Master of the Three Caverns of Supreme Clarity, Li Jingqi, established the regulations; the Master of the Three Caverns, Chongjing, transmitted and preserved them; the Celestial Enforcer of the Most High, Jiang Shuyu, revised them.

**Section Two of the Ritual Codes: Ancient Rite for the Three Times of Circumambulation**

The Dharma Master sits in the hall while disciples perform the nine bows and three prostrations. With incense, flowers, and the *Huaxia* hymn, the Master is escorted from the hall. They proceed to the six curtains, following the rites of the previous evening’s invocation.

The Dharma Master moves to the left and enters the altar through the Earth Gate.

**Incantation for Entering the Gate**

Next, the *Huaxia* hymn is chanted as the Master circumambulates leftward into the altar, ascending through the Heavenly Gate. They offer incense to the ten directions, beginning with the East.

**Incense at the Master’s Table**

Then, the High Priest recites the Five Directions’ *Guardian Spirits Incantations* from the *Wondrous Scripture of the Essential Exegesis of the True Writ*:

**East**
Nine *qi* of the Azure Heavens, great deities of the Radiant Star.
Shining upon the eastern quarter, illuminating the nine gates.
Turning the candle’s yang light, sweeping away filth and miasma.
The Luminous Youth attends my chariot, binding demons and restraining evil.
Reporting above to the Imperial Lord, upholding the true Dao and the vermilion script of jade.
The talismanic command of the Nine Heavens dispatches dragons in swift transmission.
All under heaven is pacified; I attain transcendence and flight.

**South**
Cinnabar Heavens of the South, three *qi* flowing with light.
The Fire Star revolves like a candle, illuminating the Great Yang.
Above dwell the vermilion essences, the Luminous Youths.
Commanding the fire soldiers, guarding the Three Palaces.
Severing evil and binding demons, cutting down malevolent spirits.
As the Northern Emperor decrees, the eight winds of wind and fire surge.
Interlocking bells blaze—who dares disobey?
The true Dao prevails; I receive supreme merit.
Preserving heaven’s eternity, enduring for aeons without end.

**West**
Heavens of the Seven *qi*, essence of Venus flowing bright.
Light gleams at the Golden Gate, illuminating the Great Darkness.
Within dwells the White Sovereign, named the Imperial Spirit.
Preserving and pacifying the divine, guarding my form.
Severing the roots of evil, the Kingly Dao shines clearly.
Palaces are ordered, the Three Luminaries aligned.
The Dao harmonizes with spontaneity; I ascend to the Purple Court.
The talismanic command of the Numinous Treasure universally benefits all beings.
Merit extends to all; heaven and earth are at peace.

**North**
Mysterious Heavens of the North, five *qi* lingering.
The Chronogram Star blazes, illuminating the Great Subtlety.
The Black Spirit, clad in dark feathers, attends the five gates.
Inspecting essences and capturing wrongs, none dare test their might.
The *Huoluo* blades sever and crush; the jade talisman commands.
The Eight Might of the Divine Spirits seals the gates of evil; the true Dao shines forth.
Illuminating my body, the Three Lights unite in splendor.
Spurring the void and riding the floating, my form ascends in transcendence.

**Center**
The Yellow Center governs *qi*, unifying the mysterious and true.
The Star of Stability radiates, its brilliance flowing through the Nine Heavens.
Twelve Luminous Youths open the light, primordial *qi* and yang essence.
Crimson flames ascend; illuminating all under heaven and my body.
A hundred evils are crushed, myriad ghosts slain.
The incantation of the Central Mountain universally prevails.
The Five Spirits are pacified; my body ascends as an immortal.

Next, the Precentor chants while the Dharma Drum is struck twenty-four times.
Then, the High Priest performs the threefold divination with incense and offers the incense prayer.
Finally, the incense burner is kindled.

The Most High Three Heavens’ Mysterious Primordial Three *Qi* Supreme Venerable Lord Lao,
summon forth from within our bodies the Three-and-Five Merit Officers,
Left and Right Palace Envoys,
Left and Right Incense-Bearing Courier Dragon Riders,
Incense-Attending Golden Youths,
Message-Bearing Flower-Scattering Jade Maidens,
and the Five Thearchs’ Direct Talisman and Direct Day Incense Officers—
thirty-six of each—forth they come.
As they emerge, let the local earth gods and true officials of such-and-such a place don their solemn regalia and unseal the precincts.

We now, in this very moment of burning incense,
offer on behalf of such-and-such an official, such-and-such a person,
to directly recommend the deceased kin, so-and-so,
and universally recommend all present, so-and-so and others,
as we conduct the three-day, three-night Great Yellow Register Grand Fast.
On this first day at dawn,
as the midday sun declines and the hour shifts,
we ascend the altar to perform the Dao-circuits.
May we receive the *qi* of life from the Most High’s Ten Directions’ True and Upright Ones,
flowing down into our bodies,
so that what we now petition may swiftly ascend,
directly reaching the presence of the Most High Boundless Dao’s Perfectly True Jade Thearch of the Supreme Emperor.

All officers bow three times.
Next, the Precentor chants while the Dharma Drum is struck twenty-four times again.
The clerks and soldiers proceed with their duties;
all officers kneel in reverence,
knock their teeth twenty-four times,
and dispatch the clerks and soldiers.

We respectfully summon forth from within our bodies the Five Viscera’s True Officials and Merit Officers.
Forth come the Upper Three Heavens’ Enforcing and Transforming Yin-Yang Merit Officers,
the Officers who Measure the Dao and Dissolve Disasters,
the Dispersing Calamity and Resolving Adversity Lords—
twelve of each.
Forth come the officers governing our bodies:
the Great General who Establishes the Standard and Supervises Merit in our Center,
the Vanguard Effecting Merit,
the Rear Guard Effecting Destruction,
the Courier Court Commandant,
the Courier Court Assistant,
and the Four Quarters’ Merit-Supervising Petitioners.

Forth come the Transcendent and Numinous Direct Envoys from within our bodies:
the Orthodox Unity Merit Officers,
the Healing Merit Officers,
the Left and Right Palace Envoys,
the Yin-Yang Divine Decree Clerks,
the Scarlet Talisman Chariot Clerks,
the Vigorous Wind Courier Clerks,
the Memorial-Presenting Courier Clerks,
and the Flying Dragon Riders—
two of each—forth they come,
donning solemn attire,
crowns and sashes with pendent tassels,
composing their majestic bearing.

The Direct Envoy Merit Officers wear the Heaven-Piercing Crowns,
clad in black, holding single-layered robes.
The Orthodox Unity Merit Officers wear the Vermilion Yang Headbands,
crimson single-layered robes.
The Envoys wear the Nine Virtues’ Crowns,
five-colored corded single-layered robes,
tiger-seal waistbands,
and bear jade tablets.

The Direct Envoy Merit Officers stand at the four directions.
The Orthodox Unity Merit Officers stand at the center.
The Healing Merit Officers guard and protect our bodies.
The Left Palace Envoys plant the standard ahead.
The Right Palace Envoys hold the banners behind.
The Yang Divine Decree Clerks stand to the left,
the Yin Divine Decree Clerks to the right.
The Upper Register Merit Officers stand above.
The Middle Register Merit Officers stand within our bodies.
The Urging *Qi* Merit Officers hasten the Ten Directions.
The Upper Register Envoys gaze afar to the heavens above.
The Middle Register Envoys survey the eight directions.
The General Palace Envoys encircle our bodies.

Wolf Clerks and Tiger Warriors,
scouting for treachery and hooking riders,
the General Palace Archers,
Heavenly Couriers and Armored Soldiers,
Heavenly Might Warriors,
*Qi*-Gathering *Qi*-Consuming Clerks,
Spirit-Gathering Spirit-Consuming Clerks,
Ghost-Gathering Ghost-Consuming Clerks,
Essence-Gathering Essence-Consuming Clerks,
Poison-Gathering Poison-Consuming Clerks,
Evil-Gathering Evil-Consuming Clerks,
Talisman-Destroying Shrine-Demolishing Clerks,
Scarlet Talisman Chariot Clerks,
Vigorous Wind Courier Clerks,
Memorial-Presenting Courier Clerks,
and Flying Dragon Riders—
all encamp around us, front and back, left and right.

The Merit Officers and Envoys complete their solemn preparations.
Arrayed in full regalia,
they unseal the Numinous Treasure’s official retinue,
leading the Transcendent Fast-Supervising Lords and various officers.

The Heavenly Master’s twenty-four established administrations below,
thirty-six tranquil hermitages,
seventy-two blessed lands,
three hundred sixty renowned mountains,
the Kunlun and other Upper Palaces’ thirty-six thousand gods,
the sun, moon, and stellar lodges,
the Jade Armillary and Jade Balance,
the Five Thearchs of Heaven and Earth,
the Three Realms’ officials, lords, generals, and clerks,
the Dao’s Two Mysteries,
the Three Origins and Four Beginnings,
the four directions and orientations,
the winds’ *qi* and the infusing *qi*,
the *jiazi* officials and lords,
the Summoning and Interrogating Lords,
the Nine Yi and Hu Elder Lords of the East,
the Eight Man and Yue Elder Lords of the South,
the Six Rong and Di Elder Lords of the West,
the Five Di and Qiang Elder Lords of the North,
the Three *Cang* and Cang Elder Lords of the Center,
the Five Marchmounts, Four Waterways, and Marsh Lords,
the deities of all temples,
the spirits of high mountains and low valleys,
the elders of forests and groves,
the Twelve Stream Maidens,
the root sources and original beginnings,
the lords of the land,
the altars’ and granaries’ generals and clerks—
all don solemn attire at once,
joining the Merit Officers, Envoys, and Flying Dragon Riders from within our bodies,
to ascend and petition the Most High Boundless Dao,
the Most High Dao Lord,
the Most High Venerable Lord Lao,
the Most High Grandmaster,
the Most High Mysterious Elder,
the Ten Directions’ Boundless Dao,
the Virtue and Power Host of Sages and Heavenly Worthies,
the Perfectly True Great Thearchs and Heavenly Emperors,
the Heavenly Master Lords,
the Numinous and True Fast-Supervising Great Dharma Masters,
and all the various lords and officers.

We, born and raised in demonic customs,
sunk in the final age’s toils,
indulging in fleeting pleasures and glory,
bound by karmic causes from past lives.

Suddenly granted deliverance, we have been privileged to serve the Great Dao.
*(Here concludes* The Ritual Code of the Supreme Ultimate Fast.*)*

Overwhelmed by the weight of such grace, joy and awe intertwine within us. On the day we received the Dharma, we pledged to uphold the Mysterious Decree, to manifest our cinnabar sincerity, to spread and flourish the true wind, and to broadly proclaim its benevolent blessings. With compassionate hearts, we cherish all beings and open the path of deliverance for heaven and humanity.

Now, there is a certain official of such-and-such prefecture and such-and-such county, who, on behalf of the departed spirit so-and-so, requests the performance of the Supreme Yellow Register Grand Fast. In strict accordance with the ritual statutes, we present golden dragons and painted silks, incense, flowers, oil, and candles as offerings to attest our cinnabar sincerity and to beseech the fulfillment of our prayers.

We, unworthy as we are in our offices of the Mysterious Bureau, are unequal to what we have witnessed. Reverently, we bathe our five limbs and purify our hearts with right mindfulness. Following the *Divine Immortal Statutes of the Yellow Register Liturgy of the Lower Prime*, we establish the Imperial Altar at such-and-such place to perform the Supreme Yellow Register Grand Fast for three days and three nights, conducting the Dao nine times at the nine hours. Beneath the radiance of the Three Luminaries, we prostrate ourselves before the Ten Poles. We burn incense and light lamps, recite scriptures and invoke the Perfected, to deliver the departed spirit so-and-so—disciple such-and-such—and the ancestral and primal spirits of his lineage, along with all the long-night dead souls of the Nine Dark Realms. We repent sins and seek forgiveness, that they may depart from suffering and ascend to joy. May the profound grace extend to the state and the household, bestowing blessings upon the living. May all sentient beings universally attain the fruit of the Dao.

We reverently invoke the celestial hosts: the celestial armies of the Three Caverns, the terrestrial immortals’ armies, the flying immortals’ armies, the Perfected Ones’ armies, the divine beings’ armies, the armies of the sun, moon, and stars, the armies of the Nine Palaces and Five Emperors, the armies of the Three Rivers and Four Seas, and the armies of the Five Peaks and Four Waterways—each numbering nine hundred million legions. From the Thirty-Two Heavens, we summon the overseers of the fast, the golden youths who attend incense, the jade maidens who scatter flowers, the direct talismans of the Five Emperors, the messengers who transmit words and memorials, the flying dragon riders, and others—thirty-two in all—to descend in full assembly and fill the fast’s precincts. For the fast’s sponsor, so-and-so, we deliver the departed spirit so-and-so, along with the nine generations of ancestors, the destitute souls, and the suffering shades, that they may escape the long night of the Nine Dark Realms, sever the roots of sin, and depart from the Three Paths and Five Sufferings, their bodies entering into light. May they ascend to the heavens, where clothing and sustenance arise naturally. May they turn the wheel of rebirth and enter the gate of blessings and felicity.

The fast’s sponsor, so-and-so, now offers sincerity and devotion, entrusting life to the boundless worlds of the ten directions, to the hosts of great sages who have attained the Dao, to the perfected lords and venerable masters, and to the divine officials of the ten directions. We pray that wishes be fulfilled and the self delivered; that the Three Calamities and Nine Tribulations, the Ten Sorrows and Eight Hardships, be removed from this moment onward, all emerging from the multitude of evils recorded in the Yellow Register scriptures. May the state be secured and the household pacified, and may all sentient beings universally benefit.

When the Dao rituals are complete, those who have rendered meritorious service shall be reported back to the celestial bureaus. The functionaries and messengers, the flying dragon riders, shall separately file and transmit the records in due time, and upon the conclusion of the memorials, each shall return to reside within us, restoring themselves to their palaces. When summoned again, they shall arrive as before, in accordance with precedent.

Three rolls of the dharma drum are sounded, and the saliva is swallowed three times.

On the first day of the fast, the divine officials are sent forth at dawn. The same does not apply thereafter.

Daoists who have not received the Lingbao scriptures, who have not received the Registers of the Covenant of Uniting the Powers, may not dispatch divine officials to conduct the fast.

The dispatch of divine officials follows the regulations of the Three Caverns, where the registers and ranks differ, and the Perfected Officials vary accordingly. Each shall dispatch the immortal officers and soldiers corresponding to the registers they have received.

For the establishment of a Lingbao fast, the officials of the Covenant of Uniting the Powers and the governors of the central bureaus are dispatched. Thus, the regulations state that those who have received the Registers of the Covenant of Uniting the Powers may only be designated as officiants of the fast. This is because for an Upper Clarity fast, the five divine officials of the Covenant of the Lingbao Cavern Mystery are dispatched.

The Dao’s evolution begins with the Orthodox Unity, unfolds through the Cavern Spirit, permeates the Numinous Treasure, and culminates in the Upper Clarity. The Upper Clarity conceals its radiance and veils its light, refining the spirit to ascend the Dao. Its aspiration is to rise lightly, entirely untouched by the mundane. The Cavern Spirit commands and employs divine spirits, subduing demons and pestilence, yet in matters of deliverance, it is no longer concerned. The Yang Light expounds the Dao and virtue in their natural state, investigating the true nature of the profound mystery. With a tranquil mind, one cultivates and refines, aligning with the Dao. To cultivate the self and preserve life, to deliver heaven and humanity—nothing surpasses the Lingbao fast.

Those who receive the Dao must first receive the Three and Five Registers of the Covenant of Uniting the Powers. Only after gradual cultivation may they advance to receive the Middle Covenant of the Lingbao and the various registers of the Upper Clarity Great Cavern. Otherwise, it is an overstepping and usurpation, violating the standards of the Supreme Perfected. Yet today’s Daoist clergy fail to comprehend this. The Most High, in compassion, expounded the teachings, but they are wholly preoccupied with profit. The covenants of the Upper Clarity and Lingbao, the weight of the golden pledges—these are not to be trifled with. Yet some rely on a single register’s text received at a lineage altar, calling themselves disciples of such-and-such register and officiating fasts. Others, having received only the Registers of the Covenant of Ascending the Mystery, presume to dispatch the divine officials of the Lingbao fast. In distant regions and remote commanderies, this has become customary. Not only does this violate the celestial statutes, but it is also a gross deception of heaven.

The *Yi of Du Guangcheng* states: “Otherwise, the ten precepts, the white-slip Daoists, may not be appointed to office or ascend the altar. Those who usurp titles beyond their station shall incur karmic retribution in the unseen realm.” The sponsors of fasts shall not escape liability—how can they not be warned? Those who conduct fasts must painstakingly reform this.

Next, the lecturers and cantors each announce their dharma ranks:

[Dharma ranks] reverently conduct the Supreme Yellow Register Grand Fast. We, your subjects so-and-so and others, with sincere devotion, humbly memorialize the Boundless and Spontaneous Primordial Heavenly Venerable of the Limitless Dao, the Supreme Lord of the Limitless Dao, the Most High Lord Lao, the August Jade Emperor, the hosts of great sages who have attained the Dao in the ten directions, the perfected lords and venerable masters, the thirty-two Heavenly Emperors, the Jade Clarity Sovereign, the Great Emperor of Jade, the Eastern Florescence, Southern Culmen, Western Numinosity, Northern Perfection, the Seven-Treasured Mystic Terrace of the Purple Tenuity Upper Palace in the Jade Capital of the Mystic Metropolis, the Radiant August Lord of the Dao of the Numinous Treasure, the thirty-six divisions of the revered scriptures, the Great Dharma Masters of the Mystic Cavern, and all the divine officials of the three realms.

We, your subjects, by karmic affinity from past lives, were born in this great transformation. The Mystic Perfected initiated our deliverance, enabling us to enter the root of faith. Through the Three Masters, we received the covenant and the divine scriptures of the Three Treasures. The dharma accords with the deliverance of humanity—ninety-nine thousand nine hundred. Though we have attained the rank of the Perfected, our merit is slight and our virtue small, and we have not yet attained immortality. We dedicate our lives and bodies to assist the state and establish merit.

All the above follows the *Lingbao Jade Casket’s Regulations on Illuminating the Perfected*, and all matters of submission and memorialization are duly observed. Now, in accordance with the edict, we dare not withhold this from the celestial hearing.

Next, the proclamation is read:

In accordance with the words of the proclamation, with utmost sincerity and earnestness, we pray to rely on the great Dao to deliver the living and the dead. The fast’s sponsor, so-and-so, respectfully considers the departed spirit so-and-so, the nine generations of ancestors, and all destitute souls. In their lifetimes, their sins and transgressions were beyond reckoning. Upon death, they entered hell, forever without release.

We have heard that the Supreme Yellow Register Grand Fast surpasses all methods in merit and bestows boundless grace. Reverently following the mystic regulations, we offer golden dragon-patterned silks, the pledges of our destined lives, along with incense, flowers, oil, and candles, to manifest our sincere devotion. We beseech the deliverance of the nine generations of ancestors from the suffering of the long night. We pray for the profound protection that universally blesses the unseen and the manifest.

We, your subjects, reverently purify our thoughts and settle our spirits, concentrating our minds in silent contemplation.

Following the sacred protocols of the *Huanglu* Simplified Writs and the Ritual Codes of Transcendent Immortals, we establish the deliverance rites and arrange the numinous altar. The four quarters and eight directions mirror heaven and emulate earth. We erect the fast, perform the Dao, burn incense, and light lamps. Through repentance, we atone for the sins of the living and the dead across three generations. We dedicate this to the departed soul of so-and-so and to the myriad ancestors of the fast’s sponsor—bound spirits and those who died in confinement—opening for them the radiance of deliverance, releasing them from suffering. May they be freed from evil destinies and turn toward the root of faith.

Now we burn incense, taking refuge in the Venerable Masters, the Great Sages, and the assembly of perfected virtue, who after attaining the Dao ascended into formlessness, harmonizing with the true Dao.

The master and disciples turn left, thrice offering incense to the ten directions, then return to face east while the master intones:
We now, on behalf of the fast’s sponsor so-and-so, deliver the departed soul of so-and-so and the nine generations of ancestors—those confined in the Nine Dark Prisons of the Jade Vaults, the long-night abodes, the malevolent adversaries of the dead, and the karmic roots of past transgressions. Through the power of merit, we establish the fast, burn incense, and invoke the ten directions. May the departed so-and-so and the nine generations of ancestors of so-and-so’s family—those long-dead souls—be lifted from the darkness of suffering and ascend to the celestial halls.

Now we burn incense, surrendering body, spirit, and life to the Great Dao. We prostrate ourselves, taking refuge in the Three Supreme Ones. May this merit flow to the departed soul of so-and-so and the nine generations of ancestors of so-and-so’s family, all the dead souls. May they be spared the ten sufferings and eight adversities of the long night, behold the light, ascend to the celestial halls, and dwell in effortless abundance.

Now we burn incense, taking refuge in the Venerable Masters, the Great Sages, and the assembly of perfected virtue, who after attaining the Dao ascended into formlessness, harmonizing with the true Dao.

The master and disciples turn left, thrice offering incense to the ten directions, as before.

The Dharma Master intones:
We now, on behalf of the fast’s sponsor so-and-so, deliver the departed soul of so-and-so and the nine generations of ancestors—those confined in the Nine Dark Prisons of the Jade Vaults, the long-night abodes, the malevolent adversaries of the dead, and the karmic roots of past transgressions. Through the power of merit, we establish the fast, burn incense, and invoke the ten directions. May the departed so-and-so and the nine generations of ancestors of so-and-so’s family—those long-dead souls—be lifted from the darkness of suffering and ascend to the celestial halls. We extend this universally to the Emperor and lords of the realm, their ministers and officials, those who receive the Daoist teachings, parents and revered kin, fellow disciples, and all who dwell in mountain forests pursuing the true Dao. May each attain the true Dao, surrendering body, spirit, and life to the Great Dao.

We prostrate ourselves, taking refuge in the Three Supreme Ones. May this merit flow to the Emperor and lords of the realm, their ministers and officials, those who receive the Daoist teachings, parents and revered kin, fellow disciples, and all who dwell in mountain forests pursuing the true Dao. May each attain the true Dao and dwell in effortless tranquility.

Now we burn incense, taking refuge in the Venerable Masters, the Great Sages, and the assembly of perfected virtue, who after attaining the Dao ascended into formlessness, harmonizing with the true Dao.

The master and disciples turn left, thrice offering incense to the ten directions, as before.

The Dharma Master intones:
We now, on behalf of the fast’s sponsor so-and-so, deliver the departed soul of so-and-so and the nine generations of ancestors—those confined in the Nine Dark Prisons of the Jade Vaults, the long-night abodes, the malevolent adversaries of the dead, and the karmic roots of past transgressions. Through the power of merit, we establish the fast, burn incense, and invoke the ten directions. May the departed so-and-so and the lineage of so-and-so’s family, the nine clans and affinal kin, officials and people of the realm, fellow disciples and companions, all people under heaven, the flying and crawling, the creeping and resting, those already born and yet unborn—all beings—surrender body, spirit, and life to the Great Dao.

We prostrate ourselves, taking refuge in the Three Supreme Ones. May this merit flow to the disciple so-and-so, granting them immortal deliverance, their body entering effortlessness and harmonizing with the four great elements. May all people under heaven, the flying and crawling, those already born and yet unborn—all beings—be spared the ten sufferings and eight adversities, the five poisons and waters of fire, the ten calamities and myriad harms, the qi of bandits, epidemics, and ghosts, and the afflictions of punishment.

Now we burn incense, taking refuge in the Venerable Masters, the Great Sages, and the assembly of perfected virtue, who after attaining the Dao ascended into formlessness, harmonizing with the true Dao.

The above is drawn from the *Huanglu* Simplified Writs. The phrase “harmonizing with the true Dao” appears four times, all following the original text.

For the *Zhang Qingdu* rites, when offering incense thrice, one need not circumambulate. An attendant may hold the censer and proceed left, or the attendant may guide the fast’s sponsor to offer incense in each direction, which is more fitting. Generally, in performing the Dao, one must not occupy too much time. Excessive labor leads to slackness in ritual deportment, which in turn nullifies the merit.

The Supreme Lord transmitted the fast’s methods for those who study the Dao, seeking to repent sins and attain immortality, enabling mutual deliverance. Thus, in the fast’s rites of offering incense and reciting vows, after invoking the Emperor and lords of the realm, one must invoke the Three Masters, those who transmit the Daoist teachings, and fellow disciples. The *Huanglu* Simplified Writs’ standard protocols explicitly state, “We now act for the fellow practitioner so-and-so,” making this clear. Later generations have applied these rites to others, and while some wording may be slightly adjusted, the three offerings of incense and the invocations for the Emperor, masters, and fellow disciples must remain unchanged in all scriptures.

Next, the *Dujang* chants the repentance to the twenty directions:

**East**
We, the assembly, with utmost sincerity take refuge in the Eastern Infinite Supreme Numinous Treasure Heavenly Worthy, the Nine Qi Heavenly Lords, and the divine officials of the Eastern Realm. Each reverently repents.

Kneeling in repentance:
We now burn incense, surrendering body, spirit, and life. Solemnly, on behalf of the sponsor of the *Huanglu* Grand Fast, so-and-so, we contemplate the departed soul of so-and-so and the nine generations of ancestors, all the dead souls. In their lifetimes, they committed grievous evils...

Their sins bind them to the Nine Dark Hells of the Eternal Night, where souls endure the lash and every torment is fully inflicted. Their forms are broken and emaciated, their suffering unbearable. They sink into ten thousand kalpas, forever without release. Now, in accordance with the *Alliance of Perfected Jade Casket*, the *Upper Palace of the Lady of Qing*, and the *Rites of Salvation and Deliverance*, we present ninety feet of azure silk and one golden dragon of nine feet. We take refuge in the Eastern Infinite Supreme Numinous Treasure Heavenly Worthy, the Nine Qi Heavenly Lords, and the divine officials of the Eastern Realm. We redeem the sins of the departed so-and-so and the karmic records of the sponsor so-and-so’s household, liberating the destitute souls to enter the light. Ascending to Heaven, their clothing and sustenance shall be naturally provided. May they swiftly attain rebirth through the Gate of Blessings, and may so-and-so’s body attain the Perfected Dao, harmonizing with the spirits as one.

**Southeast**
We, the assembly, with utmost sincerity take refuge in the Southeastern Infinite Supreme Numinous Treasure Heavenly Worthy, the Brahma Qi Heavenly Lords, and the divine officials of the Southeastern Realm. Each reverently repents.

Kneeling in repentance:
We now burn incense, surrendering body, spirit, and life. Solemnly, on behalf of the sponsor of the *Huanglu* Grand Fast, so-and-so, we contemplate the departed soul of so-and-so and the nine generations of ancestors, all the dead souls. In their lifetimes, they committed grievous evils. Their sins bind them to the Nine Dark Hells of the Eternal Night, where souls endure the lash and every torment is fully inflicted. Their forms are broken and emaciated, their suffering unbearable. They sink into ten thousand kalpas, forever without release.

Now, in accordance with the *Alliance of Perfected Jade Casket*, the *Central Palace of Lady Green*, and the *Rites of Salvation and Deliverance*, we present one hundred twenty feet of yellow-patterned silk—twelve feet thereof—and a golden dragon, taking refuge in the Southeastern Infinite Supreme Numinous Treasure Heavenly Worthy, the Brahma Qi Heavenly Lords, and the divine officials of the Southeastern Realm. We redeem the departed soul of so-and-so and the nine generations of ancestors of the sponsor of the *Huanglu* Grand Fast, all the dead souls, their karmic adversaries and sinful roots, from the reckonings of the Three Realms.

The Central Palace of Lady Green shall erase their names from the ledgers of sin, deliver the destitute souls, and guide them into radiant light. Ascending to the Heavenly Paradise, they shall be clothed and fed by nature itself, swiftly attaining the gate of rebirth and blessed fortune. May their mortal forms attain the perfection of the Dao, harmonizing with the spirits in unity.

Next, the Southern Realm:
We, the assembly, with utmost sincerity take refuge in the Southern Infinite Supreme Numinous Treasure Heavenly Worthy, the Three Qi Heavenly Lords, and the divine officials of the Southern Realm. Each reverently repents.

We now burn incense, surrendering body, spirit, and life. Now, in accordance with the *Alliance of Perfected Jade Casket*, the *Palace of the Female Azure Yang*, and the *Rites of Deliverance*, we present thirty feet of crimson-patterned silk, three feet of silk, and one golden dragon, taking refuge in the Southern Infinite Supreme Numinous Treasure Heavenly Worthy, the Three Qi Heavenly Lords, and the divine officials of the Southern Realm. We redeem the departed soul of so-and-so and the nine generations of ancestors of the *Huanglu* Grand Fast’s sponsor, so-and-so, along with all the dead souls—eradicating their karmic adversaries and the roots of their sins, dissolving the accounts recorded by the Three Realms’ administrators.

At the *Palace of the Female Azure Yang*, their names are stricken from the ledgers of transgression. The destitute souls are delivered, their bodies entering radiant light. They ascend to the Heavenly Paradise, where clothing and sustenance arise naturally, and swiftly attain the gate of rebirth’s blessed fortune. May so-and-so’s person attain the perfection of the Dao.

We, the assembly, harmonize and unite with the Dao.

Next, the Southwestern Realm:
We, the assembly, with utmost sincerity take refuge in the Southwestern Infinite Supreme Numinous Treasure Heavenly Worthy, the Pure Qi Heavenly Lord, and the divine officials of the Southwestern Realm. Each reverently repents.

May the Right Bureau of the Lady of Qing’s Lower Palace expunge their names from the registers of sin, open the path to deliver the destitute souls, and guide their forms into radiant light. May they ascend to the Heavenly Paradise, where clothing and sustenance arise naturally, and swiftly enter the gate of rebirth and blessed fortune. May so-and-so’s person attain the perfection of the Dao.

In harmony, the spirits unite as one.

In their lifetimes, they committed grievous evils. Their sins bind them to the Nine Dark Hells of the Eternal Night, where souls endure the lash and every torment is fully inflicted. Their forms are broken and emaciated, their suffering unbearable. They sink into ten thousand kalpas, forever without release.

Now, in accordance with the *Alliance of Perfected Ones and Jade Treasury*, the Four Offices of the Lower Palace of Lady Qing, and the *Ritual for Deliverance Without Official Titles*, we present three hundred and twenty feet of yellow-patterned silk, thirty-two feet of the same, and one golden dragon. We surrender body, spirit, and life to the Lower Realm’s *Most High Numinous Treasure Heavenly Worthy*, the Five Emperors of the Nine Lands and Four Offices, the Twelve Immortal Lords, the Perfected Ones of the Nine Palaces, the divine immortals and jade maidens, and all the divine officials of the Infinite World. We beseech the deliverance and redemption of the departed soul of so-and-so and the nine generations of ancestors of the sponsor of the *Huanglu* Grand Fast, so-and-so, along with all the dead souls. May their evil karmic roots and transgressions, recorded by the Three Realms’ Offices of Account, be erased by the Four Offices of the Lower Palace of Lady Qing and their enforcers. May the imprisoned souls be liberated, their forms entering radiance, ascending to the Heavenly Paradise where clothing and sustenance arise naturally. May so-and-so attain the Perfection of the Dao, harmonizing with the divine in shared luminosity.

The next day, facing the northeast, we chant the rites:
We, the assembled, wholeheartedly surrender body, spirit, and life to the *Most Perfected and Greatly Sage Solar Lord and Lady*, the *Flame Radiance Youth*, the divine immortals within the sun, and all the solar divine officials. Each reverently repents.

Kneeling in repentance:
We now surrender body, spirit, and life, solemnly on behalf of the sponsor of the *Huanglu* Grand Fast, so-and-so. We contemplate the departed soul of so-and-so and the nine generations of ancestors, all the dead souls, extending to so-and-so’s own person—all the transgressions committed in life, sins too numerous to recount. The dead souls, bound by karmic retribution, drift through the Eternal Night. In the Nine Dark Hells, they endure the lash, every torment fully inflicted. Their forms are broken and emaciated, their suffering unbearable. They sink into ten thousand kalpas, forever without release. We now burn incense and surrender body, spirit, and life to the *Solar Lord and Lady*, the *Flame Radiance Youth*, the *Vermilion Cloud Jade Maidens*, and the divine immortals within the sun. We beg for absolution of all transgressions, sins that offend the celestial radiance and bind them to the cycle of life and death. May the departed soul of so-and-so and the nine generations of ancestors, the imprisoned dead souls, be delivered into light. May they ascend to the Heavenly Paradise where clothing and sustenance arise naturally. May so-and-so attain the Perfection of the Dao, harmonizing with the Solar Lord in shared luminosity.

We, the assembled, wholeheartedly surrender body, spirit, and life to the *Most Perfected and Greatly Sage Lunar Lord and Lady*, the *Round Radiance Jade Maidens*, the divine immortals within the moon, and all the lunar divine officials. Each reverently repents.

We now surrender body, spirit, and life, solemnly on behalf of the sponsor of the *Huanglu* Grand Fast, so-and-so. We now burn incense and surrender body, spirit, and life to the *Lunar Lord and Lady*, the *Round Radiance Jade Maidens*, and the divine immortals within the moon. Each reverently repents.

We now surrender body, spirit, and life, solemnly on behalf of the sponsor of the *Huanglu* Grand Fast, so-and-so. Their forms are broken and emaciated, their suffering unbearable. They sink into ten thousand kalpas, forever without release. We now burn incense and surrender body, spirit, and life to the *Celestial Constellations*, the *Jade Armillary Sphere*, the great deities of the three hundred and sixty-five degrees of the celestial circuit, the *Ladies of the Stars*, and the stellar divine officials. Facing the east, we chant the rites to Mount Tai of the Eastern Marchmount:
We, the assembled, wholeheartedly surrender body, spirit, and life to the *Azure Emperor Perfected Lord of Mount Tai*, the *Flying Immortals*, the divine immortals of the famous mountains and grotto-heavens, and all the divine officials. Each reverently repents.

Kneeling in repentance:
We now surrender body, spirit, and life, solemnly on behalf of the sponsor of the *Huanglu* Grand Fast, so-and-so. We contemplate the departed soul of so-and-so and the nine generations of ancestors, all the dead souls—all the grievous evils and heinous transgressions committed in life, offenses against the divine immortals of Mount Tai and the Eastern Marchmount. Their sins bind them to the Nine Dark Hells, exiled to serve in the Eastern Marchmount. Imprisoned in the hells beneath Mount Tai, they endure the lash, every torment fully inflicted. Their forms are broken and emaciated, their suffering unbearable. They sink into ten thousand kalpas, forever without release. We now burn incense and surrender body, spirit, and life to the *Azure Emperor Perfected Lord of Mount Tai*, the *Flying Immortals*, and the divine immortals of the famous mountains and grotto-heavens. We beg for absolution of all transgressions, sins that offend the fundamental evils recorded by the Eastern Marchmount. May the imprisoned souls be released, their forms emerging into light. May they ascend to the Heavenly Paradise where clothing and sustenance arise naturally. May so-and-so attain the Perfection of the Dao, harmonizing with the Azure Emperor in shared Perfection.

Facing the south, we chant the rites to Mount Heng of the Southern Marchmount:
We, the assembled, wholeheartedly surrender body, spirit, and life to the *Vermilion Emperor Perfected Lord of Mount Heng*, the *Flying Immortals*, the divine immortals of the famous mountains and grotto-heavens, and all the divine officials. Each reverently repents.

Kneeling in repentance:
We now surrender body, spirit, and life, solemnly on behalf of the sponsor of the *Huanglu* Grand Fast, so-and-so. We contemplate the departed soul of so-and-so and the nine generations of ancestors, all the dead souls—all the grievous evils and heinous transgressions committed in life, offenses against the divine immortals of Mount Heng and the Southern Marchmount.

Sins bound in the Nine Dark Realms, exiled to toil in the Southern Marchmount. Imprisoned deep within the hells of Mount Heng, the soul endures flogging and torment, every agony fully inflicted. Eternally sunk through ten thousand kalpas, forever without release. Now we burn incense and surrender body, spirit, and life to the *Vermilion Emperor Perfected Lord of Mount Heng*, the *Flying Immortals*, the divine immortals of the famous mountains and grotto-heavens, and all the divine officials. We beseech your forgiveness and pardon for the transgressions committed, the grievous evils that have offended the Southern Marchmount. Release the imprisoned souls, that they may emerge into radiant light. Ascend to Heaven, where clothing and sustenance come naturally, and the self attains the Perfection of the Dao. Harmonizing with the Vermilion Emperor in shared Perfection.

We, the assembled, wholeheartedly surrender body, spirit, and life to the *White Emperor Perfected Lord of Mount Hua*, the *Flying Immortals*, the divine immortals of the famous mountains and grotto-heavens, and all the divine officials. Each reverently repents.

Kneeling in repentance:
We now surrender body, spirit, and life, solemnly on behalf of the sponsor of the *Huanglu* Grand Fast, so-and-so. Eternally sunk through ten thousand kalpas, forever without release. Now we burn incense and surrender body, spirit, and life to the *White Emperor Perfected Lord of Mount Hua*, the *Flying Immortals*, the divine immortals of the famous mountains and grotto-heavens, and all the divine officials. Harmonizing with the White Emperor in shared Perfection.

We, the assembled, wholeheartedly surrender body, spirit, and life to the *Yellow Emperor Perfected Lord of Mount Song*, the *Flying Immortals*, the divine immortals of the famous mountains and grotto-heavens, and all the divine officials. Each reverently repents.

Kneeling in repentance:
We now surrender body, spirit, and life, solemnly on behalf of the sponsor of the *Huanglu* Grand Fast, so-and-so. We contemplate the departed soul of so-and-so and the nine generations of ancestors, all the dead souls—all the grievous evils and heinous transgressions committed in life, offenses against the divine immortals of Mount Song and the Central Marchmount. Facing the north, we chant the rites to the Water Officials:
We, the assembled, wholeheartedly surrender body, spirit, and life to the *Great Emperor of Fusang*, the *Divine King of Yang Valley*, the *Water Emperors of the Three Rivers, Four Seas, and Nine Jiang*, the *Divine Immortals of the Twelve River Sources and Water Palaces*, and all the divine officials. Each reverently repents.

Kneeling in repentance:
We now surrender body, spirit, and life, solemnly on behalf of the sponsor of the *Huanglu* Grand Fast, so-and-so. We contemplate the departed soul of so-and-so and the nine generations of ancestors, all the dead souls—all the grievous evils and heinous transgressions committed in life, offenses against the *Water Emperors of the Three Rivers, Four Seas, and Nine Jiang*, the *River Lords of the Twelve Sources, Huai, Ji, He, and their officials*, and all the divine officials of the Water Palaces. Sins bound in the Nine Dark Realms, exiled to toil under the Water Officials. Blocked in the long-flowing sources, imprisoned in the cold night, the soul endures suffering and torment, fully immersed in filth and agony. Eternally sunk through ten thousand kalpas, forever without release. Now we burn incense and surrender body, spirit, and life to the *Great Emperor of Fusang*, the *Divine King of Yang Valley*, the *Great Spirits of the Deep Sources and Abysses*, the *Water Emperors of the Three Rivers, Four Seas, and Nine Jiang*, the *River Lords of the Twelve Sources, Huai, Ji, He, and their officials*, and all the divine officials of the Water Palaces. We beseech your forgiveness and pardon for the transgressions committed, the grievous evils that have offended the Water Officials. Release the imprisoned souls, that they may escape the cold realms and the punishments of the long rivers. Erase their names from the records of sin, that they may enter into radiant light. Ascend to Heaven, where clothing and sustenance come naturally, and the self attains the Perfection of the Dao. Harmonizing with the Water Officials in shared Perfection.

Facing the north, we chant the rites to the Sacred Scriptures:
We, the assembled, wholeheartedly surrender body, spirit, and life to the *Thirty-Six Divisions of the Most Supreme and Perfect Sacred Scriptures*, the *True Writings and Treasure Talismans*, the *Natural Celestial Books*, the *Most Numinous Writings*, the *Divine Immortals Attending the Three Caverns*, and all the divine officials. Each reverently repents.

Kneeling in repentance:
We now surrender body, spirit, and life, solemnly on behalf of the sponsor of the *Huanglu* Grand Fast, so-and-so. We contemplate the departed soul of so-and-so and the nine generations of ancestors, all the dead souls—the karmic transgressions of past and present lives, the thoughts and intentions of the heart, the accumulated habits of manifold evils.

Body and speech mutually sustain each other, and with every action sin arises.
At the sight of forms and the hearing of sounds, defilements and delusions multiply.
Treading through suffering or encountering joy, confusion and obstacles ever arise.
We have violated the *Three Primes’* *One Hundred Eighty Precepts*, the *Twelve Thousand Rules of Dignity*, the *One Thousand Two Hundred Precepts of Conduct*—even those transgressions unrecorded in the ritual codes, unforgivable by law and decree.
Through kalpas unending, these sins have accumulated, compounding over vast eons.
What came before remains unrepented, and later offenses are heaped upon them.
Some were committed knowingly, others in error or unawares;
some were unintended, others forced upon us by others.
The retribution of sin and the bonds of evil entangle one another,
bringing birth after death, with sorrows and hardships endless and far-reaching.
The spirit sinks into the depths, bound forever without release.

Now, therefore, we burn incense and surrender body, spirit, and life to the *Thirty-Six Divisions of the Most Supreme and Perfect Sacred Scriptures*, the *Treasure Talismans and Jade Chapters*, the *Jade Lads and Jade Maidens*.
We beseech forgiveness and absolution for all offenses committed in life and death,
that through merit and power, the nine generations of sinful souls may be delivered,
freed from the *Three Wretched Realms* and the *Five Sufferings*—
from the *Mountains of Swords* and *Forests of Blades*, from the *Long Rivers* and *Frigid Courts*.
May their souls emerge from the dark night and enter into the light,
ascend to the heavens above, where clothing and sustenance come naturally,
and the self of so-and-so attains the perfection of the Dao.
Harmonized, they unite with the scriptures.

The *Twenty Directions’ Confession Texts*, from the East to the *Water Official*, are all drawn from the *Huanglu* *Simplified Scripture*. The *Thanksgiving to the Three Treasures and Sacred Scriptures’ Confession Text* is the *Great Thanksgiving Confession*. Since the ritual codes lack a *Great Thanksgiving*, Master Lu’s *Three Primes Fast* concludes the *Twenty Directions’ Confessions* and then returns the incense burner. The confession text giving thanks to the sacred scriptures is thus made the *Great Thanksgiving*. This practice began with Master Lu, who, following the *Taiyi* *Ritual of Solemn Dignity Scripture*, compiled the *Complete Rites for the Daoist’s Self-Cultivation and Alliance with the Perfected Fast*, and thereafter it became customary. The *Scripture and Treasure Confession Texts* must not be abandoned.

Now, following the *Zhang Qingdu Rites*, after the *Burning of Incense and Surrender of Body, Spirit, and Life*, we return to the original text of the *Huanglu* *Simplified Scripture*. The tradition of *Master Chongjing* and *Li Jingqi’s* ritual codes used only the *Ten Directions’ Great Thanksgiving Text* from the *Lingbao Natural Fast*, as found in the *Essential Exegesis of the True Writings*. This is now replaced with the *Twenty Directions’ Confession Texts* from the *Huanglu* *Simplified Scripture*. According to the original ritual code, for each direction honored, one bows and strikes the breast according to the number of that direction—such as ninety for the East, three hundred twenty for the Upper Realm, thirty for the Palace of the Sun, seventy for the Palace of the Moon, and one hundred twenty for the Water Palace.

Now, in conducting the grand fast, the rites vary, and with limited energy, full observance is difficult. The *Alliance with the Perfected in the Jade Casket*, the *Upper Palace of the Lady of Qing*, and the *Deliverance Ritual Codes* refer to the secret *Jade Casket* and the *Alliance with the Perfected Deliverance Rituals* hidden within the *Nine Dark Prisons of the Long Night*. When *Qu Gongxun* compiled the *Huanglu Offering Rites*, he listed *Alliance with the Perfected in the Jade Casket* first, stating that it was for swearing alliance with the Supreme Perfected and should be performed accordingly. The sealing of the *Jade Casket* signifies its secrecy—something he had never witnessed. The *Lingbao Scripture of the Jade Casket Alliance with the Perfected Ritual* has lost its original intent.

When conducting the fast and ascending the altar, if one encounters wind and rain, urgent emergencies, extreme heat or cold, violent thunderstorms, fierce winds, or darkening skies—any extraordinary events—after offering incense thrice, the assembled officials stand upright in their positions and use this *Ten Directions’, Five Peaks’, and Three Luminaries’ General Confession Text*. The *Water Official’s Scripture and Treasure* ritual code is not to be used except in unavoidable circumstances; otherwise, one risks violating the ritual prohibitions. Following the original rites for the Ten Directions, after completing the confessions for each, a general confession and thanksgiving is especially excellent.

We, the assembled, wholeheartedly surrender body, spirit, and life to the *Ten Directions’ Boundless Most Supreme Numinous Treasure Heavenly Worthy*, the *Ten Ultimate Heavenly Lords*, and the *Ten Realms’ Divine Immortals and All Divine Officials*. Each reverently repents.

Kneeling in repentance:
We now burn incense and surrender body, spirit, and life on behalf of the sponsor of the *Huanglu* Grand Fast, so-and-so. We contemplate the departed soul of so-and-so and the nine generations of ancestors, all the dead souls—during their lifetimes, they committed the most grievous evils.
Their sins bind them in the *Nine Dark Prisons of the Long Night*, where their souls endure flogging and every torment.
Their forms are broken and emaciated, suffering unbearable pain.
They sink into endless kalpas, forever without release.

Now, in accordance with the *Alliance of Perfected Jade Casket* and the *Upper Palace of Lady Qing*, we present the ritual offerings for deliverance: one hundred thirty-six feet of patterned silk from the Ten Directions, and ten golden dragons. We reverently surrender body, spirit, and life to the *Ten Directions’ Boundless Most Supreme Numinous Treasure Heavenly Worthy*, the *Ten Ultimate Heavenly Lords*, and the *Ten Realms’ Divine Immortals and All Divine Officials*. We redeem and deliver the departed soul of so-and-so, the nine generations of ancestors of the sponsor of this *Huanglu* Grand Fast, and all the dead souls—eradicating their karmic roots of evil and transgressions recorded by the Three Realms’ reckoning officials.

May the *Upper Palace of Lady Qing* expunge their names from the ledgers of sin, liberate these destitute souls, and guide them into radiant light. May they ascend to the Heavenly Paradise, where clothing and sustenance arise naturally, and swiftly attain the gate of rebirth and blessed fortune. May so-and-so’s person attain the Perfected Dao, harmonizing and uniting with the divine.

**Three Luminaries**
We, the assembled, wholeheartedly surrender body, spirit, and life to the *Most Perfect and Great Sage of the Palaces of the Sun, Moon, and Stars*, the *Divine Immortals of the Three Luminaries*, and all divine officials. Each reverently repents.

Kneeling in repentance:
We now surrender body, spirit, and life on behalf of the sponsor of the *Huanglu* Grand Fast, so-and-so. We contemplate the departed soul of so-and-so, the nine generations of ancestors, all the dead souls, and even so-and-so’s own person—during their lifetimes, they committed sins beyond enumeration. The karmic retribution of the dead souls drags them through the endless night. In the *Nine Dark Prisons*, their souls endure flogging and every torment. Their forms are broken and emaciated, suffering unbearable pain. They sink into endless kalpas, forever without release.

We now burn incense and surrender body, spirit, and life to the *Most Perfect and Great Sage of the Palaces of the Sun, Moon, and Stars*, the *Divine Immortals of the Three Luminaries*, and all divine officials. We beseech your original forgiveness for the sins they committed, which offend the celestial radiance and bind them in the karmic retribution of life and death. Deliver the departed soul of so-and-so, the nine generations of ancestors of the sponsor, and all imprisoned dead souls—open the way to radiant light. May they ascend to the Heavenly Paradise, where clothing and sustenance arise naturally, and may so-and-so’s person attain the Perfected Dao, harmonizing and uniting with the divine.

**Five Peaks**
We, the assembled, wholeheartedly surrender body, spirit, and life to the *Perfected Lords of the Five Peaks*, the *Flying Immortals*, the *Divine Immortals of the Famous Mountains and Grotto-Heavens*, and all divine officials. Each reverently repents.

Kneeling in repentance:
We now surrender body, spirit, and life on behalf of the sponsor of the *Huanglu* Grand Fast, so-and-so. We contemplate the departed soul of so-and-so, the nine generations of ancestors, and all the dead souls—during their lifetimes, they committed the most grievous evils and heinous transgressions, offending the *Divine Immortals of the Five Peaks* and all divine officials. Their sins bind them in the *Nine Dark Prisons*, where they are exiled to toil in the hells of the Five Peaks. Their souls endure flogging and every torment. Their forms are broken and emaciated, suffering unbearable pain. They sink into endless kalpas, forever without release.

We now burn incense and surrender body, spirit, and life to the *Perfected Lords of the Five Peaks*, the *Flying Immortals*, the *Divine Immortals of the Famous Mountains and Grotto-Heavens*, and all divine officials. We beseech your original forgiveness for the sins they committed, which offend the fundamental evils recorded by the Five Peaks. Release these imprisoned souls, guiding them into radiant light. May they ascend to the Heavenly Paradise, where clothing and sustenance arise naturally, and may so-and-so’s person attain the Perfected Dao, harmonizing and uniting with the divine.

**Water Officials** follow the original statutes.
**Scriptural Treasures** follow the original statutes.

Next, the *Dujang* chants, and each participant visualizes the nine-colored circular image, swallowing saliva to command the demons as recorded in the *Hidden Commentary on the Jade Scripture*. Then, the *Dujang* chants the esoteric incantation to summon the *Five Talisman Beings of Birds and Humans*.

First, strike the teeth three times and swallow saliva three times, visualizing the sun and moon before one’s face, entering the *Cavern Chamber’s Golden Flower Palace* through the nostrils. One inch inward between the brows lies the *Hall of Brightness*; two inches inward, the *Cavern Chamber*; three inches inward, the *Cinnabar Field*. North of the *Hall of Brightness* and south of the *Cavern Chamber*, one inch upward lies the *Golden Flower Palace*, from which radiant light emerges behind the neck, shimmering into a nine-colored circular image. It gently enters the *Jade Pillow*, illuminating the ten directions, and follows my distant scripture as it proceeds.

The sun enters through the left nostril, the moon through the right. Again, strike the teeth three times, swallow saliva three times, and recite the esoteric incantation: *Master Guangcheng of Du* said, "This incantation must not be heard by the ears. Those who transmit it carelessly will incur blame—be cautious, be cautious."

*"Within the Yellow Center, qi severs the lineage of evil;
Esoterically, it subdues strong essence and severs the Elder of Demons.
The Supreme has decreed, the Supreme Chamber summons;
Hasten the Northern Emperor to the Jade Palace.
Receive the majestic command to proclaim to the Demon Kings;
The five qi billow and surge, clashing with fate.
The secret jade script is now complete and flourishing.
The Three Heavens revolve in brightness, the Six Heavens reach their end.
How wise!"*

Next, the *Dujang* chants, and the assembly circumambulates in *BuXu* steps. Then, they recite the ten *BuXu* hymns of *Mount Jade Capital* from the *Scripture of the Numinous Treasure’s BuXu*, concluding each with a bow and a chant of *Shan*.

*Bowing in reverence to the Supreme,
Burning incense to surrender to emptiness.
Radiance flows and follows me in return;
The Dharma Wheel turns thrice as well.
Profound vows arise in the four directions,
Bringing numinous blessings to kings and lords.
Seven generations ascend to Heaven’s halls,
Resplendent, their glory unfurled.
Chanting and gazing upon the Great Void,
Heavenly music delights my joy.
Equal in fragrance is the supreme virtue,
With lower immortals I join in company.
Wondrous thoughts illumine dark awakening,
In orderly ranks we traverse the void.
Circling, we tread the cloud’s warp,
Riding the void, we step the dark records.
Chanting the hymn to the Emperor of Unity,
A hundred passages self-regulate.
Bending, I command the lads of the Eight Seas;
Uplifting, I grasp the lofty immortals’ hands.
The heavens scatter fragrant flowers,
A numinous wind arises, serene.
Long-held vows root destiny,
Thus attaining lofty eminence.
Rejoicing before the Supreme,
For ten thousand kalpas, plans never cease.*

*Towering, the Dark Capital’s mountain,
The ten directions revere its imperial unity.
Lofty, the Heavenly Treasure Terrace,
Its radiance blazes like the flowing sun.
Resplendent, the jade grove’s blossoms,
Vermilion fruits glow in dazzling hues.
Ever mindful to consume primordial essence,
Refining fluids to solidify form and substance.
Golden light scatters the Purple Tenuity,
Graceful, the Great Vehicle’s ease.
Looking up and down, I hold the Supreme in mind,
The Flowery Splendor flourishes in the Cinnabar Field.
Glancing left, I grasp Yu Yi;
Gazing right, I carry Jie Lin.
The Six Perfections crown the Brahman conduct,
Virtue and power renew with the sun.
Long-cultivated karmic blessings respond,
Hearing the scripture as if meeting kin.
Heaven-endowed with transcendent talent,
Delighting in reciting the subtle and profound.
The qi of supreme harmony, empty and tranquil,
Exhaling and inhaling the flowing rosy mist.
Fetal breathing stills the hundred passages,
In solitude, I master the three conveniences.
The Mud Pill’s cavern shines with bright scenes,
Thus becoming a Golden Flower immortal.
The Demon King respectfully receives his charge,
Thus able to ascend and pay homage to the heavens.
All begins with fasting and precepts,
Accumulating merit to bind past affinities.
Soaring through the vast void,
Uplifting the loftiest of beings.
Guiding the reins to the ten directions,
Resting in the dark and radiant vale.
Gazing up at the Kalpa Terrace,
Looking down upon the Purple Cloud Net.
Roaming the Supreme’s capital,
Together we sit upon lotus flowers.
Accumulating study to become a Perfected Person,
Serene, the guard and defense harmonize.
Forever enjoying boundless longevity,
Ten thousand *chun*—what abundance!
Contemplating the profound stillness of the Great Dao,
Ascending as an immortal, befriending the peerless.
The noble scion bestows the numinous talisman,
The Great One bears the cavern scripture.
The relic shines with golden form,
The dragon carriage suddenly arrives to welcome.
The Heavenly Worthy glances at the cloud chariot,
Floating, floating, riding the void in flight.
Fragrant flowers like drifting clouds,
Swirling and luxuriant upon the dark beam.
Bowing the head to the Golden Gate,
Hand in hand, we roam the Jade Capital.
The *Qian* Tree’s Round Radiance Garden,
Resplendent with the seven-jeweled grove.
Three hundred named heavenly beasts,
Lions vast as ten thousand *xun*.
Flying dragons pace and roar,
Divine phoenixes chant in rhythm.
A numinous wind fans the wondrous blossoms,
Pure fragrance scatters upon my lapels.
Without transcendent talent,
How could one indulge this heart?
I adorn my nine-dragon carriage,
Riding the void in carefree ease.
The Eight Heavens are like the palm of my hand,
The Six Directions—what distance?
The assembled immortals recite the *Cavern Mystery*,
The Supreme chants the pure hymn.
Fragrant flowers scatter with the wind,
Jade tones form the Purple Empyrean.
The Five Sufferings burst forth at once,
The Eight Difficulties follow the scripture’s void.
Wondrous indeed, the Numinous Treasure’s preserve,
Raising this great Dharma bridge.
The Heavenly Perfected’s Palace of Imperial Unity,
Lush with the crown of luminous spirits.
Flowing and radiant, the Dharma Wheel’s warp,
Circling the void, entering the formless.
The Void Emperor plucks the cloud zither,
The assembled Perfected recite the *Cavern Scripture*.
The lofty immortals, solemn in praise,
Through endless kalpas, preserve integrity.
The Utmost Perfected await nothing,
At times, they rein in flying dragons.
Long fasting gathers at the Dark Capital,
Jade chimes strike the jasper bells.
The Ten Flowers’ immortals assemble,
Purple mist congeals into a palace.
The jeweled canopy arrays before the Supreme,
Perfected Persons grasp the lotus.
Scattering flowers, I declare my vow,
Grasping the tally, I subdue the Demon King.
The Dharma drum assembles the immortals,
Numinous chants resound in unison.
There is no "can" or "cannot,"
Thoughts commune with the subtle and profound.*

Next, the *Dujang* chants: "We, your humble assembly, with utmost sincerity, surrender body and life to the *Supreme Three Worthies* and the *Saints of the Ten Directions*. We perform the ritual obeisance to the scriptures as prescribed."

Then, they recite the *Three Hymns of Invocation*, concluding each with a bow and a chant of *Shan*, as seen in the *Ritual for Establishing the Altar at Night*.

Next, the *Dujang* chants the *Three Bows*:
*"With utmost sincerity, we bow in reverence to the Supreme, Boundless, and Great Dao—one bow.
With utmost sincerity, we bow in reverence to the Utmost Perfected, Supreme *Thirty-Six Sections of the Venerable Scriptures*, the *True Writings and Numinous Talismans*—one bow.
With utmost sincerity, we bow in reverence to the *Supreme Three Worthies*, the *Saints of the Ten Directions*, and the *Great Dharma Master of the Mysterious Center*—one bow."*

Next, the *Dujang* chants, reiterating the ritual ranks. Then, the *High Merit Officer* offers profound thanks, kneeling in full ritual attire.

*"We, your humble assembly, respectfully reiterate and reverently address the *Supreme, Boundless, and Great Dao*, the *Celestial Worthy of Primordial Beginning*, the *Supreme Lord of the Great Dao*, the *Supreme Lord Lao*, the *Supreme and Mysterious Ancient One*, the *Celestial Worthies of the Ten Directions and the Boundless Great Dao of Virtue and Power*, the *Utmost Perfected Great Emperors*, the *Celestial Thearchs*, the *Thirty-Six Sections of the Venerable Scriptures*, the *Heavenly Master and Great Dharma Master of the Mysterious Center*, the *High Ministers and High Stewards*, the *Four Directors and Five Emperors*, the *Officials and Attendants of the Three Realms*, and all the Perfected and Numinous Beings."*

We, though unworthy and base, have been granted the privilege to partake in the supreme Dharma. Our merits are scant, while our transgressions accumulate like mountains. Truly, we should bind our bodies and await the punishments of the unseen. Yet from the day we received the Dao, we pledged our vows to the Three Officials: to propagate the mysterious wind of the Dao, to succor and protect both the hidden and the manifest, and to guide all beings universally into the Dharma gate.

Now, the patron of this retreat, so-and-so, in reverent concern for the departed spirit of so-and-so and the nine generations of ancestors, as well as all destitute souls—whose sins and defilements, accumulated across past lives and the present, have bound them in karmic retribution—find their numinous essence sunk in darkness. Without the merit of this retreat, there would be no means of repentance and deliverance. Bearing the tokens of the Dharma and pledging our sincere devotion, we beseech that the ancestors be delivered, freed from sorrow and suffering, that the souls of the long night may behold the light of the great sun, that the solitary spirits return to the womb, and that decayed bones be clothed anew in flesh. May all under heaven be bathed in the grace of the Dao.

As this is our ordained duty, how dare we fail to present this petition?
