Thus, in accordance with the *Lingxian Ordinances of the Lower Prime* and the *Huanglu Ritual Texts*, we reverently conduct this *Supreme Huanglu Grand Retreat* for so-and-so, lasting three days and three nights, with nine periods of ritual circumambulation. We recite the scriptures, perform repentance rites, burn incense, and light lamps, universally aiding both the living and the dead to redeem their sins and suffering.

With single-minded devotion, we take refuge in the *Supreme Great Dao* and the *Perfected Worthies*, humbly beseeching the vast compassion of your grace and the boundless favor of your mercy. We implore the absolution of the departed spirit of so-and-so, the patron’s household, their myriad ancestors, and all souls trapped in the long night—extending to their present selves, their families great and small, the people of the world, and all sentient beings. May the grave sins committed in life and death be pardoned:

Those who harmed rulers or fathers, failing in filial piety to their parents;
Those who betrayed teachers or deceived friends, abandoning truth for falsehood;
Those who rebelled against superiors or oppressed inferiors, slaughtering the innocent;
Those who ensnared living beings, waged war on families or nations;
Those who injured or killed creatures, framed the loyal and good, seized others’ treasures, or sundered families;
Those who indulged in licentiousness, conspired with clans, envied the worthy, or resented the capable;
Those who slandered the virtuous, burned or stole scriptures, defiled the Three Luminaries, or disdained the Four Great Elements;
Those who, as rulers, acted without the Dao, or as subjects, were disloyal;
Those who mocked the destitute, cruelly oppressed the people, cursed heaven and earth, or reviled the true and real;
Those who reviled spirits, raged at wind and rain, failed to honor the Dao or respect the elderly;
Those who aided wrongdoing or ridiculed good deeds;
Those whose hearts contradicted their words, deceiving even their own shadows;
Those whose sins deepened day by day, month by month, until their karmic obstacles became insurmountable.

If the patron’s household harbors other concealed transgressions they wish to repent, the master shall compose a text to be added here: from kalpa to kalpa, through rebirth after rebirth, the five desires and ten fetters, the six senses and three karmas, defying heaven and earth, breaking vows and betraying covenants. The roots of past suffering, entangled across lifetimes, drag them into the abyss of evil. Bound in litigation between the living and the dead, they are trapped in the unending wheel of rebirth, their souls tormented by interrogations, their bodies severed by the winds of judgment. Confined in the dark prisons, they endure every agony.

We now burn incense and perform the ritual circumambulation, repenting before the mysterious and true. May the sins listed above be dissolved and released according to each transgression. Relying on the *Celestial Worthies* and the *Heavenly Lords of the Ten Poles*, we present the patron so-and-so’s *Golden Dragon Silk Token of Deliverance*. We pray that the *Flying Heavenly Divine Kings* be dispatched with the *Nine Dragon Mandates* to proclaim to the *Nine Dark Realms of Fengdu*, the *Peaks of Mount Tai*, the *River Sources and Spring Bends*, the *Three Officials and Nine Bureaus*, the *One Hundred Twenty Offices*, the *Yin-Yang and Water-Fire Departments*, and the *Judges and Clerks of the Underworld*: upon receiving this mandate, may they release the imprisoned souls. May the departed spirit of so-and-so and the ancestral spirits of the patron’s household emerge from the long night, behold the light, extinguish their evil roots, and erase their names from the ledgers of sin. May their earthly bonds be severed, their watery oaths annulled, their ranks transferred to the *Vermilion Mound*, and their spirits refined in the *Cinnabar Fire*. Those destined for deliverance shall be delivered; those destined for rebirth shall be reborn. If they reside in blessed realms, may their merits increase. May all beings in the *Four Births*, *Five Paths*, *Six Destinies*, and *Three Wretched Realms* universally depart the dust of the mundane and ascend to transformation.

May the imprisoned officials, exiled criminals, and condemned prisoners, by the merit of this retreat, all attain purification and liberation. May they equally attain the fruit of true perfection and together ascend to the realm of bliss.

Our highest aspiration is that the *Three Luminaries* shine brightly, the *Two Modes* harmonize, the imperial reign be steadfast, and the harvests abundant. May floods, droughts, locusts, wars, banditry, and plagues never invade our borders, and may all within be preserved in peace. May the patron so-and-so, their family, and kin perpetually receive the mysterious protection of the Dao. May a thousand disasters be extinguished, and ten thousand virtues be nurtured. May all our supplications and prayers be heard, and all our repentances and thanksgivings be answered. Above, may the great compassion of the *Celestial Worthies* be manifest; below, may our sincerity in repentance and gratitude be reciprocated.

Respectfully submitted.

This *Great Repentance Text of the Lu Tian Shi’s Covenant Ritual* is derived from the *Scripture of Thanksgiving* within the canon, originally modeled after the *Tai Ji Ritual of Retreat Propagation*. The *Huanglu Ritual of Zhang Qingdu* presents its own *Great Thanksgiving*, though its wording is somewhat verbose. Thus, the version transmitted by Li Jingqi adopts the *Great Thanksgiving of Lu Tian Shi’s Covenant Ritual* as the *Great Thanksgiving Text for the Huanglu Retreat*, incorporating only a few phrases from the *Zhang Qingdu Ritual*. Indeed, Lu Tian Shi never composed a *Huanglu Retreat Ritual*—its repentance rites and ordinances are plain yet not ornate, its language difficult to read, and modern readers often mistake its austerity for antiquity.

In the year *Qingyuan Bingyin*, Liu Chongjing came to *Kuocang* to preside over the retreat at the home of Minister Wang Xi. Each time he read the *Great Thanksgiving*, the bereaved family, believing the deceased had committed no grave sins in life, questioned the necessity of such repentance. They failed to understand that the *Supreme* established the ritual of retreat and repentance to encompass the karmic origins of all beings in the Dharma realm, inspiring remorse. Where remorse takes shape, the heart of goodness naturally manifests. Thus are heaven and hell divided.

Entering yet never returning to the Dao.
All under heaven and earth are gathered into a single rite of repentance and vow—thus is it called the *Great Retreat*.
How could this be merely for the deceased, to beg mercy and repent sins?
Yet if the host of the retreat harbors dissatisfaction, this too contravenes the Supreme’s teaching, which adapts to the moment.

Du Guangcheng’s *Huanglu Retreat* served as a ritual for fellow disciples to practice the Dao, wherein he cited the *Precious Text of the Kuocang Repentance* for the *Great Thanksgiving*. Here, I have slightly refined it to ease comprehension. Yet where repentance of sins is concerned, I have faithfully repeated the scriptural language, that the retreat’s Dharma may endure for eternal kalpas.

Next: The Lector’s Vows and Recitations
Next: The Rekindling of the Censer
Fragrant officials and envoys, Lords of the Left and Right Dragon-Tiger, and all attending spirit-officials—
At this place where the retreat is held, may the golden elixir, cinnabar mushrooms, and azure fungi arise naturally. May the hundred spirits and host of perfected ones gather here before the incense burner.
May the host of this retreat, both living and deceased, receive blessings, and may the state and household be graced with favor.
May the jade maidens and immortal youths of the ten directions attend the fragrant smoke, conveying the petitions just offered directly to the Celestial Venerable of the Supreme, Boundless Dao, the Most High Jade Emperor.

Next: The *Hymn to the Study of Immortality*; exiting the altar, the *Ritual of Master Zhang Wanfu of the Ten Thousand Blessings* is employed, followed by the *Hymn of Precepts*
Next: The *Exiting-the-Door Mantra*
Next: The *Hymn of the Empty Cavern*, leading the assembly to form ranks before the Mysterious Master; the High Priest offers a brief apology and performs the three prostrations
Next: The *Hymn of Dedication*
Next: The *Retreat Overseer’s Correction of Faults*—whether faults are present or not is noted.
If none: "The altar assembly has upheld the Dharma in perfect completion, fortunately avoiding omissions or errors."
If present: The Dharma Master is informed and presents the tally.
The offender approaches the Master, bows twice, kneels to receive the tally, then retreats to the scripture table to perform the prescribed prostrations.
Next: The *Hymn Leading the Dharma Master Back to the Hall*

Here ends *Scroll Seventeen of the Established Ritual for the Supreme Huanglu Great Retreat*

*Scroll Eighteen of the Established Ritual for the Supreme Huanglu Great Retreat*
Compiled by Li Jingqi, Dharma Master of the Three Caverns
Revised by Liu Yongguang, Dharma Master of the Three Caverns and Master of Earthly Tranquility
Transmitted by Jiang Shuyu, Celestial Enforcer of the Supreme and Daoist Ritual Officer
*Section on Rituals: The Ancient Dispersed-Altar Rites for Officials and Priests*

Upon the completion of the designated days of the retreat, whether at midnight of that day or at dawn the following morning, the assembled officials proceed in ranks before the Original Master. Then:

The *Hymn of the Dao* is intoned,
Followed by the *Hymn of Splendor*, leading the Dharma Master to ascend the altar and recite the *Entering the Door Mantra*.
Next, ascending through the Earthly Gate to the Heavenly Portal, they offer incense to the Ten Directions,
Then recite the *Incense Mantra for the Imperial Table*.
The Precentor chants, and each pays homage to the Master while maintaining proper contemplation.
Next, the *Mantra of the Five Directions’ Guardian Spirits* is proclaimed.
The Precentor chants again, and the *Dharma Drum* is sounded twenty-four times.
Then the *Three-Pinch Incense Mantra* is recited,
Followed by the *Opening of the Brazier*.

"To the Supreme Three Heavens, the Primordial Origin, the Three Qi of the Most High Lord Lao: we summon forth the Three and Five Merit Officers within our bodies, the Left and Right Attendant Envoys, the Left and Right Incense-Bearing Dragon-Riding Couriers, the Golden Lads of Incense, the Jade Maidens of Scattered Flowers, the Five Thearchs’ Direct Attendants, and the Incense Officials of the Day—thirty-six each in number—to emerge. Let those who emerge be arrayed in solemn attire. We now open the gates and invoke the True Officials and Divine Rulers of this land and domain. As we now burn incense, we do so on behalf of the assembled officials [names] who have undertaken the Supreme Huanglu Great Retreat for three days and three nights, conducting the Nine-Period Dao Procession. The rites are complete, and we now report our merit. May the life-generating qi of the Most High’s Ten Directions and True Perfected Ones descend and flow into our bodies, that our petition may swiftly ascend to the presence of the Most High, the Boundless Dao, the Utmost True Jade Thearch of the August Emperor."

Each performs the Three Bows.
Then the Dharma Master and disciples offer incense to the Ten Directions.

Then the Cantor intones, and each declares their dharma rank and full title, performing the merit-reporting rites of the Supreme Huanglu Great Retreat. We, [name] and the assembled, now burn incense once more, dedicating this merit to the Son of Heaven and the feudal lords, the local officials and magistrates, the masters of scriptures and ordination, the Daoist adepts dwelling in mountains and caves, fellow students of the Dao, the disciples of [name] and the departed souls they commend, the nine generations of ancestors, both the living and the dead, all kin and affines, inner and outer clans, the people of the world, all creatures that fly and crawl, and every sentient being. Now we hold the incense, taking refuge in body, spirit, and life, in the Most High’s Ten Directions and the Numinous Treasure’s Natural, Utmost True, and Supreme Dao. We humbly beseech the absolution of all transgressions—past and present, in life and death, and all grave offenses. May we be delivered from the Three Evil Paths, the Ten Sufferings, the Eight Adversities, and the Nine Calamities. May our bodies attain the True Dao, soaring through the void. May we ascend to heaven in broad daylight, serving the Dao Lords, and roaming freely in the Supreme Golden Towers and the Seven Treasures’ Natural Palaces, forever united with the Dao. May our profound invocation swiftly ascend to the presence of the Utmost True and Boundless Dao.

Then the Cantor intones, and all pay homage to the Ten Directions:
With utmost sincerity, we take refuge in the Eastern Direction’s Boundless, Most High, Numinous Treasure Heavenly Worthy—one bow. The remaining nine directions likewise.

Then the Cantor intones, and each takes refuge and repents, the Dharma Master kneeling in confession:
We, the assembled, wholeheartedly take refuge in body in the Boundless, Supreme Dao and Heavenly Worthy. We repent for the Retreat Master [name], the assembled, and all sentient beings, for all transgressions of body—past and present—where our four limbs and actions have violated the precepts, strayed from the scriptures, and incurred grave karmic sins, boundless and immeasurable. We beseech their complete dissolution. May the Retreat Master [name], the assembled, and all sentient beings enter the realm of the Perfected Immortals and unite with the True Dao.
We bow in reverence and gratitude to the Most High’s Ten Directions and the True Three Treasures—one bow.

We, the assembled, wholeheartedly take refuge in spirit in the Boundless, Supreme Dao and Heavenly Worthy. We repent for the Retreat Master [name], the assembled, and all sentient beings, for all transgressions of mind—past and present—where our thoughts and intentions were scattered, our emotions restless, and our minds ceaselessly wandering, incurring grave karmic sins, boundless and immeasurable. We beseech their complete dissolution. May the Retreat Master [name], the assembled, and all sentient beings unite with the True Quiescence and penetrate the Natural.
We bow in reverence and gratitude to the Most High’s Ten Directions and the True Three Treasures—one bow.

We, the assembled, wholeheartedly take refuge in life in the Boundless, Supreme Dao and Heavenly Worthy. We repent for the Retreat Master [name], the assembled, and all sentient beings, for all transgressions of speech—past and present—where we have argued over right and wrong, embellished falsehoods with ornate words, and deceived the multitude with flowery rhetoric, incurring grave karmic sins, boundless and immeasurable. We beseech their complete dissolution. May the Retreat Master [name], the assembled, and all sentient beings unite their nature and life with the Dao, merging with the Profound and Non-Action.
We bow in reverence and gratitude to the Most High’s Ten Directions and the True Three Treasures—one bow.

Then the Cantor intones:
We, the assembled, wholeheartedly take refuge in the Most High’s Three Worthies and the Ten Directions’ Host of Sages. We perform the ritual in accordance with the scriptures.

Then three invocations are chanted, each followed by a hymn.

Then the Cantor intones, and all perform the Three Bows.

Next, proceed with the circumambulation, retrieving the True Writs of the Five Directions. Upon completing the recitation for each direction, have a disciple hold the True Writ over the incense to fumigate it. Strike the teeth twelve times and recite the Jade Seal Incantation. It is said that for any prayer or exorcism, if one does not first strike the teeth before reciting the incantation, external demons will interfere, and the gates of heaven will remain unopened, unresponsive.

**The Incantation:**
O Most High and Perfectly True, Great Sage and Lofty Venerable,
Who spreads transformation and circulates qi through the Thirty-Two Heavens,
Whose Eight Assemblies and Nine Radiances naturally form the Writ,
Pacifying and securing heaven and earth, preserving and governing the kalpas.
The Mandate of the Primordial Beginning is universally proclaimed to the Three Origins.
Below, it commands the Nine Earths; above, it seals the myriad heavens.
At its center, it announces to the seas and mountains, the great peaks and rivers.
Today, this supreme proclamation is heard by all spirits.
Disciple [Name], conducting the Retreat and practicing the Dao,
Liberates and delivers the hidden souls, the Three Offices and Nine Bureaus,
Eradicates the roots of sin, eternally crossing the Three Wretched Paths.
The source of the Five Sufferings, may they receive blessings for generations.
Their names inscribed in the Crimson Register, their spirits born in heaven.
Refined and transformed by nature, the gates of life and death are opened.
Preserved for countless kalpas, the Mandate of the Nine Heavens is transmitted by wind and fire couriers.

All respond three times. This is from the *Inner Sounds of the Numinous Treasure Jade Seal*. After the incantation, place the writ upon the incense table, and following the memorial, burn it. Scatter the ashes amidst the azure smoke.

Next, the Cantor strikes the Dharma drum twenty-four times. The High Master strikes the teeth, closes the eyes, swallows saliva, and visualizes the method of the Nine Qi’s radiant splendor.

Then the Cantor, once more invoking the Dharma rank of Li Jing, performs the Three Bows and offers profound gratitude before presenting the memorial. This follows the Zhang Qingdu ritual, not the ancient method.

Assuming the Dharma rank, proceed with the Yellow Register Great Retreat’s merit-accruing memorial presentation.

**Memorial:**
Your humble servants [Names] reverently and sincerely address the Most High, Boundless Dao, the Primordial Celestial Venerable of the Origin; the Most High Lord of the Great Dao; the Most High Lord Lao; the Supreme and Mysterious Ancient of the Ten Directions; the Numinous Treasure Celestial Venerables; the Great Sage Assemblies who have attained the Dao; the Perfected Lords and Masters; the Thirty-Six Divisions of Venerable Scriptures; the Heavenly Master of the Mysterious Center, the Great Dharma Master; the Prime Ministers and High Chancellors; the Four Offices and Five Emperors; the officials and attendants of the Three Realms; and all true spirits.

Since the kalpa of the Boundless, by karmic conditions, we have endured to this day. We have encountered the Great Dharma, the true scriptures descending into the world. Unworthy and undeserving, we have received the precious writs. Yet we have not transcended the mundane world, nor concealed our light in secluded forests. We have practiced long retreats and苦思, seeking lofty conduct, but remain entangled in worldly paths, indistinguishable from demonic and vulgar ways. Our bodies and speech have committed transgressions, accumulating faults without end. We constantly fear the arrival of judgment, ashamed before the hidden and manifest. Day and night, we tremble in dread, our forms and souls at a loss.

We know full well that the defiled are not those who contemplate the true. Yet from the day we received the Dharma, we vowed to exhaust our foolish sincerity, presenting this memorial to express our crimson devotion. We widely proclaim the wind of compassion, praising and extolling the wondrous transformation, universally guiding all to enter the Dharma gate. For all who take refuge, we shall transcribe and submit their names.

Now, in accordance with the imperial edict, how dare we not make this known above?

**Proclamation:**
As the words state, we are to be pitied. Your servants, leading one another, have followed the Yellow Register’s simple writ and the ancient canons of威仪. At the numinous altar of [Location], we have established the pattern of the Mysterious Rite, modeling heaven and earth. With the gold dragon silks and brocades brought here, we pacify the Ten Directions. The token of our life’s destiny serves as proof of our crimson devotion. We bathe our five limbs and purify our hearts, entering stillness and contemplation.

Beginning on the [Day] of this month at [Hour], we reverently conduct the Yellow Register Great Retreat for Deliverance, prostrating in ashes and dust, burning incense and reciting scriptures, lighting lamps to continue the radiance, illuminating the myriad heavens. For three days and nights, at nine intervals, we practice the Dao. We deliver the departed spirit [Name] and the nine generations of ancestors of disciple [Name]’s family, along with the karmic kin of countless kalpas. The hidden souls, suffering spirits, and karmic roots of past offenses—all are completed by the hour of Hai on [Day]. The merit is accomplished, the task fulfilled. Grace extends to the living and the dead, benefiting households and nations. Rewards for merit are bestowed, reaching all spirit offices.

Within your servants’ bodies, the inner and outer true officials, lords, generals, officers, and soldiers; the invited Numinous Treasure officials and attendants; the guardians of the retreat and true spirits; the celestial, terrestrial, and flying immortals; the perfected and divine persons; the sun, moon, and stars; the Nine Palaces and Five Emperors; the Three Rivers and Four Seas; the Five Peaks and Four Waterways; the cavalry and chariots; the myriad heavens’ overseers of the retreat; the golden youths attending incense; the jade maidens scattering flowers; the Five Emperors’ direct talismans and incense officials of the day; the flying dragon couriers transmitting words and memorials; and all officials, Dharma registers, governing ranks, lords, generals, officers, the four directions’ inspectors, local true officials, and spirits of the Three Realms—who have come and gone, transmitting memorials, overseeing and protecting, proclaiming and summoning, and safeguarding the retreat—have all labored diligently.

We respectfully present a memorial on yellow silk with vermilion text, ascending to the Three Heavenly Courts. We dissolve the altar, transfer ranks, and restore the heavens’ positions, reaffirming merit and virtue. The memorial rests upon your servant’s jade table. We request that the text be reviewed.

Next, the memorial is taken and fumigated over the incense. The Dharma ranks are invoked, and after two bows, the assembly rises to a long kneel. In harmonious voices and upright qi, as the disciple’s name is read, all perform two bows. From the phrase “your servants, trembling with awe,” all perform two more bows. Upon reaching the date and location, “[Location], reverently presented on [Date],” two more bows are performed.

The memorial is unfolded upon the jade table. A ritual knife is placed to the left of the sacred title, and a vermilion brush to the right. The High Master takes three pinches of incense, strikes the teeth three times, and in a long kneel, dispatches the memorial, declaring:

**Dispatch:**
We reverently dispatch the true officials within your servants’ five bodies, one minor scribe, twelve writing assistants, and the repeatedly commanded Merit-Officials and Couriers, Flying Dragon Riders. Adorned in solemn attire, crowned and sashed, they grind ink, prepare brushes, gird swords, and arrange the registers. They shall promptly carry this yellow silk memorial with vermilion text to the Three Heavenly Courts for timely presentation. Should there be errors, omissions, transposed words, or disordered passages, the transmitting scribes, minor officials, and couriers shall wield dragon-headed ritual knives and sharp brushes to correct and amend them.

Let no supervising officials obstruct or reject this dispatch. Seal the mouth, let the qi ascend directly to the Three Heavens’ Infinite Great Dao, before the Most High’s presence—let there be no delay. The Left Lord shall pass through the barriers, the Right Scribe shall present in order, and all officials shall proceed rank by rank in due sequence.

May what is petitioned descend, what is summoned arrive, what is saved be delivered, what is proclaimed be communicated, what is promoted be advanced, what is wished be fulfilled, and what is sought be obtained. Should any subordinate officials, through obstructive qi, intercept or block this memorial from reaching its destination, seize them and consign them to the nearest prison, to be punished according to the law and the celestial statutes.

The officiant retires and prostrates before the altar, awaiting a response. Next, the memorial is placed into its case, and the ritual master leads the procession to escort the memorial down from the altar. The Dharma Master then faces the Heavenly Gate, prostrates upon the ground, and in meditation presents the memorial with due ceremony. The memorial is burned at the Heavenly Gate, and the Dharma Master rises to recite the incantation of burning.

The cantor intones, and the inner officials kneel in accordance with the ritual. The Dharma Master offers incense three times, strikes the teeth twelve times, and restores the officials to their posts.

The memorial having been presented, at the commencement of the fast, the Merit-Officials and Couriers, all Perfected Officials, Immortal Lords, and divine soldiers dispatched from the officiant’s body shall return to their places within. Entering through the Gate of Myriad Mysteries, those on the left return to the left, those on the right to the right. The Directing Merit-Official shall take charge of inspection and sealing, returning each to their original position without error or confusion. When summoned again, they shall arrive as before.

The officiant strikes the teeth three times, swallows saliva three times, and visualizes the officials of the Three and Five Chapters returning to their places within. All bow twice. The cantor intones, and the assembly kneels to return the precepts in accordance with the ritual. The Dharma Master faces west, the officials face east.

We, your servants, have not yet mastered the Dharma in full. In our reverence and movement, in our advance and retreat, we may have transgressed the regulations and violated the ritual forms. We fear being impeached by the Four Administrations or seized by the Five Emperors. For our thousand faults and ten thousand errors, we beg forgiveness and mercy. Though our origins are humble and our understanding dim, we pray not to be visited with punishment or retribution.

At the commencement of this fast, we reverently invited the Ten Precepts of the Upper Grade of Wisdom. Now that the Dharma rites are concluded, we respectfully return them to their heavenly palace. We humbly submit this report, praying for your luminous pardon.

We, your servants, with utmost reverence and awe, prostrate ourselves and bow twice.

Next, the precepts are returned with the recitation of the Three Obeisances, as recorded in the *San Dong Ke Yi*:
*"The Heavenly Worthy, in great compassion,*
*Preaches the precepts to deliver sentient beings.*
*Virtue and power pervade the hidden and manifest;*
*Karmic retribution moves the divine spirits.*
*The devas come to bow their heads;*
*The demon kings submit in form.*
*Those of the past transcend the eight difficulties;*
*Those of the present preserve a thousand years.*
*As the fast’s blessings draw to a close,*
*Together we send forth our devotion.*
*Flowing Sanskrit, ethereal clouds chant;*
*Flying incense mingles with fragrant smoke.*
*Jade phoenixes ride the cinnabar carriage;*
*Golden dragons draw the green canopy.*
*In life and death, all find joy;*
*Families and nations all know peace."*

Next, the Mountain Simpl is proclaimed, striking the teeth nine times. The assembly kneels in harmony and reads the text aloud. When the proclamation of the Mountain Simpl is complete, the officials bow twice. The disciples are instructed to hold the tablets and carry the incense smoke forward.

The High Master faces east, strikes the teeth nine times, and recites the incantation. The assembly joins in unison:
*"Mysterious and supreme, radiant and clear,*
*The Primordial Beginning oversees the Perfected.*
*The Five Elders of the Emperor,*
*Red Script of the Cinnabar Text.*
*Origin of Heaven and Earth,*
*Governors of the Three Primes.*
*Gathering qi, summoning the assembly,*
*Urging the ascent of immortals.*
*Exalted talismanic commands,*
*Universally proclaimed to the Ten Heavens.*
*Sun, moon, and stellar lodges,*
*Spirits of the Five Peaks.*
*Above in Heaven, below on Earth,*
*Great deities of the vast and dark.*
*Overseers of life and recorders of deeds,*
*Southern Gate of the Three Portals.*
*Guarding the jade tablets,*
*Inscribing names in the cinnabar register.*
*Erasing the records of transgressions,*
*Promoting to the ranks of imperial ministers.*
*So-and-so relies upon the Perfect Dao,*
*Establishing merit through the fast.*
*Redeeming the nine generations of ancestors,*
*All suffering souls.*
*The Dao rites concluded,*
*We respectfully follow the sacred mountain.*
*We present the jade tablet,*
*Begging to erase our transgressions.*
*May all attain liberation,*
*Without enmity or kinship.*
*Departing the Three Evils,*
*Ascending to the Nine Heavens.*
*Deliverance in life and death,*
*Eternal through ten thousand kalpas.*
*Today we make this report,*
*Heard by all the myriad spirits.*
*We request the Dragon Tablet,*
*To ally with the Perfected Officials.*
*Grant our plea as stated,*
*Transmitted by the Golden Dragon Couriers."*

Next, the Water Simpl is proclaimed in the same manner as the Mountain Simpl. When the proclamation is complete, the High Master faces east and recites the incantation:
*"Primordial Beginning and Five Elders,*
*Exalted Lords of the Emperor.*
*Perfected Ones of the Ten Directions,*
*Spirits of Mount Taihua.*
*Red Script proclaims the command,*
*Nothing hidden remains unheard.*
*Ascending to the Nine Heavens,*
*We request the descent of the jade text.*
*Sun, moon, and five stars,*
*Northern Dipper’s seven origins.*
*We report to the Five Peaks,*
*Spiritual mountains of the four directions.*
*Below, we report to rivers and seas,*
*Twelve springs and sources.*
*Water Emperors of the Nine Treasuries,*
*Great deities of the vast and dark.*
*Today we make this report,*
*Opening the ten thousand vows.*
*Performing the fast and practicing the Dao,*
*Universally for the living and the dead.*
*We beg to redeem the seven generations of ancestors,*
*And the roots of past transgressions.*
*Respectfully presenting the jade tablet,*
*We pray it be heard above.*
*Inscribe names in the Water Treasury,*
*That the departed may ascend to Heaven.*
*Deliverance in life and death,*
*Heard by all the myriad spirits.*
*We request the Dragon Tablet,*
*To ally with the Water Emperors.*
*Grant our plea as stated,*
*Transmitted by the Golden Dragon Couriers."*

Next, the Earth Simpl is proclaimed in the same manner as the Mountain Simpl. When the proclamation is complete, the High Master faces east and recites the incantation:
*"Heaven and Earth unfold,*
*Nine qi divide the numinous.*
*Three Primes share the talisman,*
*Ten directions shine in clarity.*
*The Five Elder Emperors,*
*Open the Perfected and govern life.*
*Cinnabar Script and Red Text,*
*Primordial essence of the Primordial Beginning.*
*Universally proclaimed beneath Heaven,*
*Spirits of the Nine Lands.*
*Today we make this report,*
*The myriad immortals determine life.*
*Performing the fast and practicing the Dao,*
*Universally for the living and the dead.*
*We, your servants, and our immortals,*
*Present our jade names.*
*Great Emperor of the Earth Treasury,*
*Erase the forms of transgression.*
*Present the tablet to the Upper Palace,*
*Inscribe it in the Azure Register.*
*Soon attain flight and ascension,*
*In harmony with Heaven and Earth.*
*Nine generations of ancestors,*
*Rotten bones renewed in glory.*
*Souls ascend to the Southern Palace,*
*Transformed in the immortal courts.*
*Today we proclaim this command,*
*Heard by all the myriad spirits.*
*We request the Golden Button,*
*To manifest our utmost sincerity.*
*Grant our plea as stated,*
*Presented by the Golden Dragon Couriers."*

The incantations for the three tablets are from the *Lingbao Chishu Yujue*.

Next, the hymn for presenting the Dragon Tablets is chanted. The cantor intones, and the officials return to their duties. Before the Three Treasures, all bow three times, kneel, and present the tablets. The High Master bows three more times and retires.

Next, the incense brazier is rekindled. The Incense Officials and Envoys, the Lords of the Left and Right Dragon-Tiger, and all attending spirit-officials of the incense are invoked to dissolve the precincts of the Yellow Register Retreat. Here, golden liquid elixirs and cinnabar mushrooms naturally arise. The hundred numinous perfected beings gather in this place before the incense brazier. May the living and deceased disciples receive blessings, may households and the state be graced with favor. The jade lads and maidens of the ten directions attend the fragrant smoke, conveying the petitions just presented directly to the Most High, the Boundless Dao, the Perfectly True Jade Emperor before the Celestial Throne. All bow three times.

Next, the Dharma Master offers incense, stands facing east, and takes leave of the Three Treasures:

*"The time allotted for this retreat has passed, the sun’s shadow wanes.
The fragrance pervades the void, the great bell’s resonance ceases.
The Dao returns to the Golden Palace, the scriptures are sealed in jade caskets.
We bow our heads in reverence and take refuge."*

**Response:** *"In the Most High Dao-Treasure."* **One bow.**

*"Incense disperses with the wind, its sound enters the Great Clarity.
Names are inscribed on golden tablets, petitions written on jade slips.
The immortal lads record them, the jade maidens present the documents.
We bow our heads in reverence and take refuge."*

**Response:** *"In the Most High Scripture-Treasure."* **One bow.**

*"The Dao-chamber is complete, the Dharma-seat fully arrayed.
May all beings ascend to the shore of non-action.
We bow our heads in reverence and take refuge."*

**Response:** *"In the Most High Master-Treasure."* **One bow.**

*"May all beings refrain from all evil and practice all good,
ever reborn in the Central Land, never cast to the frontier realms.
May the six paths receive grace, may the Fengdu courts dismiss their suits.
We bow in homage to the ten directions."*

**Response:** *"To the perfected immortals and all the holy hosts who have attained the Dao."* **One bow.**

Next, the assembly circumambulates while chanting the *"Hymn of the Three Paths and Five Sufferings,"* then posts the proclamation from the *Sutra of the Vows of Fundamental Wisdom for Dispelling Demons, Pacifying the Will, and Stabilizing Aspiration.*

Next, the *"Hymn for Dissolving the Altar"* is chanted.
Next, the *"Hymn for Cultivating Immortality"* is chanted while circumambulating out of the altar, from the *Scripture on the Ritual Dignity of the Taiyi Spread-Fast.*
Next, the *"Door-Closing Incantation"* is recited.

Next, the assembly proceeds to the tents of the Five Emperors, the Three Masters, the Fast-Overseer, the Three Officials, the Celestial Master, and the Mysterious Master to offer thanks and take leave.

Next, the *"Hua-Xia Prelude"* is played, and the High Master retires to his chamber.

Next, all officials bow to the Dharma Master three times, kneel, and offer thanks:
*"We, unworthy as we are, have been permitted to witness these rites from afar.
Though we have followed the precepts, we have often transgressed. We pray for your forbearance."*
**Three bows.**

The disciples, leading all men and women, young and old, approach the Master. They perform nine bows and three prostrations, offering thanks:
*"We, fortunate to have met you in a thousand lifetimes, have received your guidance.
The merit of this retreat is complete; we owe our lives and deaths to your grace.
Unworthy and remiss from beginning to end, we have fallen short in every way.
We pray for your forgiveness."*
**Three more bows, then receive blessings.**

Here concludes *Scroll Eighteen of the Established Rites for the Most High Yellow Register Grand Retreat.*

*Scroll Nineteen of the Established Rites for the Most High Yellow Register Grand Retreat*
*Compiled by Master Du Guangting of the Guangcheng Tradition.*

**Ritual Gate: Altar-Prohibiting Rite**

After inviting the Master to descend, the *Huaxia* hymn is chanted once around the altar, proceeding to the Earth Gate. The Dharma Master assumes the principal role, visualizing as prescribed in the original rite. Alternatively, a Zhengyi Dharma Master may be selected—donning a dark cap and crimson robe—to perform the altar-prohibiting ritual. If the High Priest conducts the rite personally, this is also permissible.

The Tai Xuan Du Zhengyi Pacifying Qi Lineage Celestial Master of [Name] Parish, the Red Heaven Three-Five Step Pace Yuanming True Person, your subject [Name], respectfully declares:

I have heard that none govern yin and yang more profoundly than the Hundred Spirits, nor can any surpass the Great Dao in delivering the living and the dead, the household and the state. Thus, the Azure Heavens bear omens of fortune and calamity, which mortals strive to discern; the Yellow Register holds the rites of salvation, which mortals endeavor to cultivate. Though I am utterly foolish, I ardently revere the mysterious transformation. Unworthily, I bear the great Dharma and presumptuously hold the office of Parish Master. In every altar I have served, how dare I forget my duty to repay this grace?

On this day, the [Year] of the Great Year [Celestial Stem-Branch], the [Month] [Day], I humbly act on behalf of [Official Title] at [Place] Abbey, conducting the Most High Yellow Register Grand Retreat for [Purpose], spanning [Number] days and nights. We perform the Daoist rites, recite the scriptures, and submit petitions in accordance with the established procedures.

We purify our forms and refine our qi, still our hearts and calm our spirits. Having set this appointed time, how dare we fail to make our supplication above?

We reverently recall that the Most High has issued decrees of renewal and opened the grace of nurturing and sheltering. Commands have been dispatched to the True Officials, who descend to oversee and inspect. May the mists and clouds momentarily cease across the Three Realms; may wind and rain not afflict the Four Seas. Our repentance and gratitude shall surely be heard; our prayers shall be transmitted without delay.

Overwhelmed by awe and longing, I concentrate my thoughts and invoke the True Ones, awaiting their response.

Concluding, I close my eyes and visualize the Azure Dragon, Vermilion Bird, White Tiger, and Dark Warrior. Then, donning the Dipper upon my head and the Five Stars, Sun, and Moon, I see them radiant in the four directions. With hands lowered and fists clenched, I recite the incantation:

**Azure Dragon of the East**, essence of Horn and Neck,
You exhale the numinous, dense qi, roar with thunderous voice.
Soaring across the Eight Extremities, roaming the Four Seas,
Come and attend at my left.

**White Tiger of the West**, corresponding to Beak and Tri-Star,
Your form is resplendent and pure, your voice solemn and clear.
You awe and subdue all beasts, your howls shake the mountains and forests.
Come and stand at my right.

**Vermilion Bird of the South**, chief of all fowl,
Born from the Cinnabar Cavern, your cries echo through the azure vault.
Your wondrous hues span five colors, your divine countenance bears six images.
Come and guide before me.

**Dark Warrior of the North**, transformed from the Supreme Yin,
Your form is marked by Void and Danger, serpent and tortoise conjoined.
You coil through the Nine Lands, command and gather the myriad spirits.
Come and follow behind me.

I summon the Four Numinous Beasts; now that they have assembled,
They shall encircle me as a sash, the Sun and Moon shall accompany my circuit.
The Nine Provinces and Sixteen Divine Generals shall serve as my messengers;
The Heavenly, Earthly, and Water Officials shall share in this blessing.

Next, I perform the Ding Pace, taking three steps. Advancing, I take the sword in my right hand and recite the incantation:

The Five Phases move—Fire, Wood, Water, Earth, Metal.
I wield this unyielding sword to command and restrain gods and spirits.
The Twenty-Eight Constellations follow my direction;
The Seven Stars of the Northern Dipper escort the numinous and true.
Roaming the ten thousand directions, may a hundred blessings converge.

Then, taking the water bowl in my left hand, I recite:

The waters of the Jiang, He, Huai, and Sea are no ordinary waters;
The Five Dragons exhale them to purify heaven and earth.
The Great Emperor drank them for thirty thousand years;
Today, I shall use them to cleanse malevolent qi.

Next, I face the sword toward the water and recite:

**Azure Dragon of the East**, bearing the talisman, descend with true qi into my water.
**Crimson Dragon of the South**, bearing the talisman, descend with true qi into my water.
**White Dragon of the West**, bearing the talisman, descend with true qi into my water.
**Black Dragon of the North**, bearing the talisman, descend with true qi into my water.
**Yellow Dragon of the Center**, bearing the talisman, descend with true qi into my water.

My water is no ordinary water—it is the water of the Five Dragons and Five Stars’ true qi.
My sword is no ordinary sword—tempered nine times, unyielding and firm, the Seven Stars flank it.
I tread upon the Northern Dipper, straddle the Demon-Quelling Star.
The Great One generates water, which flows through the ten thousand directions.
Nothing is purer than water; nothing is filthier than defilement.
With purity, I wash away impurity; with water, I govern defilement.
Swiftly, swiftly, as decreed by the statutes and ordinances!

I further command:
The Nine Wood Officials of the Azure Emperor of the East, Purifiers of Defilement;
The Three Fire Officials of the Crimson Emperor of the South, Purifiers of Defilement;
The Seven Metal Officials of the White Emperor of the West, Purifiers of Defilement;
The Five Water Officials of the Black Emperor of the North, Purifiers of Defilement;
The Twelve Earth Officials of the Yellow Emperor of the Center, Purifiers of Defilement.

I invoke:
The Heavenly Purifying Officials above,
The Earthly Purifying Officials below,
The Purifying Officials of the Current Year’s Directing Talisman,
The Purifying Officials of the Current Month’s Directing Talisman,
The Purifying Officials of the Current Day’s Directing Talisman,
The Purifying Officials of the Current Hour’s Directing Talisman,
The Purifying Generals, soldiers, True Persons, and Divine Lads—
All true officials, descend together!

Arriving at this retreat altar,
dissolve the defilements of heaven, earth, humanity, ghosts, cattle, horses, the six livestock, birds, and insects.
The Phoenix of Defilement-Breaking shall proceed from front to back, from east to west, purifying in order, restoring immaculate purity.

Let the heavenly defilements return to heaven,
the earthly defilements return to earth,
the human defilements return to humans,
the ghostly defilements return to ghosts.
May all evil defilements swiftly depart ten thousand leagues, never to linger.
Swiftly, swiftly, as decreed by the statutes and ordinances!

Next, I proceed westward to the Qian position and recite the incantation—this is the Yu Step incantation:

Qian, exalted and radiant; Kun, compliant and inwardly flourishing.
The Two Modes harmonize; the Six Directions align in uprightness.
Heaven and Earth unite in offering; eternal peace and solemn purity reign.
Responding to the mysterious and the yellow, above is the robe, below the skirt.
Zhen, Li, Kan, Dui assist and support; Qian, Kun, Gen, Xun—tiger strides, dragon soars.
The Gate of Heaven, the Door of Earth, the pivot of humans and ghosts.
Who guards me? The luminous heavens, the azure vault.
Today, my Yu Step corresponds to the Celestial Stem.
Ghosts and spirits submit; misfortune is averted below.
What I invoke and declare shall be answered with timely numinous radiance.

Then, performing the Yu Step—three steps, nine traces—from the northwest to the northeast, I face south and recite the incantation.

I invoke the Azure Emperor of the East, the Azure Youth Lord, and their retinue of ninety million officers and soldiers. Riding the true qi of Jupiter, they descend through the floating void to alight upon this altar ground. From the northeast corner, I seal the boundary to the southeast corner. The marching deities deploy their qi, scouring for evil spirits. Banish and expel demonic thieves—those guilty shall know no pardon.

Then, performing the Yu Step—three steps, nine traces—from the northeast to the southeast, I face west and recite the incantation:

I invoke the Vermilion Emperor of the South, the Vermilion Youth Lord, and their retinue of thirty million officers and soldiers. Riding the true qi of Mars, they descend through the floating void to alight upon this altar ground. From the southeast corner, I seal the boundary to the southwest corner. The marching deities deploy their qi, scouring for evil spirits. Burn and consume demonic thieves—those guilty shall know no pardon.

Then, performing the Yu Step—three steps, nine traces—from the southeast to the southwest, I face north and recite the incantation:

I invoke the White Emperor of the West, the White Youth Lord, and their retinue of seventy million officers and soldiers. Riding the true qi of Venus, they descend through the floating void to alight upon this altar ground. From the southwest corner, I seal the boundary to the northwest corner. The marching deities deploy their qi, scouring for evil spirits. Execute and behead demonic thieves—those guilty shall know no pardon.

Then, performing the Yu Step—three steps, nine traces—from the southwest to the northwest, I face east and recite the incantation:

I invoke the Black Emperor of the North, the Black Youth Lord, and their retinue of fifty million officers and soldiers. Riding the true qi of Mercury, they descend through the floating void to alight upon this altar ground. From the northwest corner, I seal the boundary to the center. The marching deities deploy their qi, scouring for evil spirits. Drown and sweep away demonic thieves—those guilty shall know no pardon.

Then, performing the Yu Step—three steps, nine traces—from the southeast, I face the altar’s heart and recite the incantation:

I invoke the Yellow Emperor of the Center, the Yellow Youth Lord, and their twelve myriad yellow-robed soldiers. Riding the true qi of Saturn, they descend through the floating void to alight upon this altar ground. From above, I seal the boundary to the altar’s center. The marching deities deploy their qi, scouring for evil spirits. Bury and conceal demonic thieves—those guilty shall know no pardon.

Then, proceeding in order to the northeast, I face north and recite the incantation:

Today, I act on behalf of so-and-so official, so-and-so person, to perform the Great Yellow Register Fast, conducting the Dao in accordance with the ritual statutes.

I invoke the celestial immortals’ legions—nine hundred million cavalry; the terrestrial immortals’ legions—nine hundred million cavalry; the flying immortals’ legions—nine hundred million cavalry; the perfected beings’ legions—nine hundred million cavalry; the divine beings’ legions—nine hundred million cavalry; the legions of the sun, moon, and stellar lodgings—each nine hundred million cavalry; the legions of the Nine Palaces and Five Emperors—each nine hundred million cavalry; the legions of the Three Rivers and Four Seas—each nine hundred million cavalry; the legions of the Five Peaks and Four Waterways—each nine hundred million cavalry. All array themselves in strict formation, advancing in unbroken ranks, their advance shaking the wind and raising thunder, their banners boiling the rain and surging the clouds. As one, they descend to alight upon the altar ground. Circling the altar thrice, they cover it threefold. Above, they spread the celestial net; below, they lay the earthly snare. The Nine Lands unite in effort as the legions and cavalry array themselves within and without the altar precincts, on all four sides and eight directions. All earthly and wooden spirits, lingering corpses and stale qi—every inauspicious impurity that defies the Dao—shall be seized and consigned beneath the Demon-Quelling Star. Plunged ten thousand fathoms into the earth, they shall stir no more, act no more. Swiftly, swiftly, in accordance with the statutes of the Most High Lord Lao!

Upon the Earth Gate, I inscribe the character for "ghost," plant the sword into the ghost’s heart, sprinkle water, lower my hands, clench my fists, and facing the Ghost Gate, recite the incantation:

The Nine Heavens issue their decree, proclaiming it to the myriad spirits. Hasten to summon the celestial perfected, all to assemble in the imperial court. The Great Unity descends, the Twin Stars escort their essence. They oversee and suppress evil, govern qi and sustain life. Should any inauspicious force test the divine, by the Dao of the Emperor’s command, I marshal the divine soldiers. Seven spirits wield their axes, the Celestial Blade advances to the right. Brandishing the sword, they lead the charge, hurling fire bells. I dispatch the edict to the armored couriers, the tiger soldiers and celestial warriors. Wind and fire join in battle, vanquishing the cunning spirits of evil. Above, they overawe the Six Heavens; below, they subdue demonic spirits. Once awed, once subdued, the myriad evils are annihilated. The divine halberd sweeps like lightning, leaving no trace of wickedness or demonic beings. The Immortal Sovereign raises his standard—those who dare delay the command shall be executed. Defy the standard, violate the command, and your form shall be destroyed. Be vigilant, be cautious, to preserve this Yellow Tranquility. The Nine Heavens proclaim their decree—let all spirits heed with reverence!

Next, the *Huaxia Hymn of Praise* is sung, guiding the Dharma Master to circumambulate from the Earth Gate and ascend the altar. The *Ritual of Lamp Veneration* begins with the *Hymn to the Study of Immortality*, leading the Dharma Master out of the hall. Then, the *Hymn to the Bright Lamp* is chanted, guiding the Dharma Master to circumambulate the bright lamp, stand upon the Earth Gate, form ranks, and bow in prayer.

The Perfected of the Supreme Ultimate and Great Void declares: Yin and yang establish their symbols; heaven and earth divide their forms. Day and night differ, darkness and light diverge. Thus, the pure and ethereal manifest their essence, and the myriad heavens become the abodes of the sagely and divine; the turbid and dense flow into form, and the myriad earths become the domains of ghosts and spirits. Above the Nine Heavens, yin qi is wholly dispelled; below the Nine Earths, the light of yang is forever cut off. This is the boundary of the netherworld, where no light remains. At the time of painted scenes, it is like a dense fog; after dusk, the gloom deepens. The sinful souls of the long night have no means to find brightness. Some beings, devoid of good karma and burdened with past sins, have since their death sunk into hell, enduring myriad torments and confined in Fengdu. Deprived of the Three Lights, they suffer for countless kalpas. Our Heavenly Worthy, in great compassion, opens many gates of salvation. He bestows the scripture of the kindled lamp to continue the light and illuminate the night. Where the numinous radiance reaches, sins and afflictions are all dispelled. Through the opportunity of repentance and deliverance, the wish for rebirth is fulfilled.

If there are good men and good women who awaken the supreme Dao-mind, follow the ritual codes, and come to the fast, bringing fragrant oil to kindle lamps for the emperor, his ministers, parents, and children—through the Three Paths and Nine Nights, whether in darkness or light—then, in accordance with the Dharma, they shall light lamps to illuminate within and without. Above, these lamps shall shine upon the heavens and the halls of fortune; below, they shall illuminate the Nine Earths and the depths of hell. Thus, suffering souls shall be delivered, the benighted shall see the light, the nine generations of ancestors shall ascend to heaven, and the Three Paths shall be freed from darkness. Blessings shall extend to all, and merit shall be boundless. Know that those who perform such deeds accumulate good karma over kalpas and shall surely attain the Dao.

Now, so-and-so conducts the Great Yellow Register Fast, following the scriptural texts to kindle lamps in offering. May the emperor enjoy blessings, the Two Luminaries shine brightly. May the seven generations of ancestors ascend to heaven, and the Three Paths be serene. In this life, may the divine and sagely protect and uphold them, their fortune towering high, and may they forever ascend to the immortal realms.

The disciple bows twice.

The *Perfected Immortals of the Upper Prime Golden Register Scriptural Texts* state: For the *Ritual of Lamp Kindling*, upon the Dao Gate, kindle two lamps to illuminate the dwelling of the fast’s sponsor, to dispel calamities and deliver from misfortune, and to pacify and secure the household deities. Beneath the lamps, the disciple bows three times and recites the incantation to the Dharma Master:

The true light of the Orthodox Unity blazes upward in vermilion smoke. Twelve Light-Opening Lads thoroughly illuminate this dwelling and my own body. A hundred evils are shattered, ten thousand ghosts repelled. The radiance is bright and clear, connecting with the divine and reaching the numinous. Ascending into the formless, it unites with the Dao’s spontaneity.

The *Perfected Immortals of the Upper Prime Golden Register Scriptural Texts* state: For the *Ritual of Lamp Kindling*, upon the sponsor’s life destiny, kindle three lamps to illuminate the three souls, to restrain evil and deliver from misfortune, and to bind and guard the three souls. Beneath the lamps, the disciple bows three times and recites the incantation:

The yang light thoroughly illuminates, and the three souls naturally arise. They gather the myriad spirits, forever attaching to my form. Like the sun and moon sharing their radiance, may I forever preserve this without decline.

The *Perfected Immortals of the Upper Prime Golden Register Scriptural Texts* state: For the *Ritual of Lamp Kindling*, upon the sponsor’s current year, kindle seven lamps to illuminate the seven po, to pacify the spirit and avert calamity, and to restrain the po and expel evil. Beneath the lamps, the disciple bows three times and recites the incantation:

The bright lamp gathers its light, and the wandering spirits do not flee. The seven po are secure, and the myriad spirits all return. Like the sun at its zenith, may I forever dwell in radiance.

The *Perfected Immortals of the Upper Prime Golden Register Scriptural Texts* state: For the *Ritual of Lamp Kindling*, upon the Year Star, kindle one lamp to illuminate the spirit of the Year Star, to dispel the sponsor’s yearly calamities and usher in blessings and fortune.

The disciple bows three times beneath the lamps and recites the incantation:

The radiance of the Great Sun flows forth, its flames illuminating the four directions. It penetrates my body, traversing the seven wefts and nine depths. Within it shines brightly, without it glows clearly, piercing through the vastness of the Great Void.

The *Perfected Immortals of the Upper Prime Golden Register Scriptural Texts* state: For the *Ritual of Lamp Kindling*, upon the great ancestral tomb, kindle three lamps to illuminate the sponsor’s ancestral burial mounds across generations, to deliver and ascend the departed souls of former lives, to sever karmic entanglements in litigation, and to dissolve the calamities of retributive cycles. The disciple bows three times beneath the lamps toward the great tomb.

The incantation of *Gong, Yu, Chen, Shang, Chou, Jue, Wei, Zhi, Xu* is recited:
The Great Sun is shrouded in darkness, boundless kalpas without end. The radiance of yang light shines brilliantly, descending to illuminate the decayed remains. The soul receives the light, and its spirit is reborn. Attaining birth in the royal gate, joy and bliss abound.

The *Perfected Immortals of the Upper Prime Golden Register Scriptural Texts* state: For the *Ritual of Lamp Kindling*, upon the lesser tomb, kindle five lamps to illuminate the sponsor’s recent ancestral burial mounds, to deliver and ascend the divine souls, that they may be born in the heavenly realms, to benefit and protect the living, and to prosper blessings and fortune. The disciple bows three times beneath the lamps toward the tomb.

The incantation of *Gong, Yu, Xu, Shang, Wei, Jue, Chou, Zhi, Chen* is recited:
In the long night of the netherworld, boundless kalpas remain unopened. The light lies hidden in the Great Yin, and the seven *po* drift astray. The Vermilion Spirit Youths and the radiance of the Great Sun shine brilliantly. Illuminating the gate of the *po*, the divine souls are reunited.

The *Perfected Immortals of the Upper Prime Golden Register Scriptural Texts* state: For the *Ritual of Lamp Kindling*, in the central courtyard, kindle seven lamps to illuminate the seven generations of ancestors—father and mother—so that the suffering souls in darkness may be born in the heavenly realms. The disciple bows three times beneath the lamps toward the earthly gate and recites the incantation:

Heaven and earth revolve, succeeding one another in turn. The Nine Netherworlds lack light, and the seven generations remain unopened. The Great Sun bestows deliverance, and the dead souls respond in return. The bright lamps continue through the night, and the decayed remains shine with radiance.

The *Perfected Immortals of the Upper Prime Golden Register Scriptural Texts* state: For the *Ritual of Lamp Kindling*, in the central courtyard, kindle the lamps of the Nine Netherworlds to illuminate the long-night abode of the Nine Netherworlds, to deliver the disciple’s departed souls from within, that they may behold the light. The disciple bows three times beneath the lamps toward the *Xu-Si* southwest direction and recites the incantation:

The Nine Netherworlds are shrouded in darkness, boundless kalpas without light. The long night imprisons the souls, and the Primordial Beginning remains unopened. The resplendent lamps continue the light, descending to illuminate the Earthly Sovereign. Delivering the Seven Mysteries, they ascend to the Southern Palace. Illuminating the entire household, may generations become immortal kings.

The *Perfected Immortals of the Upper Prime Golden Register Scriptural Texts* state: For the *Ritual of Lamp Kindling*, at the side gates, kindle two lamps to illuminate the official residence, to expel evil and capture malevolence for the disciple, and to protect the entire household. The disciple bows three times beneath the lamps toward the south and recites the incantation:

The radiance of yang light unfolds, vermilion mist blazing brilliantly. The Great Flame Youths guard the mysterious gates. Illuminating the palace and residence, the four windows and eight doors open wide. Driving away ghosts and capturing evil, the myriad spirits are vanquished. The Three Realms reverently protect, enduring through generations without decline. The assembly of Perfected Ones gathers, and sun and moon shine together.

The *Perfected Immortals of the Upper Prime Golden Register Scriptural Texts* state: For the *Ritual of Lamp Kindling*, upon the earthly gate, kindle twenty-four lamps to illuminate the twenty-four vital breaths of life, to extend the disciple’s lifespan and augment their *qi*, to increase blessings and pacify the spirit, to inscribe their name in the register of the living, and to erase it from the ledger of the dead. The disciple bows three times beneath the lamps toward the earthly gate and recites the incantation:

The Three Divisions and Eight Effulgences unite to form my body. The twenty-four *qi* constitute my spirit. The bright lamps are first kindled, opening the Supreme Mystery above. My body transcends water and fire, harmonizing with *qi* naturally. The Eight Effulgences shine together—may I attain immortality.

The *Perfected Immortals of the Upper Prime Golden Register Scriptural Texts* state: For the *Ritual of Lamp Kindling*, in the eight directions, kindle eight lamps to illuminate the Eight Trigrams, to illuminate the eight reaches for the disciple, to open the nine palaces of perception, to secretly guard the eight spirits, and to unblock the eight directions. The disciple bows three times beneath the lamps toward the *Wang* direction and recites the incantation:

The Three Effulgences shine brilliantly, and the Eight Trigrams open their windows. The heavenly *qi* is serene and sealed, the Great Yin conceals its light. The resplendent lamps illuminate the darkness, and the ten thousand wishes are unblocked. My body enters the radiant splendor, forever enjoying boundless abundance.

The *Perfected Immortals of the Upper Prime Golden Register Scriptural Texts* state: For the *Ritual of Lamp Kindling*, in the four directions and the center, kindle nine lamps to illuminate the Nine Palaces, to deliver the disciple from the calamities of the Nine Palaces and inscribe their name among the immortals of the Nine Palaces. The disciple bows three times beneath the lamps toward the center and recites the incantation:

The positions of the Nine-Five unfold, and heaven and earth open wide. The mysterious light lies hidden, the Great Yin and Great Yang. Illuminating with my resplendent lamps, they ascend to shine upon the Nine Palaces. The mysterious night unfolds brightly—may my wishes be auspicious.

The *Perfected Immortals of the Upper Prime Golden Register Scriptural Texts* state: For the *Ritual of Lamp Kindling*, in the ten directions, kindle ten lamps to illuminate the ten directions, to illuminate the ten extremities for the disciple, to summon the Perfected and descend the spirits, to resolve calamities, and to inscribe their name in the Ten Heavens. The disciple bows three times beneath the lamps toward the Heavenly Gate and recites the incantation:

Heaven opens and earth closes, the mysterious yin remains unilluminated. The vermilion mist blazes upward, opening the netherworld for me. The honored spirits of the ten directions mystically observe my form. Soul and *po* shine together, naturally radiant in essence.

The *Perfected Immortals of the Upper Prime Golden Register Scriptural Texts* state: For the *Ritual of Lamp Kindling*, in the four directions, kindle twenty-eight lamps to illuminate the Twenty-Eight Constellations, to erase the disciple’s name from the ledger of the dead, to augment their name in the register of the living, to fall death under the Northern Dipper, and to extend life under the Southern Dipper. The disciple bows three times beneath the lamps toward the southeast and recites the incantation:

The bright stars blaze brilliantly, their light flowing through the ten gates. The mysterious essence descends, and the Nine Netherworlds remain unopened. I kindle the resplendent lamps, riding the light upward to be heard. May I attain the pure canopy to illuminate my form and soul.

The *Perfected Immortals of the Upper Prime Golden Register Scriptural Texts* state: For the *Ritual of Lamp Kindling*, upon the Heavenly Gate, kindle thirty-six lamps to illuminate the Thirty-Six Heavens, to deliver and ascend the disciple’s ancestral fathers and mothers into the heavenly realms.

Beneath the lamps, the disciple faces the Heavenly Gate, bows three times, and recites the incantation:

The Dragon Han flows boundlessly, the Three Qi ride the mysterious.
The Brahmanic practice stretches afar, encompassing the vast trichiliocosm.
The long soul, eternal and vast, gazes upward in endless reverence.
Today, with these bright lamps, I vow to attain immortality.
May my seven ancestors ascend with me to the celestial realms.

The *Perfected Immortals of the Upper Prime Golden Register Scriptural Texts* state: For the *Ritual of Lamp Kindling*, in the five directions, kindle five lamps to illuminate the Five Quarters, to inscribe the disciple’s name in the immortal register and safeguard their form.

Beneath the lamps, the disciple faces the five directions, bows three times, and recites the incantation:

The sacred mountains of the Five Peaks stand firm, anchoring the Five Quarters.
The Five August Thearchs, revered deities, are the wellspring of immortals.
Today, with these kindled lamps, their light ascends to illuminate the Heavenly Kings.
May my name be recorded in the celestial registers, and may I be delivered into the immortal ranks.
May my seven ancestors be liberated, ascending together into the Great Void.

The *Perfected Immortals of the Upper Prime Golden Register Scriptural Texts* state: The *Ritual of Lamp Kindling* carries the utmost merit. Its light illumines the heavens above and brightens the earth below. For eight directions and nine nights, all behold its radiance. Those who witness these lamps shall have their sins extinguished and blessings arise. The host of this lamp-kindling accrues profound fortune. Their nine generations of ancestors shall ascend to the celestial halls, forever departing sorrow and suffering, eternally freed from the Nine Netherworlds, and roam joyfully within the Upper Prime Immortal Palaces. The living shall dwell in peace, descendants flourish, households remain pure and serene, and myriad calamities be averted. The departed shall be delivered, the living and dead alike bear gratitude. Its merit is boundless, and all aspirations shall be fulfilled. For families and nations, all shall attain prosperity and harmony. For nine nights and the Three Wretched Realms, all shall ascend to the true Dao.

The method of lamp-kindling incantations is recorded in the *Upper Prime Golden Register Scriptural Texts*. When Du Guangcheng’s rites conclude, and the *Falling Twilight Dao Procession* is complete, the master leads the assembled officials and disciples in circumambulating beneath the lamps, reciting the incantations according to their positions. After each recitation, the officials and disciples bow in reverence. The *Retaining Tranquility* and *Lamp Invocation* should precede the *Stellar Petition*, though it is also fitting to perform them afterward. It is best to offer prayers each night. If the master’s strength is insufficient, the attendant scripture-keepers or lamp-tenders may perform the rites on their behalf. Disciples shall remain outside the main gate for their prostrations. Next, recite the *Eulogy of Goodness*, followed by the *Hymn of Immortal Study*, leading the assembly back before the Original Master to disperse according to the usual rites.

The *Upper Prime Golden Register’s* "Perfected Immortals" section states: In the *Lamp-Lighting Rites of Dignity*, the officials attending the lamps must apply themselves with diligence. They shall ensure the lamp’s light remains bright and unbroken, never extinguished midway. If the light dims unevenly, it severs one from the world of the living—this must always be guarded against.

The *Upper Prime Golden Register’s* "Perfected Immortals" section further states: In the *Lamp-Lighting Rites of Dignity*, the lamps are extinguished at dawn. The master recites the incantation:
*"Mysterious Yin unfolds its radiance,
The eternal lamp renews its light.
The Great Yang now shines resplendent,
The Eight Dark Realms open in clarity.
The lamp returns to Great Yin,
Its light merging with the luminous essence.
The Two Perfected of Sun and Moon
Unite with me in oneness."*
Upon completion of the incantation, the lamps are extinguished.

---

**Investiture of the Dragon and Jade Ritual**

Proceed to the Grotto-Heaven, and outside its gate, select level ground—or a boat, or a stone surface. All must be swept clean and made pure to establish the altar. Prepare five mats of refined cloth and two ritual towels. Blue and crimson cloths may be used for offering wine, tea, or broth, with five sets of vessels. Fruits, cakes, and viands shall be provided according to what is available. For the state, sixty portions; for officials and commoners, twenty-four. Arrange four incense burners, four censer cloths, and four tables. At the center, set the Three Treasures’ position; to the left, the Grotto-Heaven’s divine immortals; to the right, the Day-Officer Earth Deity and the Surveillance Deities, along with the master’s memorial-filing position. Once the arrangements are complete, sprinkle the altar’s exterior with fragrant water to dispel impurities and perform the exorcism as in the usual rites.

Master and disciples must bathe and purify themselves, prioritizing reverence. Negligence, clamor, or irreverence shall incur severe penalties. Next, the assembly is called to bow, each venerating the master and visualizing as prescribed. Then, invoke the Three Honored Ones, the Scripture Treasure’s Mystic Master, the Five Stars and Five Emperors, the Five Peaks and Five Visceral Spirits, the Five Numinous Ones, and the Three-Colored Clouds of the Scripture Transmission Masters. Envision the local Grotto-Heaven’s perfected immortals, the divine administrators, the surveillance officials, and the Day-Officer Earth Deity seated solemnly in formation, their ranks distinct. Once the visualization of the fast is complete, proceed according to the ritual statutes.

**Method for Presenting the Mountain Memorial**
First, outside the Grotto-Heaven’s gate, arrange the altar. Bow to the master and visualize the deities as in the original method. Each then venerates the master and visualizes as prescribed.
Next, recite the *Guardian Spirit Incantation*.
Then, strike the ritual drum twenty-four times.
Proceed to the *Incense Offering*.

Supreme Three Heavens’ Primordial Originator of the Three Qi, Most High Lord Lao, summon forth from within our bodies the Three and Five Merit Officers, the Left and Right Attendant Envoys, the Left and Right Incense-Bearing Dragon-Riding Couriers, the Golden Lads Attending Incense, the Jade Maidens Scattering Flowers and Transmitting Words, and the Five Thearchs’ Direct Talismans and Daily Incense Officials—thirty-six of each—forthwith. Let those who emerge don their solemn regalia and report to the local Earth Deity and the True Officials of the Realm. We now, in this very act of burning incense, reverently perform this rite for [Name/Official Title], on behalf of [Matter], beseeching the establishment of the Supreme Yellow Register Grand Fast. May the rite be perfected and the matter concluded, that we may present this memorial to the numinous mountain.

For the water memorial: may it become a numinous spring.
For the earth memorial: may it become a numinous altar.
We pray that the qi of the Most High’s Ten Directions’ True Perfected Ones descend and flow into our bodies, that our petition swiftly ascend to the presence of the Most High’s Boundless Great Dao, before the Kunlun and Five Peaks, the numinous mountains and grotto-heavens.

Each makes three bows.

For the water memorial: before the Most High’s Boundless Great Dao, the Divine King of Yang Valley, and the Water Thearchs of the Nine Rivers’ Water Palace.
For the earth memorial: before the Most High’s Boundless Great Dao, the August Spirits of the Nine Lands, and the Great Gods of the Earth Palace.

Next, each declares their ritual rank.

Having assumed their ritual ranks, they proceed with the Yellow Register Dragon-Presentation Rite. Your servant [Name] humbly petitions the Great Luo’s Jade Clarity, the Boundless and Supreme Perfected Great Dao, the Primordial Celestial Worthy of Original Commencement, the Most High Dao Lord, the Most High Lord Lao, the Thirty-Six Divisions of Venerable Scriptures, the Great Dharma Masters of the Mystic Realm, the Three Treasures’ Sacred Assembly, and all the Venerable Numinous Ones. We reverently hope for their radiant response, that they may condescend to descend in mercy.

Kneeling with heads bowed, we humbly petition the immortals of [Name] Grotto-Heaven, the grotto-heaven’s divine administrators, and the perfected ones who have attained the Dao. We implore their true mercy, that they may cast their light downward.

We reverently summon the local governing deities, the Void-Space Surveillance Officials, the Incense Officials and Envoys, the Three Caverns’ Divine Might, the Realm’s True Officials, the Guardian Generals and Officers, and all the rightful gods of mountains, waters, rivers, and marshes. We beseech their sagely mercy, that they may descend in full attendance.

Next, three pinches of incense are offered, followed by tea and wine.

Then, kneeling in prostration, the invocation is made.

Your Majesty, we reverently summon the Most High Boundless Dao’s Three Supreme Ones, the great holy multitudes of the ten directions who have attained the Dao, the perfected lords and venerable elders, the Eastern Florescence and Southern Culmen, the Western Numinous and Northern Perfected, the thirty-six divisions of revered scriptures, the Great Dharma Masters of the Mysterious Center, the True Persons of the Great Ultimate, the Three True Persons of the Mysterious Unity, the divine immortals of the heavens’ sun, moon, and stellar lodges, the gods and immortals of the Kunlun Upper Palace, the Golden Mother of the Western Numinous, the True Lords of the Five Marchmounts, the rightful officers of the Sacred Mountain, the Hidden and Huo Reservoir Lords, the Venerable Elder of Mount Qingcheng, the Envoys of Mount Lu, the secluded ones of Mount Zhong’s lofty peaks, the western Mysterious Ramparts and Terrace, the great deities of the mounded hills, the Northern Bureau of the Three Officials, the Six Palaces’ Nether Offices, the gods of heaven above and earth below, the numinous hosts of the dark underworld, the Registrars of Life and Death, the Southern Upper Three Gates, and all the supremely divine and numinous host of immortals.

Your servant, born of dust and defilement, is blind and ignorant. Yet by the good karma of ten thousand kalpas, I have depended upon and received the transformation of the Dao. Reverently proclaiming the merciful teachings, I assist the state and establish merit, succoring beings and delivering persons, guiding and aiding the Dharma. On behalf of so-and-so official so-and-so, I have performed the grand Yellow Register fast, directly offering it for so-and-so and universally for all souls, both living and deceased, repenting sins and seeking grace. May offenses and transgressions be dissolved, and the ritual be wholly accomplished. The petition is entrusted to the Sacred Mountain, conveyed by the golden dragon courier. We beseech that names be stricken from the ledgers of sin and inscribed in the Jade Calendar. May the gods and immortals release the ninefold ancestors and sevenfold forebears, the nine clans and all kin, those who have passed before and after, redeeming their evil roots and delivering them from Mount Fengdu and the Terrace of Tai, the twenty-four hells, the courts of the Five Marchmounts, the nine nether realms, the mountains of knives and forests of swords, the lands of suffering and affliction. May their souls behold the light and forever receive deliverance, turning the wheel to receive transformation and roaming freely through the gates of blessing. May their tombs rest undisturbed, lawsuits cease, the whole household receive fortune, and all be laden with grace. May demonic influences be eradicated, auspicious omens arise daily, the cultivation of the Dao attain perfection, and all forever ascend to the ranks of immortals. Should this petition be granted, we shall look up in reverence to the mysterious grace.

Your servant so-and-so, with utmost trepidation and awe, bows his head to the ground, prostrates himself, and respectfully submits this entreaty.

Rising, he holds the petition and offers incense upon the inkstone. Next, having read the petition to its end, he seals it with blue paper and binds it with green silk, completing the dragon-button jade tablet. The disciple holds it above the incense, and the Dharma Master intones the incantation:

"Mysterious Above, open and illumine; the Primordial Beginning oversees the true.
The Five Elders of the Supreme Emperor, the red writ of cinnabar script.
The origin of heaven and earth, governing the Three Primes in their entirety.
Gather qi and summon the assembly, hastening the ascent of immortals.
The exalted talisman and mandate, universally proclaimed to the ten heavens.
Sun, moon, and stellar lodges, the numinous Marchmounts and Sacred Mountain.
Above in heaven, below on earth, the great gods of the dark and cold.
Registrars of Life and Death, the Southern Upper Three Gates.
Receive the jade petition, inscribe names in the cinnabar register.
Strike from the ledgers of sin, promote to the ranks of imperial ministers.
So-and-so, relying upon the supreme Dao, performs the fast and establishes merit,
redeeming the nine ancestors and all suffering souls.
The ritual now complete, we reverently follow the Sacred Mountain’s decree,
presenting the jade petition to beseech the erasure of sin.
May all receive deliverance, without enmity or kinship.
Depart from the three evil destinies, souls ascend to the nine heavens.
Delivered in life and death, eternally preserved through ten thousand kalpas.
Today we make this supplication, may the myriad gods all hear."

We beseech that the Dragon Tablet, the *Jade Instructions*, and the *Dragon Tablet Admonitions* be bound with golden clasps, and presented to the covenant-keeping Perfected Officials. May the petition be granted as supplicated, transmitted by the Golden Dragon Courier.

The incantation complete, all officials bow twice.
Next, the tablet is cast into the grotto.
Next, the *Dragon Tablet Eulogy* is recited.
Next, three prostrations.
Next, three offerings of incense.
Next, the incense burner is replenished.
Next, the *Hymn to the Immortals* is chanted.
Next, the offerings are withdrawn.

**Rite of Casting the Water Tablet**
Reverently attend to the master’s contemplation.
Recite the *Guardian Spirit Incantation*.
Strike the ritual drum.
Open the incense burner.
Proclaim the dharma rank.
Summon the Perfected.
Present tea and wine.

Next, kneel and address:
