Your servant reverently petitions the Most High Boundless Great Dao, the Three Supreme Ones of the Great Dao, the host of great sages who have attained the Way in the ten directions, the perfected lords and venerable masters, the Eastern Florescence and Southern Culmen, the Western Numinous and Northern Perfected, the thirty-six divisions of sacred scriptures, the Great Dharma Master of the Mysterious Center, the Perfected of the Supreme Ultimate, the sun and moon, the Five Stars, the Seven Primes of the Northern Dipper, the Five Peaks and Four Quarters, the sun’s cavern of eternal radiance, the grotto-valleys and dark recesses, the Divine Kings of the Immortals, the Great Emperor of Fusang, the Nine Elder Lords of the Immortal Capital, the Three Rivers and Four Seas, the Nine Jiang and Huai Marshes, the Three Officials and Nine Bureaus, the Twelve Water Sources and Nine Water Lords, the great gods of the dark and cold, the host of immortals of the water palaces, and all assembled spirits.

Your servant, born in the lower realm, is endowed with a humble and common constitution. Yet by karmic affinity with the Dao, I have encountered this sagely dispensation. The Numinous Treasure bestows its transformation, the Great Dharma delivers beings, assisting the state and establishing merit, upholding the compassionate teachings. Today, on behalf of the official So-and-so, I have performed the supreme Yellow Register Great Fast, offering deliverance for the departed spirit So-and-so, universally encompassing the living and the dead, praying for grace and atoning for sins, beseeching blessings and dispelling calamities. May enmities be resolved, and life and fortune be prolonged. The ritual now complete, we cast the tablet into the numinous spring, transmitted by the Golden Dragon Courier. We beseech the erasure from the ledgers of death and the inscription of life. May the gods and immortals grant renewal. May the nine ancestors and seven generations be delivered from the roots of suffering, departing the radiant valleys and the dark, cold realms of the netherworld. Bathed and refined, may they ascend to the heavens. May tombs be peaceful and auspicious, and all misfortunes forever obliterated. May the entire household receive blessings, their spirits and qi at rest and flourishing. May learning and understanding be illuminated, wisdom perfected and radiant. May the true Dharma be proclaimed, and treacherous villains subdued. May the three realms attain deliverance, merits fulfilled and deeds complete. May the emperor be secure and the state prosper. We reverently present this petition, beseeching that it be granted as supplicated.

Your servant So-and-so, with awe and trepidation, bows his head and prostrates himself, twice bowing reverently to address.

The address complete, kneel.
Knock the teeth thrice, and read the tablet inscription to its end.
Seal the tablet with blue paper, binding the Dragon Tablet and jade clasp with blue silk.

Instruct the disciple to hold it over the incense and recite the incantation:
The Five Elders of the Primordial Beginning, the Most High and Venerable.
The perfected of the ten directions, the numinous immortals of Mount Taihua.
The red script proclaims the mandate, no hidden realm left unaddressed.
Above, it ascends to the nine heavens, beseeching the descent of the jade missive.
The sun and moon, the Five Stars, the Seven Primes of the Northern Dipper.
It petitions the Five Peaks at the center, the numinous mountains of the four quarters.
Below, it petitions the rivers and seas, the twelve water sources.
The Nine Water Lords, the great gods of the dark and cold.
Today we present this supplication, may all wishes be declared.
So-and-so has performed the fast and practiced the Dao, universally for the living and the dead.
We beseech redemption for the seven ancestors, and the dissolution of karmic roots of sin.
Reverently casting the earthen tablet, may it be heard above.
Inscribe names in the water palace, may the departed ascend to heaven.
Delivered in life and death, may all gods hear.

We beseech that the Dragon Tablet, with the *Jade Instructions* bound by golden clasps, be presented to the covenant-keeping Water Officials. May the *Jade Instructions* serve as the pledge to the Water Officials. Grant as supplicated, the *Jade Instructions* serving as the petition. Transmitted by the Golden Dragon Courier.

The incantation complete, all officials bow twice.
Next, cast the tablet into the water.
Next, recite the *Dragon Tablet Eulogy*.
Next, three prostrations.
Next, three offerings of incense.
Next, replenish the incense burner.
Next, chant the *Hymn to the Immortals*.

Next, the offerings are cleared, dispersed according to the usual method. The *Earthen Tablet Casting Rite* proceeds as follows:

Invoke the master’s mindfulness, recite the *Guardian Spirit Incantation*, strike the ritual drum, and kindle the incense burner. Next, declare the dharma ranks and invoke the perfected. Offer tea and wine.

Next, kneel and make the petition:

Your humble servant reverently addresses the Most High, Boundless Dao, the Three Supreme Ones of the Great Dao; the host of great sages who have attained the Way in the ten directions; the perfected lords and venerable elders; the Eastern Florescence, Southern Culmen, Western Numinous, and Northern Perfected; the Five Elder Thearchs; the thirty-six divisions of revered scriptures; the Great Dharma Master of the Mysterious Center; the Perfected of the Supreme Ultimate; the Three Perfected of the Mysterious Unity; the Great Thearch of Fengdu; the sovereigns of the nine provinces’ palaces and the lords of the Yellow Springs; the imperial numina of the boundless world and the nine lands of the August Spirits; the Central August of the Seasonal Thearchs and the High Perfected; the Yellow Spirit of Earth of the nine lands; the Five Thearchs of the Earthly Bureau; the officials and spirits of the Three Realms; the local deities of land and domain; and all numinous beings of this abode and oratory.

Your servant, born of common qi and foolish by nature, has by karmic fortune encountered the true Dharma and met with good causes and conditions. At the opening of the numinous treasure’s radiance and the proclamation of the *Red Writ*, I was permitted, despite my humble and defiled state, to serve the true and perfected. Aiding the state and the times, I establish merit and propagate the teachings.

On behalf of the official so-and-so, who has undertaken the great *Yellow Register* fast, I offer this to deliver the departed spirit so-and-so, universally encompassing the living and the dead, dispelling calamities and atoning for sins. Having supplicated for blessings and grace, the Daoist rites are now complete. The tablet is cast upon the numinous altar, transmitted by the Golden Dragon Courier. I beseech that earthly misfortunes be erased and their names stricken from the rolls of sin. May they attain deliverance and rebirth, their forms and spirits safeguarded. May their names be inscribed in the *Jade Calendar* of the Nine Elder Immortals’ capital. May the nine generations of ancestors, parents, and kin of the womb; the departed and the newly deceased; all partake of blessed causes. May they depart from the nine depths below, the eight gates, the hells, and the midst of torment. May their transgressions dissolve, their households be purified and at peace. May the roots of evil be severed, and may they ascend to the halls of fortune. May so-and-so’s studies be perfected and their merit and conduct resplendent. May the living and the dead share in this blessing, steadfast and unshaken. May the emperor receive fortune and the world know peace.

I reverently make this petition, beseeching your compassionate response. Your servant so-and-so, with awe and trepidation, bows his head to the ground, prostrates twice, and humbly submits.

The petition complete, kneel once more. Strike the teeth twelve times and read the tablet’s inscription. Next, seal the tablet with yellow paper, bind it with plain silk, and affix the dragon clasp and jade disk. Have a disciple hold it above the incense and recite the incantation:

The heavens and earth unfold, the nine qi divide their numen.
The Three Origins share the same tally, the ten directions shine in clarity.
The Five Elder Thearchs open the true and guide the living.
The cinnabar writ and red script, the primordial essence of the Most High.
Universally proclaimed beneath heaven, the imperial numina of the nine lands.
Today, I make this supplication, and the myriad immortals decree life.
So-and-so undertakes the fast and practices the Dao for the living and the dead.
I vow for my immortals: may their jade names be cast.
Great Thearch of the Earthly Bureau, erase their sinful forms.
Submit the tablet to the upper palace, inscribe their names in the *Flourishing Azure* register.
May they swiftly ascend, their numen shared by heaven and earth.
May the nine generations of kin, their rotting bones, be renewed in glory.
May their souls ascend to the Southern Palace and receive transformation in the immortal courts.
Today, I issue this decree—may all gods hear.
Hear and grant peace; the *Dragon Tablet Petition* reads: "hear" as "grant."
With the golden clasp, I manifest utmost sincerity.
Grant as supplicated, presented by the Golden Dragon Courier.

The incantation complete, all officials bow twice.
Next, cast the tablet into the center of the altar’s earth.
Next, recite the *Dragon Tablet Eulogy*.
Next, three prostrations.
Next, three offerings of incense.
Next, replenish the incense burner.
Next, chant the *Hymn to the Immortals*.

Next, the offerings are cleared, dispersed as in the usual rites.

For the *Earth Tablet*, on the night of the merit-concluding rite, once the recitation of incantations and hymns is complete, by dawn it may be buried within the altar—no further petition or announcement is required.

Here, from the ritual method of Master Zhang Chengxian, three tablets are presented in petition, each corresponding to a distinct true rank; thus they are recorded again. If performing a *zhai* rite with the *Earth Tablet*, it may be cast immediately after the incantation is recited at the merit-concluding *jiao*. As for the *Mountain* and *Water Tablets*, though the incantation is recited at the time of the merit-concluding rite, if a *jiao* is later established at the grotto site, one must follow this sequence in full: each tablet is recited, sealed with its incantation, and then cast—this is thorough and complete. One must not, having already petitioned at the altar, proceed directly to cast them at the mountain. The true numina of those places may fail to receive and acknowledge them. The merit may not reach its destination, and the loss would be grave; one must be meticulous and prudent.

The reason for petitioning these *Mountain* and *Water Tablets* at the altar is that the *zhai* sponsor and disciples, bound by public and private affairs, may be unable to journey in person to the grotto heavens. Thus, they are petitioned together at the altar. If the *zhai* sponsor and disciples do not shrink from the distance of mountains and waters or the toil of ascent, and personally accompany the officials to the grotto palace, then at the time of the merit-concluding rite, after the memorial is presented and the *Earth Tablet* petitioned, the *Mountain* and *Water Tablets* are retained for the journey. The ritual will then be even more fitting. One must act with careful deliberation.

When handling the three tablets, it is most excellent to burn one or two hundred paper coins for the local earth gods—this ensures the documents are not obstructed.

Master Daoist Zhang Chengxian of the Tang said: After ascending the altar and receiving the *Central Alliance of the Numinous Treasure*, in accordance with the *Spontaneous Golden Statutes*, cast ten golden clasps, releasing dragons into clear springs, as the Dao of seeking immortality. Ascend the altar again to receive the *Red Writs of the Five Elders*, the *Two Registers*, and the *Staff of Strategic Thought*, stabilizing resolve. According to the *Luminous True Statutes*, cast thirty-seven dragon clasps in three sets of three, for the three sites of mountain, water, and dwelling, as tokens for the study of immortality. Then, following the *Jade Formulae*, separately cast twenty-seven dragon clasps in nine sets, on the eight solar terms, into mountains, waters, and dwellings, to seek the erasure of sin from the registers and the inscription of names in heaven.

Furthermore, at the conclusion of the *Yellow Register Zhai*, a *Dragon Tablet* is also cast, following only the *Three Yuan Tablet* texts, without additional petitions or established oral formulae. The masses, following one another in ignorance, have practiced this in confusion. In the past, I encountered Master Lu, who communed with the divine and entered the subtle, whose words accorded with principle and never failed to elicit response. He transmitted the wondrous in his heart, yet his texts lacked ritual protocols. If one were to follow the scriptural texts literally and cast them carelessly, the gods of mountains, waters, and dwellings—unable to recognize the records of the hidden and manifest—would find it wildly incongruous. Thus, the *Mysterious Ancestor* composed these petitions for the three sites, each addressing its respective immortal bureau, and separately issued three established formulae for the tablets. Now, as I examine them clearly, they must have been inscribed at that time. With sins erased and names recorded, the nine lineages are immediately delivered. The household bears glory, studies flourish, and in life and death, immortality is attained. I reveal this to my disciples and enjoin them to hold it in reverence.

Du Guangting said: The Great Dao, with the one *qi*, transforms and gives rise to the Three Powers, shaping the myriad existences. Thus, it divides the courts of the Three Yuan to govern sin and fortune—namely, the Three Officials of Heaven, Earth, and Water, who truly preside over the Three Yuan. The length of human life and early death, sin and goodness, fortune and misfortune, are all bound to them. The formats of the three register tablets are also the canonical forms of the Three Yuan. In the method of performing the *zhai*, one must cast the three tablets to petition the Three Yuan. Thus, the *Mountain Tablet* is cast into the grotto heavens and grotto palaces, petitioning the Heavenly Official of the Upper Yuan; the *Water Tablet* is cast into the numinous springs and water palaces, petitioning the Water Official of the Lower Yuan; and the *Earth Tablet* is cast into the altar or dwelling, petitioning the Earth Official of the Middle Yuan. Within the texts of the tablets, the ranks and titles of the true numina are clearly evident.

In recent times, only the *Mountain* and *Water Tablets* are cast. In the regions of the Huai and Zhe rivers, there are records of the three-tablet rite, long practiced. Now, upon examining the origins, I have found the texts described by Master Zhang Chengxian, which petition the Three Yuan and are quite clear and fitting. Thus, the casting of the three tablets is indeed without doubt. It may be followed as a permanent model. Not only when receiving scriptures, but also when casting the three tablets in the *zhai* for deliverance, the merit is entirely bound to the Three Yuan. If all three tablets are employed, the merit of the good deeds is fully conveyed to the courts of the Three Officials. Those who practice and uphold this should not harbor doubts.

The rites for the *Prohibited Altar*, the *Lamp Offering*, and the *Casting of the Dragon Jade* are all taken from Du Guangting’s *Yellow Register Zhai Rituals*.

Here ends *Formal Rituals for the Supreme Yellow Register Great Zhai*, Scroll Twenty.
Here begins *Formal Rituals for the Supreme Yellow Register Great Zhai*, Scroll Twenty-One.

Master Tang Cheng, Du Guangting, compiled the *Rites of the Gate of Liturgies* for the *Ascending the Altar and Circulating the Scriptures*, as revised by the Enforcing-Dao Immortal Officer Jiang Shuyu.

When performing the Yellow Register and Numinous Treasure *zhai* rites, the Dao is practiced and scriptures are circulated thrice daily. Through the six periods of day and night, disciples offer petitions, recitations, and invocations to pray for blessings. As the timing of the *xingdao* and *xiaoxi* rites shifts, one may separately ascend the altar to circulate scriptures, chant praises, and perform the liturgy—all in accordance with the *Golden Register* protocols.

Upon ascending the altar and taking the high seat, the recitation of scriptures and the observance of *weiyi* proceed as prescribed. If wind or rain disrupts the schedule, or if other liturgies intervene, the *xingdao* and scripture-circulation rites may follow in succession.

For the *Ascending the Altar and Circulating the Scriptures* rite, the Dharma Master dons the *Crown of the Primordial Beginning*, a yellow skirt, and a purple-brown *pei* robe adorned with the five-colored numinous radiance—this is called the *Dharma Robe*. The assembled officials wear their usual attire.

First, the assembled officials, arrayed in full *weiyi*, welcome the Dharma Master and proceed before the Mysterious Master to stand in formation. The Dharma Master then offers incense.

Next, the *Hymn to the Dao* is chanted,
followed by the *Huaxia Hymn* as an introit, and the ascent to the altar proceeds as prescribed.

The Dharma Master ascends the *Gate of Heaven*, approaches the incense table of the imperial seat, and recites the *Incense Offering Mantra*.
Next, the Dharma Master and the *Dujang* each offer incense at their respective stations.

Then, the *Three Refuges* are chanted:
*"With wholehearted devotion, we take refuge in the Dao-Treasures of the Ten Directions.
May all beings turn their minds toward the Way and universally offer their reverence.
With wholehearted devotion, we take refuge in the Scripture-Treasures of the Ten Directions.
May all beings awaken to understanding and receive, uphold, recite, and chant.
With wholehearted devotion, we take refuge in the Master-Treasures of the Ten Directions.
May all beings ascend the Dharma Bridge without obstruction."*

Next, the assembly in the ritual arena is instructed: *"Hold the tablets before your hearts and sit properly, as prescribed."*
Then, hymns are chanted in accordance with the liturgy,
followed by the *Hymn of Past Lives*:
*"The truth of past lives is certain,
yet the feeble dismiss it as nonexistent.
All is judged by what the eye beholds—
what passes from sight is deemed distant.
The great sages, enlightened by the Dao’s teachings,
grieve for the stubborn and foolish.
Tenderly, they lament the suffering of their disciples,
earnestly, they express their concern for us."*

Next, the *Dujang* initiates the scripture recitation:
*"In the primordial vastness of the Cloud-Script of the Great Void,
amidst the eons of beginningless time,
now distant, now near, now submerged, now afloat,
wandering the Five Directions, spanning over a *zhang* in expanse—
the Heavenly Perfected, the August One, took up the brush and inscribed
the *Dongzhang* scriptures, followed by the Numinous Talismans.
The Primordial Beginning descended, and the True Writs were revealed.
Luminous in their presence, obscure in their absence,
they heal the deeply afflicted and raise the drowned from the dark depths.
By this means, one may ascend to the Immortal Realms.
Today, on behalf of the *zhai* sponsor [Name], we establish this Supreme Yellow Register Great *Zhai* to offer proper deliverance for the deceased kin [Name],
and universally deliver the souls of all present, that they may ascend to the blessed realms.
We now gather the assembly, the pure multitude ascends the altar,
to reverently recite the *Supreme Scripture of the Numinous Treasure of the Highest Clarity, the Limitless Salvation of Humanity, the Wondrous Upper Chapter*—
the foremost of the myriad scriptures, the root of the ten thousand Daoist practices,
most fitting for recitation during the performance of the Great *Zhai*.
For a three-day *zhai*, it is essential to complete ten recitations, adhering to the number ten.
If one can additionally recite the *Chapters of the Divine Embryo* and other scriptures, it is even more excellent.

After each recitation, offerings are made to the Three Treasures, the August Thearchs of the Ten Poles, the administrators of Earth and Water, the sovereigns of the Nether Gates, the officials of the Three Realms, and all responsive numinous spirits.
May the deceased souls [Names] and all the imprisoned and sin-laden spirits of the Nine Glooms be delivered from suffering and attain rebirth in the proper realms.
We pray that the Flying Celestials descend to observe, and the August Thearchs chant from afar.
With the turning of a single numinous sound, the hells of the Nine Glooms fall silent;
with the hidden resonance of ten recitations, the sunken souls of the Five Paths cease their retributions.
May grace flow to the departed and blessings extend to the living.
May all sentient beings universally attain the fruits of the Dao.

For this supreme cause, we invoke the names of the Great Sage, the Primordial Beginning Heavenly Worthy;
the Supreme Dao Lord; the Supreme Lord Lao; the Supreme Numinous Treasure Heavenly Worthy;
the Heavenly Worthy Who Saves by Sound; the Heavenly Worthy Who Delivers from the Nine Glooms;
the Heavenly Worthy Who Crosses the Vermilion Mound; the Heavenly Worthy of the Great Dharma Bridge;
the Heavenly Worthies of the Ten Directions Who Save from Suffering;
the Left and Right Perfected of the Highest Clarity; the Great Dharma Master of the Mysterious Center;
and all inconceivable merits and virtues."*

Next, the assembly is instructed: *"Meditate in stillness, as prescribed."*
Each visualizes themselves seated amidst clouds of blue, yellow, and white *qi*,
with the Azure Dragon to the left, the White Tiger to the right,
the Vermilion Bird before, and the Dark Warrior behind.
The sun, moon, and five stars illuminate their sides,
while the attending scripture immortals array themselves within the altar.
A halo, like the sun’s image, appears around them.
When this is complete, they swallow saliva thrice and click their teeth thrice,
then silently recite the *Mysterious Essence Mantra of Opening the Scripture*.

For the circulation of all Numinous Treasure scriptures, this visualization of the scriptural text should be observed.
For differing practices, follow the respective methods.

*"Silent, it reaches the ultimate origin,
towering in emptiness, spanning eons.
The profound writ of the Vast and Mysterious—
who can fathom its depths?
Entering the path of the Great Vehicle,
countless kalpas pass.
Neither born nor extinguished,
yet born from the lotus.
Transcending the paths of the Three Realms,
with compassion, they untangle the world’s snares.
The Perfected, of supreme virtue,
become immortals for all generations."*

Next, the *Hymn of Initiating the Scripture* is chanted:
*"We bow our heads before the Heavenly Worthy of the Void."*

Then, the assembly is instructed: *"Please circulate the *Scripture of the Limitless Salvation of Humanity*, in accordance with the liturgy."*
At the point of the secret mantra, follow the text in practice.

Each visualizes the Thirty-Two Heavens, where nine-colored clouds interweave,
forming palaces and towering terraces.
The Heavenly Thearchs, clad in celestial robes and crowns, appear distinctly.
Beginning with the Heaven of the Grand Primordial, they click their teeth once,
then bow once in their minds, proceeding through the Thirty-Two Heavens in sequence.
Upon completion, they close their eyes and meditate in stillness.

From the Three Elixir Fields, the primordial *qi* emerges—
first as blue, yellow, and white clouds like threads, gradually thickening as they leave the body.
The clouds envelop the practitioner, then the seat, the table, and the scripture mat, surrounding all.
Lush and swirling, they encircle the altar, then expand outward to enclose a quadrant of space,
eventually merging with heaven and earth in profound unity.

Next, they visualize the Azure Dragon emerging from the liver to stand on the left,
the White Tiger from the lungs to stand on the right,
the Vermilion Bird from the heart to stand before,
the Dark Warrior from the kidneys to stand behind,
the Lion from the spleen in the Lower Elixir Field, with twelve lions arrayed on either side,
and nine white cranes emerging from the *Niwan* Palace, encircling the four directions.
From the Six Harmonies Palace behind the *fangcun* between the brows,
the sun and moon emerge from the eyes, nine *cun* from the face,
their light illuminating the altar, penetrating and radiant.
Only then is the secret mantra recited.

Silently recite the secret words, letting not even the ears hear them.

The Most High Mysterious Prime, Supreme Lord of the Dao, summons forth from within this servant’s body the Three and Five Merit Officers, the Left and Right Attendant Messengers, the Golden Lads of Incense, the Jade Maidens of Transmission, and the Thirty-Two Fragrant Officers of the Five Thearchs’ Direct Talismans and Direct Days—each in their thirty-two ranks—to receive and convey these words.

We, on behalf of the officiant [Name], now offer the deceased kin [Name] in proper rite, and universally present all departed souls gathered here for the performance of the Supreme Yellow Register Grand Fast.

Today, as we ascend the altar to circumambulate the scriptures, may these offerings aid in their deliverance. May what is here proclaimed ascend directly to the august presence of the Most High Primordial Lord of the Thirty-Two Heavens.

This done, draw the eightfold azure *qi* of the Eastern Eight Heavens eight times into the liver; the eightfold vermilion *qi* of the Southern Eight Heavens eight times into the heart; the eightfold white *qi* of the Western Eight Heavens eight times into the lungs; the eightfold dark *qi* of the Northern Eight Heavens eight times into the kidneys.

Only then begin the recitation of the scriptures.

When the recitation is complete, next chant the *Hymn of Rising from the Seat*:
*For all beings yet to come,*
*May this sow the seeds of good affinity.*
*Should they awaken to the truth,*
*Let them look up in gratitude to the mysterious grace.*

The hymn concluded, the assembled officers rise, and the master of intonation extols the scriptures.

Consider well: the Three Caverns’ precious scriptures are the supreme models of the myriad heavens. They weave the *qi* of soaring mystery into chapters of cloud-seal script, their meaning surpassing all unborn things, their text enduring through eternal kalpas. Thus do heaven and earth by them divide and order themselves; sun and moon by them revolve and course; ghosts and spirits by them transform and adapt; and humankind by them is enlightened and delivered. Therefore, those who chant them ascend in form to the crimson empyrean; those who hear them are reborn in spirit among the azure heavens. None—whether of the celestial or mortal realms, whether living or dead—do not look up to them in reliance, depend upon them for refuge. They are the bridge for all classes of beings, the gateway for all perfected ones. Vast and majestic is their model; praise of them knows no end.

Now this disciple [Name], having inaugurated the Yellow Register Grand Fast, performs the ninefold Dao-circumambulations and the sixfold scripture-circumambulations. May we, by the power of the true vehicle, uplift and transcend the departed souls. Above, may this benefit the state and the family; below, may it protect those still living.

Now, as the scripture-case is opened to expound its profound mysteries, its resonance pierces the Three Heavens; as the scroll is held to chant its arcane verses, its sound reaches five hundred million. May the golden maidens attendant with incense weave fragrant characters in the midst of heaven; may the jade lads in charge of scriptures present the sacred texts upon the bamboo slips. Thus shall past transgressions dissolve in former kalpas, and blessings descend upon this very day. The living and the dead alike shall bear the grace of renewed prosperity; all beings, moving and still, shall rejoice in the virtue of growth and fulfillment. By this supreme goodness, may all be adorned and perfected. May the Three Wretched Paths cease their torments of anguish; may the Nine Nights end their bitterness and sorrow.

So too, may all classes of beings—whether stirring or inert, whether dimly sentient—together board the vessel of the Six Perfections and reach the shore of the Three Clarities.

Next, the chanting of the *Three Hearings of the Scripture*:
After hearing the scripture, may all beings have their myriad sins swept away and the sprouts of goodness grow.
After hearing the scripture, may all beings deeply enter the Dharma-gate and take refuge in faith and acceptance.
After hearing the scripture, may all beings forever sever delusion and constantly cultivate the supreme Dao.

The Dharma-master strikes his teeth three times, swallows his saliva three times, and visualizes the Three Primordial Sovereign Ladies in the Golden Flower Palace, appearing as infants.

Next, the circumambulation:
Recite the *Hymn in Praise of the Most High’s Scripture of Wisdom*.

The Most High’s Mysterious Void Sect exalts the Dao and venerates its scriptures.
With a single bow and lift of the head, one attains immortality—
through countless kalpas, age upon age.
Majestic is the virtue of the Great Perfected,
serene in the cause of non-birth.
Celestial radiance weaves empty structures,
riding the void to journey by nature’s decree.
Sun and moon blaze as torches,
peace and harmony bring joy without end.
Those who study immortality cast aside ornate thoughts,
each thought building upon the last.
Coming and going disturb my spirit,
restlessness leaves no experience unscathed.
Extinguish thoughts and dwell in tranquil emptiness,
whispering into the silence of the void.
Seek the scriptures as if parched with thirst,
hold fast to your resolve like unyielding metal or stone.
Preserve the child and ascend the mysterious path,
the Five Spirits pass through talismanic registers.
Cross me with the practice of the Six Perfections,
thus unbind the Three Nets.
Purify the fast and worship the Primordial Simplicity,
exhale and inhale to nurture the cloud-sprout.
Roam freely within the Golden Gate,
the Jade Capital is my home.
Naturally, the Seven Treasures arise,
each person seated upon a lotus.
Above, they chew the fruit of the Mysterious Capital,
below, they drink deeply of the Hollow Melon.
Their countenance shines brighter than ten suns,
what reckoning of years or kalpas?
The Dharma-drum summons celestial immortals,
the tolling bell subdues the great demons.
A divine wind fans fragrant blossoms,
brilliant and resplendent, unfurling rich robes.
The Great Perfected plucks the cloud-zither,
the assembled immortals strum the numinous harp.
Elegant songs resound in the Three Heavens,
scattering wisdom through the Jade Flower Grove.
The seven generations ascend the Hall of Blessings,
by this they tread the mysterious sound.
If past-life virtue was insufficient,
this scripture remains distant and hard to find.
Those whose faith in the Dao is unwavering,
though they soar, may yet sink.
The Most High’s Dao of Non-Action
flourishes when planted in the hearts of all.
To study the Dao, one must have unwavering faith,
revere the master as one’s closest kin.
Draw near the radiance and embrace the pure void,
diligently renewing with each passing day.
Until all beings are delivered,
I shall not deliver myself.
Great vows bring weighty retribution,
mysterious virtue is surely thus.
Hidden evils and deep sins
confront one like a turning wheel.
To study the Dao is also arduous,
day and night, cultivate the field of blessings.
Planting virtue is like planting a tree,
piling baskets of earth to form a mountain.
If you can immerse yourself in the mysterious and exalted,
you will soar lightly into the azure heavens.
Cultivate this Dao of Non-Action,
and you shall be bound in affinity with goodness.
The Most High’s most recondite scripture,
is called the *Scripture of Wisdom*.
To relieve suffering requires great talent,
transcending the mundane to attain immortality.
The numinous countenance is what the world relies upon,
radiant as a lotus in the deep pool.
Each person’s conduct has its root,
all stemming from past-life merit.
Establish virtue while the time is ripe,
make vows and none will go unfulfilled.
Good and evil both await their reckoning,
the principle of rise and fall is unfathomable.
The worthy uphold the Dharma’s words,
the Dao also lies in silent forgetting.
To comprehend this is the great wisdom,
ascending to become a Lord of the Great Ultimate.
A jeweled canopy joins the jade chariot,
commanding the nine dragons to drive.
The Golden Flower holds aloft the *Cavern Scripture*,
immortal youths all bear incense.
Whistling songs resound through the Mysterious Capital,
jade chimes strike the jasper bell.
Rising to stand in the Great Clarity,
transcending radiance to roam the Purple Empyrean.
Uphold the Dharma’s net without fail,
wander the mysterious ultimate in freedom.
Ten thousand kalpas are but last night,
a thousand springs like the morning dawn.
Towering, they shade the cloud-flower,
grasping the branches of the Jeweled Grove.
Incense smoke arises naturally,
the mysterious steps ascend in a whirlwind.
Spiritual banners unfurl with the wind,
fleeting thoughts dissolve in their time.
Extinguish wisdom to expand the great chaos,
let Non-Action become the pure hymn.

Next, chant the *Hymn in Praise of Studying Immortality*,
exit the hall to stand before the Mysterious Master, and dedicate the merit.

The Left Immortal Lord of the Great Ultimate says:
The eight true hymns are all the words of the Most High, the Perfected of the Great Ultimate.
The assembled immortals delight in their recitation,
never divulging them to the world below.
Secretly treasured within the Golden Gate and Jade Chamber,
they are fittingly transmitted to the perfected,
to cultivate the *Numinous Treasure* fast.
They must not be shown to the frivolous and ostentatious—
be cautious, be cautious indeed!

The Perfected of the Great Ultimate says:
The jade maidens and immortal youths who attend the scriptures,
hearing the sounds of this ritual scripture’s hymns and praises,
all rejoice and protect the practitioner.
This great scripture should always be venerated with these hymns.
Even those who silently recite the scripture
should chant them, for they are the words of the highest immortals,
the wondrous essence of cultivating the true.

From the *Numinous Treasure Mysterious Capital Southern Scripture of the Jade Capital*.

The Heavenly Worthy says:
The scriptures are my legacy, guiding the foolish and lost,
able to awaken boundless Dao-mind in all beings.
Intention arises from awakening,
through awakening, one becomes true.
All sages who cultivate and practice
ascend to the fruition of the Dao.
Thus, the Primordial Beginning, with one qi, gave birth to and transformed the Three Qi,
dividing them into the Three Heavens.
The first is the Beginning Qi, known as the Heaven of Pure Tenuity,
the realm of the Heavenly Treasure Lord of the Jade Clarity,
where I manifested.
At the dawn of the Dragon Han kalpa, I was called the Heavenly Worthy of the Formless,
and in this heaven, I revealed the twelve divisions of the *Cavern Real Treasure Scripture*,
to teach the Nine Saints of the heavens—
also known as the Mysterious Masters of the Myriad Heavens,
the Supreme Dharma Kings—
for ninety-nine thousand nine hundred ninety-nine billion kalpas.
The second is the Primordial Qi, known as the Heaven of Yu Remnant,
the realm of the Numinous Treasure Lord of the Highest Clarity,
where I manifested.
At the dawn of the Yan Kang kalpa, I was called the Heavenly Worthy of the Nameless,
and in this heaven, I revealed the twelve divisions of the *Cavern Mystery Treasure Scripture*,
to teach the Nine Perfected of the heavens—
also known as the Healing Kings of the Three Realms,
the Supreme Perfected Lords—
for eighty-eight thousand eight hundred eighty-eight billion kalpas.
The third is the Mysterious Qi, known as the Heaven of Great Red,
the realm of the Divine Treasure Lord of the Great Clarity,
where I manifested.
At the dawn of the Crimson Brightness kalpa, I was called the Heavenly Worthy of the Brahma Form,
also known as the Perfected of Beholding the World,
and in this heaven, I revealed the twelve divisions of the *Cavern Spirit Treasure Scripture*,
to teach the Nine Immortals of the heavens—
also known as the Guides of the Ten Directions,
the Heavenly Worthies of the Utmost Extreme—
for seventy-seven thousand seven hundred seventy-seven billion kalpas.
When the Kai Huang era began, I was called the Vacuous August,
governing the Primal Yang within,
expounding the Three Caverns,
descending to transform the human realm as the Most High Dao Lord,
for sixty-six thousand six hundred sixty-six billion kalpas.
Upon reaching the Shang Huang era, I was called the Primordial Beginning in full,
governing within the Purple Tenuity Palace,
widely disseminating scriptures and precepts
to save and deliver all beings.
The Three Cavern Treasure Scriptures comprise thirty-six divisions,
also called the Three Vehicles of the *Cavern Real Treasure Scriptures*—
this is the Great Vehicle.
The *Cavern Mystery Numinous Treasure Scriptures*—
this is the Middle Vehicle.
The *Cavern Spirit Treasure Scriptures*—
this is the Small Vehicle.
They coalesce the qi of soaring mystery,
naturally forming chapters,
written in jade characters and golden script,
in dragon scripts and phoenix seal-script.

The Great Square spans one zhang and eight corners, its radiant beams descending to instruct the heavens. Circulating through the world, it endures from beginning to end across kalpas, ever turning the Dharma Wheel. At times it is real, at times expedient; sometimes broad, sometimes concise. Adapting to capacities to awaken understanding, it guides practice according to the age. Though heaven and earth may end their course, the Three Caverns shall never perish. They open the path for all ranks of beings, guiding humans and gods alike. The Three Realms and the ten directions all receive its benefits.

Thereafter, at the dawn of each kalpa, the *Cavern Real* descends to transform the world. People embrace virtue and power, dwelling together in non-action. All revere the Most Perfect, attaining long life and the Dao. Next, the *Cavern Mystery* descends, and humanity and all beings gradually decline. Simplicity scatters, frivolity spreads, the Dao is lost, and virtue is betrayed. Finally, the *Cavern Spirit* descends, and humanity grows ever more frivolous. They no longer revere the true and perfect, and their years and lives grow short.

From this point onward, the human heart is corrupted, the Three Caverns cease to spread, and worldly wisdom flourishes day by day. Humans and spirits intermingle, the kalpas hasten, and lifespans do not reach a hundred years. In every thought, impermanence reigns, and the cycle of death and rebirth never ceases. Thus, I manifest again to proclaim and propagate the Three Caverns, disseminating transformation among humankind. Adapting to the capacities of each era, I expound and propagate the scriptural teachings—sometimes great, sometimes small—according to what suits the beings.

Thus, the original texts of the Primordial Beginning were not fully transmitted below. In the Three Pure Realms above and the Four Brahmā Heavens, the perfected and sages cultivate and practice in full. Though in mountain caves and grotto palaces, in seas and sacred peaks and immortal palaces, there is cultivation, it is not complete. This is because the scriptures they practice vary by place, and the Three Caverns are not fully present.

Therefore, I commanded Laozi to incarnate in the human realm, to save and deliver all beings, and to expound the precepts and regulations. Whether among the Yi or the Xia, whether sage or commoner, throughout the ten directions, all are enabled to attain liberation. The wondrous Dharma of the Three Caverns is scattered among humankind, exhorting men and women to diligently cultivate and practice.

Ordinary beings accumulate sins, their karmic burdens sinking them into delusion. They have no affinity with the Dao and cannot believe or revere it. They follow only false teachings and various heterodox spirits, exhausting body and mind in vain, only to descend into hell in the end. Those who believe and practice the Three Caverns all enter the Hall of Blessings. Some ascend in broad daylight, some escape through corpse liberation, concealing their forms in grotto palaces, roaming the world. They attain long life, change their names, and endure for eternal kalpas. Refining qi and transforming form, they turn spirit into the Dao. None can recognize them, for they are boundless.

After my passing, demonic teachings will flourish. The world will uniformly follow them, and people will die young. Warfare, floods, fires, illnesses, and injuries will cause death and harm. Nations will fall, families will perish, and these calamities will follow one after another day and night. Their treasuries will be exhausted in service to demons and heresies. Falsehood and chaos will daily increase, and frivolous deceit will spread through the times. Hunger, cold, and suffering will afflict them, and fathers and sons will be scattered and displaced. The world will be foolish and deluded, forever without awakening.

I pity you, who have sunk for kalpas on end. I speak these essential words to enlighten the deaf and blind. Yet the wondrous Dharma of the Three Caverns is of one kind, which is twofold: first, the true Dharma; second, the transformative Dharma. The true Dharma is free from all falsity and endures for eternal kalpas. The transformative Dharma circulates through texts and perishes with the times.

Within the transformative Dharma, there are five kinds:
1. The coalescing of soaring mystery’s qi, cloud-seal scripts forming chapters, naturally combining and separating, appearing and disappearing unpredictably. In the Three Pure Realms above, it eternally abides as the scriptural treasure, enduring for billions of kalpas, protected by sages and perfected beings.
2. The numinous script of one zhang and eight corners, resplendent throughout the Three Realms, the ten directions, and the five billion heavens, rising and falling with the kalpas, circulating in response to karmic conditions.
3. The writing and recitation of texts in the halls, pavilions, terraces, chambers, gates, and doors of the heavens’ palaces, subduing beings and guiding their entry into and exit from cultivation.
4. Flower-patterned and leaf-shaped characters, jade tablets and rosy compilations, the square zhang of Penglai, the Langfeng and Xuanpu gardens, now hidden, now revealed, enduring or perishing with the kalpas, teaching and training immortals, subduing demonic spirits.
5. Paper and silk, bamboo and wood, lacquered writings, scattered among humankind, transmitted and recited. At the kalpa’s beginning, they descend; at its end, they ascend. They protect nations and pacify people, opening the path for all ranks of beings.

The scriptures are the words of the Primordial Beginning, teaching and transforming all beings, enabling them to recognize the root and origin, the causes and conditions of past lives, the retribution of sins and blessings, the auspicious and inauspicious, good and evil, the gateways of birth and transformation, and the origins of expedient means. They turn from evil to embrace goodness, preserve and secure their lives, attain long life and non-action, return to the Dao, and become eternal models. Those who preserve them receive blessings. Those who cultivate them become immortals.

From the *Sutra of Karmic Retribution and Causes and Conditions*.

The Most High Dao Lord said to the Three Heavens Dharma Master: "The teachings and precepts of the Heavenly Worthy, the wondrous texts of the Three Caverns, the celestial writings in jade characters, the numinous seal-scripts and dragon scripts—though boundless—are all summarized and categorized into twelve matters. Their divisions and distinctions vary according to the roots of beings:
1. Natural original texts
2. Divine talismans
3. Precious oral instructions
4. Numinous diagrams
5. Registers and genealogies
6. Precepts and regulations
7. **Dignified observances**
8. Methods and techniques
9. Arts and calculations
10. Records and biographies
11. Hymns and recitations
12. Memorials and petitions

The natural original texts are the celestial writings of the Eight Assemblies, the phoenix seal-scripts and dragon scripts. They are the root of heaven, earth, and the myriad things, enlightening humans and spirits, establishing all Dharmas. They summon the divine immortals and emperors of the Nine Heavens, verify and determine registers and charts, regulate the celestial pivot, subdue the Fengdu underworld, vanquish demonic spirits, command the water deities, summon dragons to ascend the clouds, mark the kalpic cycles of heaven and earth, record the names of sages and perfected beings, govern the cities and terraces they oversee, and delineate the realms of the multitude of perfected beings. They broadly proclaim distinctions, various ranks of descent, methods for ingesting primordial essence, and techniques for transforming form.

Divine talismans are the cloud-seal scripts, the pledges of divine perfected beings. They summon and subdue demonic hordes, awe and control spirits and ghosts, govern the primordial and command fate, and protect life through the years.

Precious oral instructions are the explanations of the celestial writings of the Eight Assemblies by the heavenly perfected and supreme sages, establishing the correct sounds and revealing the Great Dao."

The *Lingtu* (Numinous Charts) are the transformative traces of the multitude of sages, manifesting without fixed form. They depict and convey adaptability, enabling comprehensive understanding and realization.

The *Pulu* (Registers and Genealogies) are the recorded accounts of the multitude of sages, listing the names and titles of immortals and perfected beings, their ancestral origins and lineages, and the hierarchical positions of divine palaces.

The *Jielü* (Precepts and Disciplines) are the systematic regulations and binding agreements that prevent transgressions and examine faults, weighing the gravity of offenses and blessings to distinguish their severity.

The *Weiyi* (Dignified Rituals) fully demonstrate the forms of purification and abstinence, serving as models for advancement and retreat, the measured rhythms of bowing and rising, and the standards for demeanor and bearing.

The *Fangfa* (Methods) are the writings of the multitude of sages, containing the essential secrets of elixirs and medicines, divine herbs and numinous fungi, malleable gold, flowing water, and jade—the Dao of self-cultivation.

The *Shushu* (Arts and Calculations) clarify and discern the spirit through contemplation, preserving authenticity and focusing the mind on the Dao. They encompass fasting of the heart and sitting in forgetfulness, wandering through emptiness and flying steps, ingesting the six *qi*, guiding the Three Luminaries, refining the body to transform form, and the methods of immortal transcendence.

The *Jizhuan* (Records and Biographies) are the accounts of the multitude of sages, documenting their studies and practices, the attainment of the Dao and perfection of the real, the entry into mystery and subtlety, the places of cultivation, and the times of fruition.

The *Zanyong* (Hymns and Chants) are the adorned dharma-words of the multitude of perfected beings and great sages, extolling the true Dao, inspiring universal faith and joy, arousing dedication and redirection, and cultivating reverence and veneration.

The *Zhangbiao* (Memorials and Petitions) are the wondrous treasures and extraordinary texts transmitted between master and disciple, used in altar rites, oaths of transmission, confessions and repentances, prayers for blessings, and official declarations.

These twelve categories comprehensively encompass all methods. Every intention and purpose is fully provided without omission. They transform and guide the Three Vehicles to enter the One Vehicle Dao, as stated in the *Sutra of Fundamental Boundaries*.
