At the time of refinement and deliverance, the Dharma Master shall knock his teeth, visualize the spirits, and silently pay homage, beseeching the descent of the Most High’s true water and true fire into the refinement site.

Bow three times, offer three pinches of incense, and make the proclamation:

*"Your disciple, [Name], in full Dharma rank, humbly petitions the Patriarch, the Northern Pole Purple Tenuity Great Emperor, and the Patriarch, the Southern Pole Longevity Great Emperor. This lowly one, though a defiled corpse, dares to partake in the Dharma ranks, bearing the sacred scriptures and upholding the true teachings. To succor the living and deliver the dead, I fulfill my vows. I now lay bare my sincere heart, supplicating Your audience.*

*I prostrate myself on behalf of the patron, [Name], who, for the universal deliverance of the departed kin [Name], has convened this assembly of souls to establish the Supreme Yellow Register Great Fast. A universal offering of pure alms-food is set forth for the six destinies, the four modes of birth, the orphaned and lingering spirits, invoking the Most High’s compassion, vast and impartial, boundless and unobstructed. I beseech that, in accordance with the true rites, the rites of refinement and deliverance be proclaimed, that grace may be bestowed, suffering ended, and transcendence attained.*

*May Your celestial mercy deign to issue a sagely decree, commanding the Water and Fire Bureaus of the Southern Palace and the True Lords Governing the Five Peaks to descend the spiritual roots of yin and yang—true water and true fire—this very day and hour, into this altar ground, to refine and deliver the multitude of spirits. May their souls be purified, their myriad qi preserved whole, their forms restored in full, and their radiance rekindled. May they ascend through the Southern Palace’s ranks and transcend to the Heavenly Courts. Relying upon Your majestic might, may Your sagely grace perceive all. I prostrate myself in await of Your heavenly favor’s manifestation. This disciple, unable to contain his reverence, gazes toward the sacred with fervent longing, awaiting Your pardon."*

Next, the Dharma Master intones the ritual proceedings:

The Master visualizes the Primordial Sovereign of the Origin residing in the Mud-Pill Palace, now attended by the Nine-Flowered Perfected Ones and the assembled immortals, officials, and generals, all arrayed in solemn splendor, descending in radiant majesty.

The Master performs the Fire Pool Rite, pacing the Southern Dipper’s Fire Bell Mantra Steps to the fire pool, where the assembly recites the hidden incantation.

The Master encircles the fire pool in twelve positions, employing the Opening and Flowing Circulation Rite. He recites the *Purification of Heaven and Earth Spell* once, sprays water from his mouth, and blows it into the pool.

Proceeding as prescribed, he recites the *Establishing the Fire Pool Spell*:

*"By the Most High’s decree, sins are absolved, and beings delivered.
The six destinies and three paths all behold the light.
The fire pool is established, and they ascend in order.
Each according to their karma, all attain transcendence.
Swiftly, swiftly, as the Emperor commands!"*

He visualizes the Vermilion Mound’s raging fire flowing like molten gold, entering the fire pool from its southeast corner, its golden-green flames blazing fiercely. Drawing three breaths of noon qi, he blows them into the pool.

Holding the True Fire Unification Talisman, the Master forms the Descending True Fire Mudra, tracing from *yin* to *wu*. Silently, he intones:

*"Fiery spirits, fiery spirits, the Vermilion Bird soars.
With one divine fire, press upon bing and ding.
The Fiery Spirit Maidens wield the Emperor’s bell.
Samādhi’s true fire swiftly descends from the Vermilion Mound.
I act by the command of the Southern Pole Longevity Great Emperor!"*

Drawing noon qi, he blows upon the talisman and burns it in the pool. Secretly, he recites:

*"Southern Yan’s floating cavern, the flowing fire’s court.
Jade eyes gleaming, the flowing fire’s essence.
The sharp blade of Dhyāna’s wisdom, the divine youth of Vaṇī.
The flowing fire’s substance, the jade-eyed true visage.
Ascend into the Hall of Blessings, the Cavern-Yang’s palace."*

Facing east again, he draws the qi of the day’s sun and blows it forth.

Next, he commands the Fire Pool Attendants, the Refinement and Deliverance Officials, the Divine Youths, and the Solar Essence of Midday to swiftly descend into the pool and await, guiding the orphaned souls into the fire pool to refine their forms according to the Dharma.

*"Swiftly, swiftly!"*

The Master visualizes the Flowing Fire Divine Court, boundless in its expanse.

Above stands the Vermilion Mansion of the Southern Numinous Prefecture, its towers and pavilions rising in solemn array. Within its courts, the fire shines with a golden-green hue, its flames crowned with golden bells that ascend in flickering ascent.

The Master performs the Water Pool Rite, pacing the Mystic Pivot of the Northern Dipper to reach the water pool. The assembly chants in veiled speech. The Master circles the twelve positions around the water pool, employing the *Opening, Releasing, Retaining, and Communing* method. Silently, he recites the *Purification of Heaven and Earth Incantation* once, then sprays a mouthful of water into the pool. Having completed the ritual proceedings, he intones the *Water Pool Construction Spell*:

*"By the Supreme Decree, sins are absolved and beings delivered.
The six destinies and three woeful paths all behold the radiant light.
The water pool is established, and they ascend in due order.
Each according to their karmic retribution, all attain liberation.
Swiftly, swiftly, as the August Emperor commands!"*

He visualizes the waters of the Celestial River and Eastern Well flowing into the water pool from its northwest corner, limpid and serene. Drawing a breath of northwest qi, he blows it into the pool.

Holding the *True Water Unification Talisman*, the Master forms the *Descending True Water Mudra* and extends it to the *zi* hour. Silently, he recites:

*"Great Yin, Great Yin, essence of the Dark Warrior.
With one descent of divine water, it connects to the *gui* and *ren* stems.
Celestial true nectar, radiant chamber of the Upper Clarity.
The Primordial Beginning Venerable Lord, the Life-Cherishing Lord Han.
The numinous root of true water swiftly descends to the Pivot Prefecture.
I, in accordance with the Purple Tenuity Northern Pivot August Emperor’s statutes and decrees, command!"*

Drawing northern qi, he blows upon the talisman and sinks it into the water pool. Secretly, he recites:

*"The mirrorless pool, abyss of divine dragons.
Conveying the splendor of the Eastern Well to cleanse the orphaned souls.
Gathering their bearing and refining their forms, the essence of Great Harmony.
The Jade Maidens of Mystic Harmony pour it into their spirits.
Souls and spirits clarified and rectified, the Dao’s qi endures forever."*

Facing west again, he draws the true qi of the day’s moon and blows it forth.

Next, he commands the Water Pool Attendants, the Form-Purifying Officials, the Divine Youths, and the Numinous Root of the Moon’s Yellow Splendor to swiftly descend into the pool and await, guiding the orphaned souls into the water pool to purify their essences and cleanse their forms according to the Dharma.

*"Swiftly, swiftly!"*

The Master visualizes the Celestial River and Eastern Well, boundless in their expanse.

The waters are pure, luminous, and radiant, with celestial palaces above, their towers and pavilions standing in solemn array.

Next, the Dharma Master proceeds to the refining and deliverance site. The Master approaches the incense seat, visualizing the transformation as prescribed. *Incense for the Return of Spirits* rises, its smoke curling into talismanic script. All heavens and earths are suffused with billowing fragrance. Qi is entrusted and merits gathered; orphaned souls receive refinement. All sentient beings ascend together to the Dao’s shore.

The Dharma-ranked minister [Name] burns incense and reverently invokes the Three Clarities and Three Realms, the Ten Poles and Ten Florals, the Most High Sovereign of Salvation from Suffering, the Great Emperor of Longevity, the true lords of the Three Provinces and Five Offices, the Vermilion Numinous Fire Palace, the Southern Prosperity Upper Palace, the sacred assembly of the Numinous Treasure refining and deliverance, and all divine immortals within and beyond the Three Realms. May the jade wheels and feathered canopies briefly descend from the layered heavens; may the Dharma rain and merciful clouds extend over the hidden earth. Grant this minister the power to perform deliverance and universally succor the submerged and lost. Humbly beseeching the radiance of grace above, and the witness of proof below. This minister offers utmost reverence in prayer.

The seat is arrayed, and the Master visualizes the auspicious smoke of the Celestial Gate, propitious qi and cloudy hues, rosy light dazzling and resplendent. In heart and sight appear the Three Treasures’ merciful lords, the Azure Mystery Emperor, all heavenly great sages, and every immortal spirit—brilliant and majestic in their descent.

**Incantation for Guiding Souls:**
Today is an auspicious day, a propitious hour of the Great Dao.
All heavens bestow their witness; myriad perfected ones arrive together.
The Three Realms convene; the Eight Sceneries unite.
Earth officials perform their duties, universally delivering the hidden and manifest.
Attending marshals of the departments, gather the souls to the altar court.
Guide the departed spirits to receive refinement of their forms.
Each adjusts their bearing; swiftly come forth.
Together ascend to wondrous fruition, proceeding to the Vermilion Numinous Realm.

The Master visualizes the countless millions of orphaned souls awaiting deliverance, all assembled beneath the altar.

Reverently summon the Great Dharma of the Numinous Treasure, the resplendent immortal courts, the spirit officials and merit officers, the Golden Lads and Jade Maidens, the refining and deliverance immortal clerks, the myriad deities in charge, the celestial generals of the Cinnabar Heaven’s left and right attendants, the Water Pool and Fire Pool attendants, the Fire Bell Divine Lads, the Nine Radiance Lads, the Yellow Floral Jade Maidens, the Eastern Well Jade Maidens, the soul-delivering chief clerks, the soul-gathering merit officers, the soul-seizing generals, the refining and deliverance attendants, the Twelve Qi of Primordial Harmony’s Generals of Transformation, the Flying Primordial Spirit-Summoning Marshals, the Six Ding and Six Jia Generals, the Golden Lads and Jade Maidens, the refining and deliverance rectifying-day spirit generals and merit officers, the Yellow Register Court merit officers and Fire Palace divine soldiers, the Five Paths Community Chiefs of Mount Tai, the City Gods and Earth Gods, and all other deities—come to the altar site.

By the Dao’s decree, refine and deliver the dead souls. You, divine and mighty, swiftly and reverently comply with the primordial teachings, summoning from the ten directions, the boundless empty realms, the Six Paths and Four Births, the owned and ownerless, all orphaned, stagnant, imprisoned, and suffering souls—assemble at the numinous altar to reverently receive refinement and deliverance. Each assumes their office to gather qi, harmonizing form and spirit. Refine their essences to congeal the true; ascend as immortals and awaken to the Dao.

*As swiftly as the flowing fire’s decree!*

The Master visualizes the aforementioned officials and clerks, their bearing solemn and majestic, arrayed to left and right. The souls receiving deliverance all stand beneath the altar.

The Heavenly Worthy Who Accords with Wishes for Rebirth.

Burn the *Lingbao* Talisman of Ascending to Perfection and Delivering the Destined to Depart from Birth and Death. Recite the incantation:

The vermilion script of Jade Purity ascends to commune with the Purple Court.
Heaven’s compassion grants absolution; the numinous spirits of the Three Realms,
The ten directions’ worlds, the sinful souls of the Nine Nether-realms,
The myriad ancestors of countless generations, the suffering shades and wandering essences—
Erase their names from the ledgers of sin, sever the roots of evil.
Hasten to the realm of rebirth, where qi and consciousness abide in tranquil repose.
Ascend to the Heavenly Hall, refine the essence and temper the spirit.
Transcend the Five Sufferings, the true heart luminous and clear.
Sweep away the shadows of Yin, enter the Dao and ascend to perfection.

Swiftly, swiftly, as the Lord Emperor of Imperishable Life decrees!

Burn the talisman, draw the primordial qi, and blow it into the Water Pool. Visualize the orphaned souls’ bodies suffused with jade light, radiant and resplendent, their forms dignified and majestic, clad in beloved immortal robes.

The Perfected One of Perfect Treasure and Rounded Splendor.

The master silently recites the incantation for delivering souls:
*Xingsheng, Duli, Kehan, Gongdu, Baohun Yinghun She.*

Burn the talisman for summoning the Generals of the Six Dings and Six Jias, the Golden Lads and Jade Maidens. As the refinement and deliverance of merits are now complete, reverently summon the Great Generals of the Six Dings and Six Jias, the Golden Lads and Jade Maidens, to swiftly escort the refined orphaned souls. Let each compose their appearance and demeanor, and reverently proceed before the August Emperor’s throne to offer thanks for Heaven’s grace, receive the precepts and transmit the talismans, ascend to perfection, and attain deliverance by rank.

The ritual assembly, with utmost sincerity, requests to proceed with the welcoming and guiding. The assembly chants the hidden verses, leading the souls to pay homage.

Next, descending from the seat, the *Lingbao Rite of the Great Fast for Transmitting Talismans and Conferring Precepts*

The Dharma Master approaches the incense and prays, saying:
Reverently summon the boundless worlds of the ten directions, all spirits now present to receive deliverance. You have, since the vast kalpas, planted the roots of suffering, enduring this cycle of rebirth without respite. Now the jade altar’s rites are complete, and the precious models proclaimed. A summons is issued to the hidden and the manifest, gathering the six destinies like motes of dust; spirits soar through the empty vast, entreating the true chariots of the Nine Pures. Relying on the Dao’s compassion, may all departed souls universally transcend. Let pure offerings quench the ever-burning fires of hunger, and Dharma waters cleanse the defiled forms of sin. Refine the true essence, smelt away the shadows of yin, for this expedient teaching bends even the Most High’s majesty to condescend. Having arrived at the Dao altar, you must each compose yourselves with reverence. Receive the talismans and precepts in solemn return. Past transgressions are now pardoned; henceforth, cultivate good fruits with ever greater care. Let steadfast faith repay the virtue of creation.

All ghostly and divine assemblies, submitting in reverence, bow twice in gratitude to Heaven’s grace.

The *Ling Shu* is raised, guiding the assembled souls to the place of precept-bestowal. The Dao assembly stands in order, each with utmost respect.

The Master approaches the seat, holding the censer of incense, and invokes:
Today, the Dao altar is pure, and all present unite in mind. We dedicate this to the six paths of beings before us—orphaned souls and lingering spirits, all assembled spirits. We bow in reverence to entreat the Three Primes of the Great Void, the Seven Perfected of the Empty Realm, the Boundless Wondrous Dao, the Nine Qi of Cavernous Spirit, the Celestial Worthy of Primordial Beginning in his infinite manifestations, the great sages and lords of the ten directions, the thirty-six Heavenly Emperors, the Five Masters of Lingbao, the numinous immortals of Heaven and Earth, the sun, moon, and stars, the Four Controllers and Five Emperors, the mighty spirits of the Three Realms. May they deign to receive our plea, respond with radiant grace, descend into this Dao altar, and witness the conferral of precepts. We beseech your wisdom and blessings, that Heaven’s grace may abundantly flow, universally reaching all beings, that all may ascend to the Dao’s fruit.

*The Celestial Worthies of Lingbao in the Ten Directions*

The Dharma Master ascends the seat:
By the power of the Dao, I now serve as your great preceptor. I call to mind your countless kalpas of disbelief in the Great Dao, your failure to awaken to the true vehicle. Some have sinned through the three karmas, others erred through the six senses; some harbored inner perversity, others were stained by external defilements. From the three poisons arose one hundred and eight afflictions; from the six emotions sprang eighty-four thousand toils of dust and suffering. Through kalpas you have revolved, unaware and unenlightened, long mired in the bitter destinies, with no hope of liberation. The Celestial Worthy of Primordial Beginning, in his great sagacity and compassion, mindful of all, divided his form and scattered his light. Descending into the Nine Darks, his majestic radiance illuminated the suffering, and he addressed the four assemblies: “Listen well, for I now proclaim for you the Nine Wondrous Precepts of the True Ones and the Golden Register’s White Tablet. The merit of upholding them delivers from peril and relieves suffering—its divine power is beyond thought.”

The spirits bow their heads, humbly receiving the teaching.

Now, in accordance with the mysterious statutes, we transmit them before the sacred. You must receive them with single-minded devotion, never to forget.

*The Celestial Worthy of Compassionate Precept-Proclamation*

First: respect and deference, filial piety toward parents.
Second: diligence and loyalty to one’s lord.
Third: no killing, compassionate salvation of beings.
Fourth: no licentiousness, rectifying the body in its place.
Fifth: no theft, yielding to righteousness and diminishing the self.
Sixth: no wrath, lest fury harm others.
Seventh: no deceit, lest flattery and treachery injure the good.
Eighth: no arrogance, lest pride scorn the true and real.
Ninth: no duality, upholding the precepts with singular devotion.

The Celestial Worthy of Primordial Beginning, having proclaimed these precepts, through the power of his compassion and wisdom universally bestows them upon the living and the dead. Spirits awaken to understanding, each generating good thoughts. All suffering dissolves, body and mind at peace. All arouse the Dao-mind, abiding in non-retrogression.

Today, as we transmit the precepts and grant the registers and deliverance talismans, we pray that the Three Treasures and the Venerable Masters will together witness and deliver. May the Youths Who Examine Fate, the Mighty Spirits Who Guard the Precepts, the Direct Talismans of the Five Emperors, and the officials of the Six Palaces follow and protect, enlighten and elevate. Let names be inscribed in the Jade Purity, recorded in the Golden Registers, swiftly attaining the Dao’s fruit and forever transcending the wheel of suffering.

The *Precious Registers and Numinous Talismans* are now solemnly proclaimed.

Proclaim the *Talisman of Longevity*
Proclaim the *Talisman for Salvation from Suffering*

The Dharma Master visualizes the Celestial Emperor, commanding the Golden Lads and Jade Maidens to bear the registers and tablets, descending on golden light from the Heavenly Gate. The Master takes the tablet and passes it over the incense, praying:

The Primordial Sage on High, the Lofty Numinous Jade Emperor,
By jade script proclaims the mandate, delivering the dead and saving the living.
The wondrous precepts of the Golden Register protect and succor the hidden realms.
The White Tablet and precious talismans, the Nine Perfected Immortals’ scriptures,
Dissolve transgressions, reconcile karmic debts.
The True Person Who Saves from Suffering erases all guilt and punishment.
The Youths Who Examine Fate inscribe names for rebirth.
The Mighty Spirits Who Guard the Precepts guide them to the courts of blessing.
Transcending the Five Sufferings, they ride cloud chariots,
Turn the wheel to attain the Dao, and ascend to the Upper Purity.

Proclaim the *Precious Register for Ascending to Heaven*
The Dharma Master takes the register and passes it over the incense, praying:

By the Celestial Worthy’s talismanic mandate, at this very moment, ascend and advance.

At the Northern Capital’s Frigid Pool, the ranks guard the bodily souls.
They restrain demons and ensure promotion, advancing them to the Southern Palace’s ranks.
The dead souls undergo refinement, transformed by immortals into perfected beings.
Those whose living bodies receive the transmission endure through kalpas everlasting,
Revolving with the kalpic wheel, their years equaling Heaven’s.
Forever delivered from the Three Paths, the Five Sufferings, and the Eight Adversities,
They transcend the Three Realms, roaming freely in the Upper Purity.

**Prayer over the Talismanic Register**
May all beings of the Six Paths and Four Births, the lonely souls and lingering spirits,
Upon receiving and upholding this register, have their names inscribed on the Purple Tablet,
Their lives transmitted to the Vermilion Numinosity.
Great sins dissolved in the Nine Dark Realms, they are plucked from the Earth’s Gates;
Swiftly ascending beyond the Three Realms, unbound by Heaven’s Portals.
Yet they must be summoned again by celestial immortals, specially escorted and guarded.
Let all take heed.

**Summoning the Escort Officers**
We reverently summon the celestial officers and generals of the various Dharma courts,
The attending merit officials, the Great Generals of the Six Dings and Six Jias,
The Golden Lads and Jade Maidens, the Thunder Gods on duty,
To carry out the ritual teachings and universally deliver the submerged souls.
Let them listen to the Dharma, hear the scriptures, receive talismans, and accept the precepts.
Now that the ritual is roughly complete, the time for escort has arrived.
We temporarily lend our majestic authority to strictly guard and deliver them,
That none remain detained, and all swiftly attain transcendence.
The written decree is as follows, and shall be executed accordingly.

**Proclaiming the Decree**
The August Emperor descends in transformation, mindful of those with karmic affinity.
The Numinous Treasure bestows its teachings, delivering countless beings.
Thus are the departed of the dark paths bathed in the radiant grace of the Great Dao.
Names inscribed on golden tablets, ranks conferred in the Vermilion Palace.
Through the distant cloud thoroughfares, their feathered sleeves flutter.
Forever severed from the wheel of rebirth, they bid farewell to the altar and depart.
May they follow their vows to be reborn in the presence of the Heavenly Worthy.

**Rising and Turning Toward**
We have just performed this for the Great Register’s chief patron, so-and-so,
Universally dedicating it to the deceased kin, so-and-so,
And universally delivering all souls present—the Six Paths, Four Births, lonely souls, and lingering spirits.
May all these merits be fully perfected.
May the primal grace grant our sincere prayers,
That all attain the fruit of the Dao and never again fall into the delusions of the dusty world.

Ascend the Dharma Bridge with measured steps, swiftly reach the Dao’s shore.
The Three Torments cease their reckoning, the Nine Nights end their bitterness.
May all beings in the Dharma Realm dwell in harmony and acceptance.
May all under heaven awaken to the Dao and cultivate the True.
May this servant forever abide beneath the Dao’s shelter.
For these most excellent merits, we invoke:
Jade Purity’s Primordial Heavenly Worthy of the Origin,
High Purity’s Numinous Treasure Heavenly Worthy,
Grand Purity’s Heavenly Worthy of Dao and Virtue,
Heavenly Worthy of Great Unity Who Saves from Suffering,
Heavenly Worthy Who Delivers from the Nine Hells,
Heavenly Worthy Who Crosses to Vermilion Radiance,
Heavenly Worthy of the Cinnabar Realm’s Alchemical Fire,
Heavenly Worthy of the Golden Portal’s Transformation,
Heavenly Worthy of the Wheel-Turning Sacred King,
Heavenly Worthy Who Grants Rebirth According to Vows,
Heavenly Worthy of Carefree Bliss,
Heavenly Worthy of Jewel Flower Perfection.
Boundless, inconceivable merits.

Proceeding beyond the gate, transform the petitions, talismans, and registers.
The Dharma Master performs the deliverance rite, reciting the *Fanjian* ode:
May the souls be purified and upright, their myriad qi enduring forever.
May they know no suffering, their bodies suffused with radiance.
When merits are fulfilled and virtue perfected, they shall ascend to High Purity in carefree ease.
Swiftly, swiftly, by the decree of the Emperor of Eternal Life.

Silently recite the *Huasheng* incantation:
Rise and gather, solitary souls—*Kěhán* summons you.
Accomplish the assembly of souls—swiftly, swiftly, by the Celestial Emperor’s decree.

Silently recite the *Huadie* incantation:
Blazing flames of the Fire Bell, above and below, in the eight directions.
Ten thousand spirits stand guard, forever severing misfortune.
Swiftly, swiftly, by the law of the Cinnabar Heaven’s Fire Bell.

Envision the Fire Bell filling the earth, resplendent as the sun, spanning heaven and earth.
The delivered souls ascend, borne away upon golden light.
Heavenly Worthy of Jewel Flower Perfection.

The deliverance rites performed thus far are now complete.
Again, relying on the pure assembly, for the sake of these karmic conditions, we invoke:
Great Sage Primordial Heavenly Worthy,
Supreme Lord of the Great Dao,
Most High Lord Lao.
Inconceivable merits.

**Numinous Treasure Rite of Life Release**
When Daoists release lives themselves or perform the rite for others, the text may be adapted accordingly.
Prepare the site for life release by arranging a table.
The Master and the assembly proceed to the table, first offering incense and striking the teeth three times.
The incense is kindled.

Supreme Three Heavens Mysterious Primordial Three Qi Most High Lord Lao, summon forth from within this servant’s body the Three and Five Merit Officers, the Left and Right Attendant Envoys, the Left and Right Incense-Bearing Dragon-Riding Couriers, the Incense-Holding Golden Lads, the Message-Transmitting Jade Maidens, and the Five Thearchs’ Direct Talismans and Daily Incense Officials—thirty-six of each—forthwith. Notify this place’s earth spirits and local deities, the true officials and rightful gods. This servant now, on behalf of so-and-so, establishes the Supreme Yellow Register Grand Fast to aid and deliver the soul of so-and-so, the rites of which have now been fully performed. At this moment of burning incense and releasing lives, may the qi of the Most High’s Ten Directions Orthodox Perfected enter this servant’s body, that this petition swiftly ascend before the Most High’s Boundless Dao Supreme Perfected Jade Thearch.

Petition:
This duly ordained servant so-and-so respectfully petitions the Most High’s Boundless Dao and the Ten Directions’ Perfected, the Accomplished Great Sages, the Fusang Great Thearch Lord of Yang Valley, the Divine Kings of Cave Source and Abyssal Depths, the Great Spirits of Mingling, the Three Rivers and Four Seas, the Nine Jiang Water Thearchs, the Twelve Huai and Ji River Lords, the River Earls and Marquises; the Two Thousand Piculs of the Yellow River’s Lady of Clear Waters, the Water Palace Divine Immortals and Perfected Spirits, and all the deities of this lake, land, and locality. This servant, by good fortune and karmic conditions of past lives, has endured the kalpas of the Nine Heavens to reach this present body. Having encountered the scriptural teachings, I revere and uphold the Three Treasures. Though ordained in the Great Vehicle, I reflect upon my own impurities and unworthiness. Yet from the day of receiving this mandate, I have pledged to cultivate and propagate the wondrous Dharma, to extol the winds of benevolence, that the sun’s numinous radiance may illumine the Nine Netherworlds, and the Primordial Beginning’s compassionate grace may universally extend to all beings. Creation nurtures all things, and the myriad forms flourish. Though human and non-human differ in form, all alike receive the primordial qi. All living kinds yearn for wholeness. Yet in this age, the Dao declines while perversity and evil flourish. People, greedy and turbid, devour living beings. Birds, beasts, fish, and turtles are made their sustenance. Trapped and captured on land and water, their numbers are beyond reckoning. Now the fast’s sponsor, so-and-so, moved by karmic retribution, establishes this grand fast, donating personal wealth to ransom lives, fostering and protecting them, ensuring their universal well-being. Released into clear springs, may this merit aid the unseen blessings. If Daoists release lives themselves, they should follow the original statutes and add accordingly: According to the scriptural texts, releasing lives to deliver the dead takes precedence in cultivation. This servant, leading the assembly, reverently performs these rites without negligence. Moreover, the devout laymen and laywomen so-and-so and others, compassionate toward all beings and devoted to good causes, [join in this endeavor].

Each contributes their wealth to purchase turtles and fish, following this servant to arrive at the clear depths. Together we release them, returning them to the source of life. If no one joins the assembly to release lives, omit the phrase "Moreover, the devout laymen and laywomen so-and-so and others."

As the statutes of Celestial Master Lu originally contain this passage, I dare not delete it: may they transcend calamities, escape suffering and distress, all bathe in life’s wholeness, and forever enjoy primordial auspiciousness. May this merit universally flow to all heavenly beings, the seven generations of parents, the emperor and kings, dukes and the myriad commoners.

If Daoists release lives themselves, they should follow the original statutes and add accordingly: as well as this servant’s precept-master, parents, fellow disciples, worthy recluses in the mountains, Daoist officials, Orthodox Unity disciples, friends, acquaintances, the six relations, all winged insects and creeping things, those that crawl and gasp for breath, the spirits of the heavens and hells, the earth-prisons and the Five Peaks and Four Waterways, the suffering souls and wandering shades, the imprisoned and those burdened by labor—may they all be freed and dispersed, delivered from evil destinies, and ascend together to the realm of non-action.

May the heavens be lofty and clear, winds harmonious and rains timely, sun and moon radiant, stars arrayed in order. May the earth be level and upright, mountains and forests lush, waterways unobstructed, and the five grains abundant.

May the sovereign’s virtue expand boundlessly, his majestic presence vast and awe-inspiring. May the imperial teachings shine with clarity, gazed upon by all under heaven. May the people embrace righteousness and deference, and rival states cease their strife. May the six barbarian tribes submit as guests, and heresies and evils never arise. May rivers and seas be full, and sages and worthies be born daily. May wealth be shared in generosity, and clothing and sustenance come naturally. May men be of lofty talent, and women of chaste virtue. May none take up lost items on the road, and the Dao and its power flourish. May schools and academies thrive, with each guiding the other to enlightenment. May bodies be offered in alms, and fields of merit widely established. May the sorrowful and suffering be dispersed, extending to all living beings. May this disciple’s seven generations of ancestors ascend to the heavens, their embryonic forms reborn, soaring through the skies. May they be reborn among the chosen people, free from care or calamity. May the radiance of sun and moon be equal, delivering all from hardship. May they be delivered in every generation, and blessings extend to their descendants. May this servant, having attained the true Dao, ascend to heaven in broad daylight.

Respectfully submitted.

*Recite and ponder the verses of the* Micro-Determination of Will Sutra, *the hymn of the Perfected of the Great Ultimate:*

O worthy one, do not kill,
nor even harbor the thought of killing.
Though creatures may be small,
all delight in growth and life.
How can you take their lives
to nourish your own?
Such nourishment lasts but a moment,
yet binds you to the natural consequences.
Long mired in the Three Paths,
you suffer and return again.
Good and evil each have their causes,
as echo follows call.
Why not change this conduct,
rewarding yourself with a heart of compassion?
Hand in hand with the Perfected, roam,
carefree, observing the floating world.

*Right One*

Though the Great Dao has no intent,
it may be sought with feeling.
I halt my chariot in the hollow vastness,
gazing back at the veiled, surging currents.
Beyond the Three Realms, in purity and brightness,
I wander the jade capital in solitude.
Without the mysterious impetus of fate,
who could grasp the hidden truth?
The Milky Way shines clear and distant,
lofty and low, all is empty and yielding.
The Seven Mysteries scatter the dark night,
and the unborn drift with the tides.
If the hidden term quietly congeals,
the Yang’s nine calamities bring no joy or sorrow.
Witnessing these meetings and partings,
time and again I linger.
By forsaking the body, the body endures—
true immortals gather with their kind.

*Right Two*

The profound path lies within the mysterious,
deep and still as the Han’s clear waves.
Change and decay turn like a wheel,
yet the camphor’s branches never alter.
Still the heart and contemplate the Perfect,
flowing with fate, departing the net of separation.
Response and resonance follow principle,
the spirit’s ease extends even to the ancestors.
Wandering in simplicity, without bounds,
myriad thoughts dissolve into the nine distances.
Flying roots scatter dark leaves,
principle returns—there is nothing else.
Ever recite the jade scriptures,
their mysterious tones piercing the clouds and rosy dawn.
When the *jiashen* flood disaster arrives,
I soar on wings to the Queen Mother’s abode.
Forever enjoying boundless ages,
who knows how many kalpas have passed?

*Right Three*

**Next: Releasing Lives and Restoring the Incense Burner**

*End of Volume Thirty-One of the* Supreme Yellow Register Great Fast Established Rites.
*Beginning of Volume Thirty-Two of the* Supreme Yellow Register Great Fast Established Rites.

Transmitted by Master of the Three Caverns, Chongjing, and bequeathed by Master Liu Yongguang to the Celestial Enforcer of the Most High, Jiang Shuyu, for compilation.

**Section on Fast Rites and Their Application**

*Explanation of the Dragon’s Radiance*

The *Lower Prime Yellow Register Simplified Writs of the Spirit-Immortal Rank* states: For the威仪 of extracting and delivering sinful roots, one should craft ten golden dragons to镇 the ten directions. To deliver sinful souls, place one in each of the ten directions. Present the ten-directional silk offerings as tokens: ninety *chi* of green-patterned silk for the east (or nine *chi*), thirty *chi* of crimson-patterned silk for the south (or three *chi*), seventy *chi* of white-patterned silk for the west (or seven *chi*), fifty *chi* of black-patterned silk for the north (or five *chi*). For the four corners, use yellow-patterned silk, each one hundred twenty *chi* (or twelve *chi*). For the upper direction, thirty-two *chi* of azure-patterned silk; for the lower, thirty *chi* of yellow-patterned silk. According to each direction’s color, arrange them in the ten directions to deliver the souls of the eternal night.

The host presents silk corresponding to their life-destiny, varying by year. The Son of Heaven and feudal lords use purple silk, emulating celestial patterns. Commoners use the color of their life-destiny’s proper direction, placing it at the center to deliver their year and fate, ensuring all is refined and wondrous. The Son of Heaven’s offering is measured in *pi*; feudal lords in *zhang*; commoners in *chi*. Rank determines the measure, all following the luminous statutes.

The Flying Celestial Divine Persons declare: Those who violate this shall be examined by the Heavenly Officials of the Mysterious Capital Bureau.

*Explanation of Ascending the Altar*

Whenever entering the oratory to ascend the altar, rinse the mouth with fragrant water, called "dispelling defilement." Upon exiting, rinse again, called "sealing the true *qi*." After arranging the offerings, first have two Daoist adepts proceed as威仪, leading the master and disciples to ascend the altar. They circumambulate the outer altar once, stopping at the southeast corner. The master recites the *Entering the Door Spell*, then leads the disciples in order through the Earth Gate to ascend the central altar. The威仪 remain circling the outer altar and do not enter the central altar. One威仪 is stationed on each side of every altar. After three circumambulations, they stand on the four sides. When stepping in emptiness and circling, they proceed to the northwest corner. The master ascends the inner altar through the Heavenly Gate, turning left three times, offering incense to the ten directions once. Then, offering incense at the imperial desk, they retreat to the west, standing facing east. The disciples circumambulate the central altar once, then stand in order and perform the rites as prescribed. The disciples lead the master out of the altar, passing before the master, who follows behind.

In establishing fasts and erecting altars, emulate heaven and earth. The inner altar is entered and exited through the Heavenly Gate; the central altar through the Earth Gate. Whenever entering the altar, the master leads the disciples through the Earth Gate, the master preceding, disciples following. Whenever exiting the altar, the disciples lead the master out through the Earth Gate, disciples preceding, the master following.

*Hymns of China and Their Explanations*

Diligently uphold fasts and precepts,
recite scriptures to restrain the six emotions.
Thus one rides the void and soars,
radiant above the Jade Clarity.

With focused mind, uphold the scriptural teachings,
refine the five spirits through exhalation and inhalation.
Virtue crowns the heavens,
turning the wheel to become an Upper Immortal.

*From the* Numinous Treasure Jade Casket Covenant of the True Scripture.

Master Du Guangcheng says: Now only the eighteen empty sounds are used. Today, even these are abandoned.

*The Morning Entering the Door Spell*

The Dharma Master turns to the left of the Earth Gate, strikes the teeth three times, and recites the secret incantation.

*Night Entering the Door Spell (partial)*
According to Laozi’s *Visualization Diagram*, visualize the following: one Attendant of the Four Luminaries, one Messenger for Communicating with the True, two Jade Maidens for Transmitting Words, and two Jade Maidens for Pacifying Attendance—six in total.
The Attendant of the Four Luminaries,
the Messenger for Communicating with the True.
The Jade Lads for Transmitting Words,
the Jade Maidens for Pacifying Attendance.
Convey my words to the deities of the Dao chamber.
The primordial qi of the Upper Prime enters my body.

Upon completion of the prayer, enter the door with the left foot first.

*Morning Exiting the Door Spell*
After exiting the Earth Gate, turn to face the altar, strike the teeth three times, and recite the prayer while visualizing one Jade Maiden:
Exiting the yin to enter the yang,
the myriad spirits open and clear.
Once the affairs at the Pass are concluded,
request the closing of the Yellow Chamber.
The Jade Maidens for Pacifying Attendance
illumine and prepare the divine palace.

Upon completion of the prayer, exit the door with the right foot first.

*Night Entering the Door Spell*
According to Laozi’s *Visualization Diagram*, visualize the following: one Attendant of the Four Upper Ones, one Dragon-Tiger Messenger, one Plain Maiden for Pacifying Attendance, one Luminous Lad, and one Maiden of the Upper Mystery—six in total.
The Attendant of the Four Upper Ones,
the Dragon-Tiger Messenger.
The primordial qi of the Orthodox Unity,
the Plain Maiden for Pacifying Attendance.
For matters to be reported at night,
the Luminous Lad.
The Maiden of the Upper Mystery enters with me.
Within the Yellow Palace,
all that is conveyed shall be heard above.

*Night Exiting the Door Spell*
After exiting the Earth Gate, turn to face the altar, strike the teeth three times, and recite the prayer while visualizing one Maiden:
The Great Yin of the Mysterious Upper,
the eight windows open and brighten.
For matters to be reported,
the Maiden communicates the numinous.
Once the affairs are concluded and positions restored,
the myriad spirits withdraw in tranquility.

*From* The Incense-Burning Rituals, *in* The Upper Prime Golden Register Precepts of the Perfected Immortals.

*Offering Incense to the Ten Directions*
At dawn and midday, incense is first offered to the east, then southeast, south, southwest, west, northwest, north, northeast, below, and above.
At night, incense is first offered to the north, then northeast, east, southeast, south, southwest, west, northwest, below, and above.

*From* The Fasting and Incense-Offering Rituals, *according to* The Original Precepts of the Numinous Treasure:
At midday, begin with the east, then proceed to south, west, north, northeast, southeast, southwest, northwest, above, and below. Here, however, the order begins with the southeast, then east, following the sequence of the *Golden Register Precepts* for the Ritual of Deliverance from Sinful Roots. For the present *Golden Register Fast*, the original scripture is followed.

Master Zhang Wanfu of the Pure Capital’s *Ritual for the Celestial Master’s Fast* states that the order for ascending the altar to offer incense is the same as the first.
The Ritual of Deliverance from Sinful Roots is based entirely on the *Golden Register Precepts of the Perfected Immortals and Transcendents*. It is an ancient text from the Dragon Han era and must not be altered.

*Incense-Offering Spell*
After the Dharma Master has offered incense to the ten directions, he approaches the imperial desk, offers incense three times, and recites the secret incantation:
Jade blossoms scatter radiance,
the nine qi contain mist.
Fragrant clouds densely woven,
directly ascend the nine heavens.
The Golden Lad for Attending Incense,
the Jade Maiden for Transmitting Words.
Report before the Emperor,
granting your servant long life.
For all generations to come, as a divine immortal,
all that is petitioned and desired shall be fulfilled as spoken.

*From* The Great Cavern Scripture of Supreme Purity: *The Scripture’s Incense-Offering Spell* omits the phrase "the Golden Lad for Attending Incense," and "the Jade Maiden for Transmitting Words" is rendered as "the Jade Maiden for Attending Incense." "That which is petitioned" is written as "that which is directed," and "shall be fulfilled" as "shall not fail."

First, the officiant visualizes with focused reverence:
Within the Heavenly Treasure Terrace, the Three Supreme Ones are seated. To their left, the thirty-six divisions of sacred scriptures; to their right, the Great Master of the Mysterious Center. The Ten Perfected and Five Emperors, hosts of immortals in attendance, arrayed as in the grand assembly for the audience of the True.

The officiant closes his eyes and visualizes the Three Supreme Ones descending through the void, flanked by the Lords of the Dragon and Tiger, a thousand chariots and ten thousand riders, the honored spirits of the Three Realms, and hosts of perfected beings in attendance, all arrayed in their seats. The master, on behalf of the disciple, presents the intent of the retreat.

Next, he visualizes the Scripture Master, the Master of the Numinous Treasure of Supreme Purity, Lord Zhan, whose personal name is Qi, with the courtesy name Ji Zhong, who propagated the Dao in Changsha. He bows in his heart three times and prays: "May the master attain the immortal Dao, and may I be elevated and delivered."

Next, he visualizes the Register Master, the Master of the Three Caverns of Supreme Purity, Lord Tian, whose personal name is Jushi, with the courtesy name Ruoxu, born on the second day of the fifth month of the jia-yin year in Changsha’s Zhenyan. He propagated the Dao in the Two Zhe regions. He bows in his heart three times and prays: "May the master attain flying immortality, open the path of deliverance for me, and may my seven generations of ancestors ascend early to the heavenly halls. May I attain the perfection of the Dao and ascend into the formless."

Next, he visualizes the Initiation Master, the Master of the Three Caverns of Supreme Purity, Lord Liu, whose personal name is Yongguang, with the courtesy name Daohui, born at the xū hour on the twenty-fifth day of the third month of the jia-yin year, a native of Guixi in Xinzhou. In the bing-yin year of the Kaixi era, on the Heavenly Offering Day, he transformed and ascended at the Supreme Purity Palace on Mount Longhu, having propagated the Dao in Jinghu, Jiang, and Zhe. He bows in his heart three times and prays: "May the master attain elevation and deliverance, ascend to the ranks of the lofty immortals, open the path of deliverance for me, and may the five destinies and eight difficulties be overcome, my name entered in the immortal registers, and I forever become a perfected person."

According to *The Divine Immortals’ Section of the Middle Prime Registers of the Five Registers*: "The ritual propriety for honoring the masters: the Scripture Master is the origin of the scriptures, and thus should be revered. The Three Ancestors’ lineage begins here. The Register Master is the master of the Initiation Master, and thus should be revered three times, for from him come the registers of life and death. The Initiation Master is the master from whom one receives the scriptures, who delivers one from the five destinies’ difficulties, and thus should be revered. One who studies the Dao without honoring the Three Masters will find the Three Treasures not descending, the Three Realms not respecting, and demonic spirits harming the body."

Master Du Guangcheng said: "Scripture (經) means ‘distant.’ Among the Three Masters, the Scripture Master is the distant master, the master of the Register Master, and one’s ancestral master. Register (籍) means ‘cause.’ The transmission of the true and the study of the Dao depend on the mutual causation of master and disciple; he is the disciple of the Scripture Master and the master of the Initiation Master. Initiation (度) means ‘advancement.’ He delivers my mortal body and advances me to the ranks of the Dao. From the beginning to this point, none is without dependence on the master; he is one’s own master. The direction of their abode is the place where they reside. In the heart’s bow, one visualizes their appearance, personal names, and titles, and reveres them with prayers. The reason for revering the master is that the methods I practice, which open the path of deliverance for heaven and humanity, depend on the master’s instruction to reach this point. In all acts of cultivation and devotion, one first reveres the master, not forgetting the root. In ancient times, scriptures were received from masters, so when burning incense during a retreat, one necessarily revered the master. The methods of retreats derive from the divine scriptures, so establishing a retreat takes the veneration of the scriptures as its foundation. The retreat’s regulations speak of the Three Masters’ covenant to receive the Three Treasures’ divine scriptures, offering reverence and cultivation—this is the essence of the retreat’s observance. In the present age, scriptures are not received from masters, and the methods of retreats have also declined. Those who establish retreats, if they have not covenanted to receive the precious scriptures—such as those referred to in the regulations as the *Golden Writ of Supreme Purity and the Three Caverns’ Treasures*—should adapt as appropriate. When revering the masters, one may visualize and pray to the Three Masters who transmit the registers of the method."

At dawn, he visualizes the qi of blue-green clouds filling the retreat hall, with blue-green dragons and lions guarding front and back. According to *The Numinous Treasure’s Visualization of Spirits*: "The blue-green dragon and lion together have eight heads. Four heads are at the two sides of the high seat’s southern envoy station, above sì and wèi. Four heads are in the north, above chǒu and hài, with the central high seat as the standard. The blue-green dragon is within, the lion without, all facing east and west in mutual opposition." Next, he visualizes the blue-green qi emerging from the master’s liver like ascending clouds. The blue-green dragon and lion emerge within the blue-green qi, covering the bodies of the disciple’s entire household.

At midday, he visualizes the qi of red clouds filling the retreat hall, with vermilion phoenixes and male and female fenghuang singing mournfully to the left and right. According to *The Numinous Treasure’s Visualization of Spirits*: "The male is called fèng, the female huáng; they are birds. Their heads resemble a rooster’s, beaks a swallow’s, necks a snake’s, backs a tortoise’s, tails a fish’s, with five-colored dragon patterns, together having eight heads. Four are in the east, above yín and chén on the two sides of the envoy station. Another four heads are in the west, above xū and shēn on the two sides of the envoy station. The vermilion phoenix is within, the fenghuang without, facing north and south in mutual opposition." Next, he visualizes the qi of red clouds emerging from the master’s heart, with the fenghuang and vermilion phoenix emerging within the red qi, covering the bodies of the disciple’s entire household, young and old.

At sunset, he visualizes the qi of white clouds filling the retreat hall, with white tigers and qilin guarding the four directions. According to *The Numinous Treasure’s Visualization of Spirits*: "The qilin is a beast. Its body resembles an ox’s tail, horse’s hooves, is yellow in color, with round hooves and a horn. Its head bears flesh, together having eight heads. Four are born in the four directions, two heads above zǐ, wǔ, mǎo, and yǒu. The white tiger is within, the qilin without, all facing south." Next, he visualizes the white clouds emerging from the master’s lungs, with the white tiger and qilin emerging within the white qi, covering the bodies of the disciple’s entire household, young and old.

Next, he visualizes immortal lads and jade maidens, celestial immortals, earthly immortals, flying immortals, the celestial bodies of the sun, moon, and stars, and the five emperors’ armies, each with nine hundred million and ten thousand riders, overseeing the retreat’s affairs. The officials of the Three Realms array to the left and right, their majestic propriety solemn, without negligence or slackness. According to *The Numinous Treasure’s Visualization of Spirits*: "The immortal lad attends the incense, standing to the left in the east; the jade maiden attends the incense, standing to the right in the west. From the celestial immortals to the Five Emperors of the Five Peaks, all are the armies of celestial immortals, wearing crimson robes, stationed at the celestial gate, to the east of the gate."

The earthly immortals’ officers and soldiers wear attire like that of military troops, stationed at the earthly gate. The flying immortals’ officers and soldiers wear feathered robes, stationed at the celestial gate, to the west of the gate. The officers and soldiers of the Solar Palace wear red robes, stationed at the solar gate. The officers and soldiers of the Lunar Palace wear pale yellow robes, stationed at the lunar gate. The officers and soldiers of the stellar lodges wear robes of colors corresponding to their directions, stationed at the four quarters, the four seasons, and the four *meng* positions. The Five Emperors’ officers, soldiers, and horses follow their respective directions, each wearing robes of their directional color and stationed in their own quarter. The central position is the direction of the established king.

Next, with eyes closed, inwardly visualize and perceive the five viscera and five consciousnesses, the five stars and Five Emperors, attending and guarding within the body, illuminating and covering the whole as one. The body becomes golden in color, and true *qi* emerges from behind the lungs. A circular radiance appears around the neck, like the image of the sun, illuminating the ten directions. Within the body, all is clearly seen, both inside and out.

According to *The Numinous Treasure’s Visualization of Spirits*: "As for the five viscera: first visualize the lungs, red and white in color, with seven lobes like a lotus flower, connected below the throat, with the *zouyu* covering the heart. Next visualize the heart, purple-red in color, like an oil sac, three inches long, wider above and narrower below, with a central aperture below the lungs. Next visualize the liver, purple-green in color, with five lobes below the heart. Next visualize the kidneys, which are paired, purple-black in color, like inverted cups, positioned beside the spine at the level of the navel. Next visualize the spleen, a muddy golden-yellow color, one foot long, with both ends slightly curved and coiled. The granary contains the stomach, located directly at the navel.

As for the Five Peaks: visualize the Eastern Peak, Mount Tai; the Southern Peak, Mount Heng; the Western Peak, Mount Hua; the Northern Peak, Mount Heng, each in their respective directions. The Central Peak, Mount Songgao, is in the southwest. Each of the Five Peaks is in its own domain; visualize them from afar.

As for the five stars: visualize the five stars shining brightly in the five directions. The Fiery Star of the south is above the forehead; the Quelling Star of the center comes before the heart; the Chronographic Star of the north comes between the two knees; the Jupiter Star of the east comes at the left elbow; the Venus Star of the west comes at the right elbow.

As for the Five Emperors: visualize the Green Emperor standing in the east, the Red Emperor standing in the south, the White Emperor standing in the west, the Black Emperor standing in the north, and the Yellow Emperor standing in the center, the direction of the established king. Each wears the crown of an emperor and robes of their directional color, standing within the ritual altar.

Again, following the method above, visualize true *qi* emerging from behind the lung viscera, ascending through the spine, and surging upward to exit above the head. The *qi* of the four viscera then rises in succession, intermingling and crowning the body, lush and dense, like thick smoke. Thereupon, the body becomes golden, a circular radiance appears around the neck, and like a mirror, it illuminates the ten directions. Within the body, all is clearly seen, both inside and out.

The above describes the majestic propriety for establishing the retreat, excerpted from *The True Immortals’ Section on the Upper Prime Golden Register of the Numinous Treasure*. For all who ascend the altar to perform the Dao, burn incense, make invocations, or engage in visualization, follow the method above.

*Guardian Spirit Incantations and Explanations: Eastern Direction*

The Nine *Qi* Azure Heavens, Radiant Star Great Divinity.
Shining upon the eastern realm, penetrating the Nine Gates.
Revolving the candle of yang light, sweeping away filth and dispelling miasma.
The Luminous Youth attends, guarding my chamber.
Subduing demons and binding spirits, ascending to stand before the Emperor.
Upholding the true Dao, the vermilion script and jade writ.
The talismanic command of the Nine Heavens, dispatched by dragon couriers.
All under heaven is pacified and secured—I attain flight as an immortal.

**Southern Direction**
The Southern Vermilion Heavens, Three *Qi* flowing in radiance.
The gleaming star revolves like a candle, illuminating the Great Yang.
Above dwells the Crimson Essence, the Luminous Spirit Youth.
Commanding the fire soldiers, guarding the Three Palaces.
Severing evil and binding spirits, shearing and restraining demon kings.
Upheld by the Northern Emperor, the Eight Winds of Fire surge.
Interlocking bells gleam—dare any disobey?
The true Dao flows forth—I receive supreme merit.
Preserving heaven’s eternal existence, enduring for a hundred million kalpas without end.

**Western Direction**
The Seven *Qi* Heavens, where Venus streams its essence.
Light illumines the Golden Gate, penetrating the Great Darkness.
Within dwells the White Youth, named Imperial Spirit.
Protecting and pacifying the spirit, guarding my form.
Cutting off the roots of evil, the kingly Dao shines clearly.
Palaces are ordered and solemn, the Three Luminaries aligned as one.
The Dao harmonizes with nature—I ascend to the Purple Court.
The talismanic command of the Numinous Treasure universally bestows blessings upon all beings.
Merit extends to all—heaven and earth are at peace.

**Northern Direction**
The Northern Mysterious Heavens, Five *Qi* lingering in circuit.
The Morning Star blazes brilliantly, its light illuminating the Supreme Subtlety.
The Black Spirit Venerable Divinity, clad in flying dark feathers.
Guarding the Five Gates, inspecting essences and seizing transgressions.
Dare any test their might? They are shattered and destroyed.
By the jade talisman’s decree, the Eight Might of the Divine Spirits.
Evil gates are sealed shut, the true Dao shines forth.
Illuminating my body, the Three Lights penetrate with radiance.
I ride the void and mount the floating clouds, my form ascending in immortal flight.

**Central Direction**
The Yellow Center governs *qi*, unifying the mysterious and true.
The Star of Stability emits its splendor, streaming and shining across the Nine Heavens.
The Radiant Youths, twelve in number.
Primal *qi* and yang essence, flames rising as crimson smoke.
Illuminating all under heaven, and the bodies of us, your servants.
A hundred evils are cast down, ten thousand ghosts slain.
The divine incantation of Mount Zhong universally enacts this.
The Five Spirits are pacified and secured—I ascend as an immortal of the highest rank.

The above is excerpted from *The Essential Exegesis of the Numinous Treasure True Writ*, entitled:
*The Celestial Worthy’s Numinous Treasure Five Spontaneous Guardian Spirit Incantations*

**Explanation of the Ritual Drum**
Master Du Guangcheng states: The ritual drum aligns the inner spirit and *qi*, externally dispelling demonic influences. It is the first act of all ritual proceedings.
Striking the left and right sides forms the Heavenly Bell;
striking the center sounds the ritual drum.
The rhythm follows eight beats as a measure, for the twenty-four *qi*.
Three offerings of incense, with invocations for each:

**First Incense Offering**
Invocation: May it reach the Jade Clarity Realm, to offer to the Wondrously Non-Existent Supreme Emperor, the Spontaneous Primordial Celestial Worthy of the Dao, the Peerless Treasure of the Dao.

**Second Incense Offering**
Invocation: May it reach the Supreme Clarity Realm, to offer to the Wondrously Existent Great Emperor, the Jade Dawn Lord of the Great Dao of the Void Emperor, the Peerless Treasure of the Scriptures.

**Third Incense Offering**
Invocation: May it reach the Grand Clarity Realm, to offer to the Perfectly True Great Emperor, the Venerable Lord Lao of the Myriad Transformations and Primordial Chaos, the Peerless Treasure of the Master.

The above is excerpted from Master Du Guangcheng’s *Rituals of the Retreat*.

**Incantation for Holding the Censer**
The Dao arises from the study of the heart; the heart transmits through incense.
Holding the jade censer, the heart contemplates the Nine Heavens.
The true spirits gaze downward; the immortal banners approach the chamber.
Grant that your servant’s memorial swiftly ascend to the Nine Heavens.

The above is from the *Golden Register Rituals* promulgated during the Song dynasty—it is not an ancient method and may be omitted. In ancient practice, the High Priest and the Chief Cantor each had an incense table before their positions to offer incense; they did not use a handheld censer but offered incense directly at their own tables.

**Explanation of the Incense Offering**
The Most High Three Heavens, the Primordial Three *Qi* of the Celestial Worthy Lord Lao, summon forth from within us, your servants:
the Three and Five Merit Officers, the Left and Right Attendant Messengers, the Left and Right Dragon Courier Riders, the Incense-Holding Golden Youths, the Flower-Scattering and Message-Transmitting Jade Maidens, and the Five Emperors’ Direct Talisman and Daily Incense Officers—thirty-six of each.
Let them emerge, fully adorned, to report to the local earth gods and true officials of this place.
We now burn incense to universally deliver the departed kin of so-and-so, and all the souls gathered here, as we conduct the Most High Yellow Register Great Retreat for three days and nights.
On this first night, we begin the retreat by ascending the altar, paying homage to the true, performing the Dao, fulfilling our duties, proclaiming the precepts, and pledging allegiance to the various heavens.
May the life-*qi* of the Most High Ten Directions’ true and correct spirits descend and flow into us, your servants, so that our memorial swiftly reaches the presence of the Most High, Boundless, Great Dao, the Perfectly True Jade Emperor.

This incense offering marks the beginning of invoking the true spirits, excerpted from the *Golden Register Writ*. The Dao is divided into the Three Caverns, and its teachings likewise follow distinct divisions. For instance, the *Upper Prime Five Spirits and Five Venerables Divine Perfected* pertains to the *Shangqing* incense offering; the *Most High Numinous Treasure Supreme Prime Celestial Worthy* pertains to the *spontaneous* incense offering. The *Jade Maidens Transmitting Messages to the August Lords* pertains to the *Dongshen* incense offering; the *Most High Primordial Five Spirits Venerable Lord Lao* pertains to the *Zhengyi* incense offering. Other variations are too numerous to list comprehensively. As for the *Numinous Treasure*, it follows the *Golden Register Writ* in its entirety. However, the *Yellow Register Writ* differs, as in its description: the Incense Officers, the Left and Right Dragon-Tiger Lords, the Dragon Courier Riders, the Incense-Attending Jade Maidens, and the Five Emperors’ Direct Talisman Officers—thirty-six of each—emerge. Master Zhang Wanfu’s *Orthodox Retreat* incense offering follows the *Yellow Register Writ*, yet for the *Host Initiation* and *Retreat Conclusion*, it reverts to the *Golden Register Writ*. The invocations differ between the two. It is likely that the *Orthodox Retreat* follows the original scripture, while the *Host Initiation* and *Retreat Conclusion* employ the *spontaneous audience* method, thus adhering to the *Golden Register Writ*—though this is not certain. As the teachings have been transmitted for so long, discrepancies abound.

As in the *Golden Register Writ*, beneath the Three and Five Merit Officers, the five characters "Left and Right Official Envoys" are absent, yet they appear in the *Alliance with the True* ritual scriptures. The *Golden Register Writ* speaks of "Incense-Attending Golden Lads," while the *Alliance with the True* renders them as "Jade Lads." The *Golden Register Writ* mentions "Incense-Attending Jade Maidens," whereas Master Lu’s and Du Guangcheng’s rites refer to them simply as "Jade Maidens," and Zhang Qingdu’s ritual calls them "Flower-Scattering Jade Maidens." Beneath the Five Emperors’ Direct Talisman Officers in the *Golden Register* and *Alliance with the True*, the four characters "Direct Day Incense Officers" are absent, yet all rites by Master Lu, Zhang, and Du include them. All *Alliance with the True* scriptures speak of "before the Perfected Jade Emperor," while the *Yellow Register Writ* reads "before the Jade Emperor, the August Thearch’s Presence."

In essence, the Three Registers and *Alliance with the True* scriptures are used in mutual reference, hence the ritual code states: "The *Alliance with the True* cannot be performed alone; the *Golden Register* cannot be used exclusively." Though the *Yellow Register*’s *Roots of Transgression* varies in scroll titles and names, it too serves as a common lower canon with broad applications. As for the re-lighting of the incense burner, discrepancies likewise arise, which cannot be fully explicated. Here, we provisionally record the *Host Initiation* and incense-lighting rites; the rest may be inferred by analogy.

**Explanation of the Dharma-Rank Announcement and Audience Petition**
Master Zhang Wanfu states: Each participant shall announce their received Dharma rank. When reciting, let the voice be heard only by oneself, avoiding clamor. The rest follows this example.

**Text for the Dharma-Rank Announcement and Audience Petition after the Conclusion of the *Host Initiation* and Incense-Lighting**
This passage is drawn from the *True Immortal Ranks* of the *Upper Prime Golden Register Writ* in the *Scriptures of the Numinous Treasure*, serving as the ritual code for the *Audience with the Host of Perfected Ones* and the *Dignified Rites of the Assembly of Perfected*, known as the *spontaneous audience* method. It differs from the triple incense-offering and vow-recitation of the *Orthodox Retreat*, as it does not invoke the sacred ranks.

In Zhang and Du’s *Host Initiation* rites, after announcing the Dharma rank, the text proceeds: "Your servant so-and-so now burns this vow-incense, dedicating these merits..."—this follows a single scriptural source. Among the *Host Initiation* rites for the various *Numinous Treasure Retreats* preserved in the canon, none include the invocation of sacred ranks. Only one *Standing Rite for the Spontaneous Numinous Treasure Retreat*—of uncertain authorship—replaces much of the original phrasing with contemporary language and inserts the invocation of sacred ranks during the procession. Later generations have uncritically perpetuated this practice, and even the transmissions of Liu Chongjing follow suit. Though it is said that when offering incense and petitions, one must first report to the Supreme Mystery, the invocation of sacred ranks during the procession derives from the *Alliance with the True Ritual Code of the Nine Dark Prisons of the Long Night’s Treasury in the Cavern Mystery*, where the Celestial Worthy of Original Beginning, in the Fragrant Grove Garden, taught the seven thousand two hundred and forty youths the methods of transforming the body’s majestic radiance and destiny. Summoning the flying deities and transcendents of the ten directions, he expounded the karmic retribution of transgressions and blessings, delivering the highest ranks. The Great Dao Lord of the Supreme then petitioned the Celestial Worthy of Original Beginning, seeking to bestow teachings for cultivation and the deliverance of all beings. Thereupon, the flying deities and transcendents were commanded to establish the protocols for the *Duty of the Retreat*. The invocation of sacred ranks during the procession originates here.

The *Host Initiation* and dispersal of the retreat follow the *spontaneous audience* method. Since it traces its lineage to the *Golden Register Writ*, which lacks such invocations, they cannot be arbitrarily inserted. Moreover, the prayers of supplication, repentance, gratitude, and vows rely solely on the transcendents’ memorializing the retreat’s sincerity. Here, we adhere to the ancient ritual code and omit the sacred ranks. Yet, fearing that later students, unfamiliar with the scriptural texts, might harbor doubts, we briefly elucidate the origins.

**Explanation of the Ten Directions Salutation**
At midday, the salutation begins with the East; at night, it begins with the North.
Master Zhang Wanfu states: For every bow, first recite "With utmost sincerity, I take refuge in the East," then focus the mind on the East. Lower the body, bend the knees, and invoke the "Boundless Supreme Numinous Treasure." Gradually descend until both hands touch the ground. As the invocation of "Celestial Worthy" concludes, the forehead touches the ground. Rise in unison with the voice, neither too swiftly nor too slowly, with measured rhythm. Ensure the five bodily postures conform to the ritual, avoiding cramped or lax movements. Align the ascent and descent; after each bow, rise from the seated position before resuming the seat, following the example below—never remain seated. Strike the chime only after the recitation of "Celestial Worthy" concludes. This is called *salutation* because the rising, bowing, and kneeling proceed with dignified order, in accordance with the ritual. Only those who can salute with utmost sincerity truly perform the salutation; those who perform the salutation must possess utmost sincerity. If one does not examine the reverence of form, how can the mind’s intent be conveyed? Thus, repentance and prayers for blessings always begin with salutation.

**Explanation of the Three Karmas’ Repentance**
After the salutation, each participant kneels upright, holds the tablet, kowtows, and repents.
Master Zhang Wanfu states: From the salutation to the Ten Directions’ Celestial Worthies through the repentance of the Three Karmas, all derive from the *Perpetual Audience Rite of the Numinous Treasure*. The Three Petitions and Three Eulogies follow.

The Dao as one’s spouse, the scriptures cherished as jade and pearls.
Holding precepts to restrain the six passions, mindful of the Way to dispel desires.
In tranquility, the upright qi abides; in serenity, the spirit rests in silence.
Heavenly demons all revere and protect, generation after generation receiving great blessings.
The household and state flourish in abundance; the scriptures and Dao thrive in splendor.
Heavenly beings and humans share this aspiration, ascending into the Great Vehicle in subtle mystery.
By the mind, the field of merit is established; the Wheel of Dharma ascends in boundless motion.
Seven generations of ancestors ascend to heaven; this body soars in broad daylight.
The Great Dao pervades the profound void—with thought, nothing remains unanswered.
Refining the essence to join the immortals, thus attaining the vajra body.
Transcending the Three Realms’ tribulations, liberating from the Five Sufferings of hell.
All return to the *Supreme Scripture*; in stillness, bow with reverence.

The above is from the *Dongxuan Lingbao Xiaomo Baozhen Anzhi Zhihui Benyuan Dajie Shangpin Jing* (*Scripture of the Supreme Precepts of the Numinous Treasure’s Treasure of Wisdom for Dispelling Demons, Stabilizing the Will, and Fulfilling Fundamental Vows*), also found in the *Bu Xu Jing of Yuqing Mountain*, known as the *Ritual Scripture*. After each recitation concludes, one proclaims "excellent" and bows once. The oral instructions of the perfected state: the jade maidens and immortal youths attending the scriptures, upon hearing this invocation, rejoice and protect the devotee’s body. All great scriptures employ this invocation in their veneration. For those who venerate the scriptures in silent contemplation, they inwardly recite the text—this is the secret of the highest immortals.

In ritual purification, the scriptures are the foundation. In all purification rites, before the Three Treasures, the sacred scriptures must be placed to consecrate the altar. Thus, the *Shangyuan Jinlu Jianwen Zhenxian Pin* (*Catalogue of Perfected Immortals of the Golden Register of the Upper Prime*) states: upon completing the circumambulation in the purification rite’s dignified observances, all turn northward to venerate the scriptures with three bows.

**Explanation of the Three Bows**
Master Zhang Wanfu states: The Three Bows derive from the *Perpetual Audience Rite of the Numinous Treasure*.

*End of Scroll Thirty-Two of the* Wushang Huanglu Da Zhai Licheng Yi
*Scroll Thirty-Three of the* Wushang Huanglu Da Zhai Licheng Yi *begins*

The Venerable Master Chongjing of the Three Caverns, as transmitted by Liu Yongguang to the Celestial Enforcer of the Most High, Jiang Shuyu, compiled:

**Methods for Purification Rites: Explanation of the Placement of the True Writs for Pacification and Consecration**

The Hidden Scripts of the Myriad Heavens, the Spontaneous Jade Writs, and the Boundless Cavern Chapters derive from the *Lingbao Scripture on the Five Refinements for Deliverance from the Corpse*. They are also called the *Method of the Five Immortals’ Refinements for Pacifying Spirits and Consecrating the Divine*, specifically for the deliverance of the departed. For the consecration of purification altars, these must be observed and employed.

The method requires writing in cinnabar on azure paper to consecrate the five directions. On the eve of the rite, after reciting the writ, it is secured with a golden dragon. When dispersing the altar, after reciting the writ, the disciple holds it above the incense smoke while the Dharma Master strikes his teeth twelve times and intones the incantation:

*"Most High Perfected, Great Sage and Lofty Honored One,
Spreading transformation and circulating qi through the Thirty-Two Heavens.
Eight Assemblies and Nine Radiances, spontaneously forming script—
Pacifying and consecrating heaven and earth, preserving and governing the kalpas.
The Primordial Beginning’s talismanic command universally notifies the Three Primes.
Below, it commands the Nine Earths; above, it seals the Myriad Heavens.
At its center, it announces to the seas and mountains, the famous peaks and great rivers.
Today, this supreme proclamation is heard by all spirits.
Disciple So-and-So, performing purification and practicing the Dao,
Delivers and uplifts the hidden souls, the Three Offices and Nine Bureaus.
Eradicates the roots of transgression, eternally delivering from the Three Paths.
The source of the Five Sufferings, generation after generation, receives blessings.
Names recorded in the cinnabar register, spirits ascend to heaven.
Refinement and transformation occur naturally, opening deliverance from life and death.
Preserved for kalpas unnumbered, by the Nine Heavens’ edict.
Transmitted by wind and fire couriers."*

All respond three times. From the *Lingbao Inner Sound Jade Formula*.

After the incantation, the writ is burned in the memorial casket. There are also methods for employing the Five Elders’ Red Writs and Jade Scripts, which are not fully recorded here. The *Jade Formula of the Red Writs*, with Du Guangcheng’s preface, is appended to the left.

The Yellow Register Purification Rite fundamentally aims to rescue hidden souls, uplift wandering spirits, open deliverance for those in eternal night, and ascend and ferry those in the depths of the Yellow Springs. Yet its benefits extend further: averting calamity and inviting fortune, repenting transgressions and seeking grace, universally cultivating for humans and heavens, and benefiting both families and states—its merits are all-pervasive.

The consecrated *Lingbao True Writs of the Five Elders’ Red Scripts*, when examined in detail, serve four distinct purposes:
1. Seeking immortality and receiving the Dao: the twenty-four characters beginning with the Nine Qi of the Eastern Direction.
2. Warding off and restraining stellar influences: the thirty-two characters beginning with Jupiter, assisting the liver.
3. Subduing and vanquishing demonic spirits: the thirty-two characters beginning with the incantation of the Eastern Mountain Spirit.
4. Dispelling and eliminating water disasters: the thirty-two characters beginning with "Below, restrain the Eastern River."

The applications of the five writs are thus complete.

Master Zhang Wanfu of the Pure Capital Abbey in the Western Capital, in his *Ritual Norms*, states: The Hidden Scripts of the Myriad Heavens and the Eight Assemblies’ Jade Writs were expounded by the Celestial Worthy of Primordial Beginning in the Fragrant Grove Garden to the Youth of Supreme Wisdom. They deliver from the Five Sufferings and ferry across the Nine Dark Realms. In the *Rite for Transmigrating Spirits*, they are carved into stone for practical use.

Now, for the Yellow Register rites of deliverance, these texts should be employed. Whether in mourning or celebration, their application is measured and fitting. May they be perpetuated through endless kalpas, universally practiced. The incantations and burnt offerings are equivalent to the true writs. Established methods exist for these, and they are to be widely propagated.

Written on the fifteenth day of the tenth month, the *guiwei* day, in the first year of the Tianfu era (Xin-You year), by Du Guangting, Feathered Robe of Tianmu Peak, styled Shengbin.

**Three Hymns of Wisdom with Exegesis**

**Wisdom arises from the formless,**
Radiant, transcending the ten directions.
It weaves emptiness to tower in the dark firmament,
While all heavens draw from its flowing fragrance.
Its subtlety defies thought,
Yet through emptiness, truth and reality commune.
Being is ultimately non-being,
Non-being embraces all without exclusion.

**Wisdom ever observes the body,**
The foremost task in learning the Dao.
Vast and boundless, it roams the mysterious,
Naturally recording my spirit.
The Celestial Worthy ever shields and guards,
While demon kings pledge their protection.
Resplendent is the vajra body,
Transcendent, a Supreme Immortal.

**Wisdom engenders the root of precepts,**
For the true Dao, precepts are the master.
From this, the Three Treasures arise,
Revered and received by lofty immortals.
Aboard this deathless vessel,
Swiftly cross the great expanse.
At this moment of preaching precepts,
All heavens come to bow in homage.

*From the* Scripture of the Numinous Treasure on the Great Precepts of Wisdom-Observing the Body. *After each hymn, perform one prostration.*

The Preceptor of the Sharp Precepts faces west; the assembly faces east.

The Celestial Worthy addressed the Most High Lord of the Dao: "Now, let the Dharma-sound be universally proclaimed to awaken all beings. For all men and women, dispel calamities and avert misfortunes. Invoke blessings, deliver lives, and eradicate the roots of all suffering. Let the living perceive the Dao and escape the Eight Difficulties; let the dead rejoice, feasting in celestial halls. May they soon be reborn among humans, in the household of a Wheel-Turning Sage King. Those who cultivate fasts and seek the Dao must do so with single-minded devotion. Receive the Ten Precepts with earnest attention and never forget them. Focus your thoughts in silent contemplation, profoundly reflecting on the natural. Do not allow scattered thoughts to disturb body and spirit. Those who can do this should now listen attentively."

**The First Precept:** Let the heart harbor no malice or envy; do not nurture hidden harm. Guard your speech, be mindful of transgressions, and let your thoughts dwell on the Dharma.
