Bringing auspicious signs of peace for a hundred million years.

**Hymn of Scattering Flowers**

On Jade Capital Mountain, the assembly of the Perfected gathers in the Scattering Flowers Grove,
Ten immortals together intone the *Step-in-Emptiness* melody, scattering blossoms to fill the ritual ground—
An offering before the Heavenly Worthy.

Five-colored auspicious clouds follow their steps as they depart the Scattering Flowers Grove,
Six-jewel immortal robes draped upon them as they arrive to fill the ritual ground—
An offering before the Heavenly Worthy.

A resonant note from the Void descends beneath the moon in the Scattering Flowers Grove,
Three chants of *Step-in-Emptiness* ascend into the clouds to fill the ritual ground—
An offering before the Heavenly Worthy.

**Ten Remembrances**

First, Heaven and Earth in harmonious union;
Second, sun and moon in lofty brightness;
Third, yin and yang in orderly succession;
Fourth, the realm at peace and tranquility;
Fifth, the sovereign’s ten thousand years of longevity;
Sixth, the ministers’ upright governance;
Seventh, the myriad families in bliss;
Eighth, the hundred grains in abundant harvest;
Ninth, those in the hidden paths freed from suffering;
Tenth, the Great Dao flourishing in practice.

**Twelve Vows**

First, may the cosmos shine in purity;
Second, may the celestial signs be clear and perfect;
Third, may the Sage enjoy boundless longevity;
Fourth, may transformation extend to the Eight Boundaries;
Fifth, may sweet dew descend from Heaven;
Sixth, may auspicious mist rise from the Earth;
Seventh, may the four seasons follow their course;
Eighth, may the myriad beings thrive in wholeness;
Ninth, may families practice filial piety and fraternal duty;
Tenth, may the realm abound in talent and virtue;
Eleventh, may Fengdu’s judgments cease;
Twelfth, may those who cultivate the Dao attain immortality.

**Four Concluding Vows**

May the Great Dao flourish and the scriptures spread—
With utmost sincerity, we bow our heads in reverence to the True Three Treasures.

May sagely transformation know no bounds, its radiance equaling the Three Luminaries—
With utmost sincerity, we bow our heads in reverence to the True Three Treasures.

May the master, venerable parents, the departed ascend to Heaven, and the living dwell in peace—
With utmost sincerity, we bow our heads in reverence to the True Three Treasures.

May all sentient beings escape suffering and together attain the Non-Action—
With utmost sincerity, we bow our heads in reverence to the True Three Treasures.

**Ten Vows from the *Jade Capital Scripture of the Supreme Clarity’s Jeweled Terrace Radiant Perfected***

First, may the Great Dao flow and spread, the world embracing virtue;
Second, may all sentient beings awaken to the Dao;
Third, may the sorrowful souls of the Nine Nights all attain liberation;
Fourth, may the lonely spirits without refuge all receive rebirth;
Fifth, may the world know great peace and the hundred grains ripen;
Sixth, may ministers be loyal, children filial, rulers benevolent, and fathers kind;
Seventh, may the Four Seas unite in harmony, enemies and kin reconciled;
Eighth, may those concealed in wombs and shells all be born and thrive;
Ninth, may chronic and acute illnesses swiftly heal;
Tenth, may the orphaned and exposed beings enjoy ample clothing and food.

**Here ends Scroll Thirty-Six of the *Ritual of the Supreme Yellow Register Great Fast***
**Scroll Thirty-Seven of the *Ritual of the Supreme Yellow Register Great Fast*** begins.

The Venerable Master Chongjing of the Three Caverns, posthumously styled Master Guang, transmitted the teachings to the Supreme Enforcer of the Dao, Immortal Jiang Shuyu, who compiled this section on the sequence of ritual praises.

**Establishing the Grand Fast and Enacting the Supreme Rites**
The principles are manifold, and the practices indeed intricate. Only by adhering strictly to the regulations can resonance with the unseen be achieved. Should the sequence be neglected or altered at will, not only would it mislead the spirits and the living, but it might also offend the celestial statutes. Thus, we meticulously expound upon the ancient canons and establish this standardized ritual. From beginning to end, all must conform to the prescribed model.

**Sequence for Invoking the Officers**
First, before the hall, arrange the positions for the Merit-Officers, Talisman-Messengers, and divine attendants, with offerings of incense, tea, wine, and fruit. Either thirty-six or twenty-four divisions may be made. The Daoist assembly stands in ordered ranks before the Three Treasures. Next, intone the *Tang Song*; then, the Dharma Master ascends to offer incense and makes a silent memorial. The Ritual Officer then performs two bows while offering incense. The Dharma Master transforms the spirits and paces the *Dang* steps. The assembly moves to the officers’ positions for purification by sprinkling. The Dharma Master offers incense to summon the officers. The Ritual Officer offers incense and bows. The first offering of tea and wine follows, after which the Dharma Master makes an announcement. The Ritual Officer again offers incense and bows. The second offering of wine follows, and the Dharma Master makes another announcement. The Ritual Officer offers incense and bows a third time. The third offering of wine follows. The memorial document and summons are read aloud. The Dharma Master dispatches the officers by burning the documents, while the Ritual Officer kneels and pours a libation. The ritual proceeds, followed by the dedication of merits.

**Sequence for Raising the Banner**
First, set up an incense table beneath the banner pole. The Dharma Master offers incense and makes an invocation. The Ritual Officer offers incense and bows. The Dharma Master recites the *Lingfan Absolution Mantra*, and the assembly repeats it in unison. The banner is raised, followed by the dedication of merits.

**Sequence for Opening the Scriptures**
First, gather the Daoist assembly before the Three Treasures in ordered ranks. The Dharma Master offers incense and invokes the sages. The Ritual Officer offers incense and bows. The *Kaijing Shu* is recited. The Ritual Officer kneels, holding the censer, and reads the memorial aloud. Upon completion, gold paper money is burned along with it. Hymns of praise are chanted at will to accumulate merit. The *Three Refuges* are intoned, followed by the chanting of the *Daochang*. Each participant holds a tablet before the heart and sits properly, as the assembly settles. Hymns and chants proceed according to ritual. The *Yin Suming Zan* is sung, incense is offered, and the scriptures are recited. The *Zan Jing* follows the prescribed form. The *Jing Nian* is chanted in stillness. The *Qing Zhuan Falun* is intoned, and the scriptures are recited. Upon completion, the *Dujing* strikes the chime, and the *Shijing* collects the scriptures. The *Jiezuo Song* is recited, followed by the *Qili Tan Jing*. The *San Wen Jing Zan* is sung, then the *Yin Taishang Zhihui Jing Zan*, concluding with the dedication of merits.

If ascending the altar to recite the scriptures, the assembly stands in ranks before the Mystic Master. The *Dujing* intones the *Dao Zan*. The *Huaxia* ascends the altar and enters the chamber, as in the audience ritual. Upon reaching their positions, they stand in formation and chant the *Three Refuges*. The scriptures are recited in order. Upon completion, the *Xuexian Song* is sung. The assembly exits the altar before the Mystic Master, and the dedication of merits concludes. The assembly disperses to the refectory as usual.

**Sequence for Presenting Memorials**
First, arrange the ritual space, setting out offerings before the central Three Treasures. To the left, place the positions for the Orthodox Unity’s Three Masters; to the right, the positions for the Memorial Officers and Divine Generals, in thirty-six divisions. The Daoist assembly stands in ranks before the Celestial Master’s Hall. The Dharma Master offers incense. The Ritual Officer offers incense and bows. The *An Ren Ge* is sung, each participant expressing reverence. The Master is invited. The Ritual Officer offers incense and bows again. The libation ritual proceeds. The Dharma Master offers incense, kneels, and presents the memorial’s intent. The hymn leads to the Memorial Officers’ Hall. The Dharma Master offers incense. The Ritual Officer offers incense and bows. The Dharma Master makes an invocation. The Memorial Officers are invited. The Ritual Officer offers incense and bows again. The libation ritual for the three offerings proceeds, with invocations as prescribed. The hymn leads to the Three Treasures’ presence. The Dharma Master enters the chamber to offer incense. The Ritual Officer offers incense and bows again. The Dharma Master returns to his position, offers incense, and performs the memorial presentation ritual. The *Ge Lishi Cunnian* is chanted as prescribed. The Dharma Master recites the *Weiling Zhou*. The *Ming Fagu* is struck twenty-four times. The Dharma Master kindles the incense burner. Each participant announces their ritual position. The Dharma Master enters the scripture. The Three Pure Ones’ positions are invoked. The libation ritual proceeds. The *Changgui Chuguan* is chanted, and the assembly kneels in formation. The Dharma Master visualizes the spirits and invokes the officers. The Dharma Master opens the memorial and hands it to the *Shijing*. The *Shijing* kneels to receive the memorial, then stands with the *Shixiang* before the Three Treasures. The memorial is recited. The Ritual Officer kneels before the censer. The memorial is reviewed. The Dharma Master dispatches the memorial. It is fumigated, sealed, and placed in a case. The *Shijing* carries the memorial case, the *Jianzhai* escorts it, and the *Weiyi Huaxia* leads the procession to the burning site, where it is consumed by fire. The *Duguan* is read. One person is dispatched separately to the Memorial Officers’ Hall to read the *Congzhang Shu*, which is burned in a separate location. The *Fenzhang Song* is recited. The Dharma Master prostrates to visualize the spirits and presents the memorial as prescribed. All remain in profound silence until the response is received. If a talisman is to be issued, it follows here. The *Songsheng Song* is recited. The Dharma Master dismisses the officers and restores the incense burner. The *Chutang Song* is recited before the Celestial Master to express gratitude. The Master is sent off. The dedication of merits concludes, and the assembly retires.

**Sequence for Issuing Talismans**
After presenting the memorial for absolution in Fengdu, the Dharma Master offers incense and makes an invocation. The Dharma Master consecrates the *Jiuku Fu* talisman. The memorial text is recited. The Dharma Master consecrates the talisman again. The Dharma Master issues the *Yuqing Bajiu Hun Fu* as above. The Dharma Master issues the *Yuqing Podiyu Fu*. The Dharma Master issues the *Taishang Chi She Shengtian Baolu*. The Dharma Master issues the *Donghua Qinggong Jiulong Fuming*. The Dharma Master summons the courier officers and youths. The summons and paper horses are read aloud. The Dharma Master consecrates and dispatches the youths and couriers. The talismans are burned. The paper horses are read aloud and burned.

**Sequence for Transmitting the Register**
*(Text continues with the transmission ritual sequence.)*

**Sequence for Establishing the Ritual Offices**

First, the Daoist assembly gathers in the Hall of Serene Silence to deliberate and appoint the six ritual officers, drafting their respective appointment documents and rosters. Then, in proper rank and order, they stand before the ancestral masters in the Hall of Serene Silence. The Dharma Master offers incense, and one person reads the roster of offices aloud. All return to their positions and stand. The officiating steward is then led before the ancestral masters to perform the bow, offer incense, and make two prostrations. Next, the steward is led before the Dharma Master to make two prostrations, kneel, and present the petition requesting the master to transmit the ancient ritual in three kneeling bows. For brevity, the Dharma Master now receives the petition. The steward makes two more prostrations, then hands the petition to the Supervising Steward. The Supervising Steward presents the petition, requesting the master to ascend the high seat. Once the Dharma Master consents, the cantor leads the master to the seat. The petition is read aloud. The Dharma Master consecrates the incense and invokes the covenant. The Fourfold Vows are made. The Dharma Master descends from the seat. The covenant document is written. The cantor leads the master out of the hall to rest in the tent. The concluding dedication and recitation of merits follow, and the steward performs the bow and disperses according to the usual rite.

**Sequence for Erecting the Tents**
First, the Daoist assembly invokes the Heavenly Worthy of the Golden Portal’s Transformative Body and escorts the Dharma Master out of the Hall of Serene Silence. They proceed to the supervising officer’s station, where incense is offered and an invocation made, followed by the reading of the oath proclamation. The High Priest approaches the tent of the Mystic Master to offer incense, while the assembled officials arrange themselves in ranks and bow. The steward offers incense and performs the bow. The Mystic Master is invited to descend. The Mystic Master is invited to recite the hymn. The steward offers incense, performs the bow, and presents tea. The High Priest makes an invocation. The memorial is read aloud. The memorial is burned. The cantor leads the procession to the tent of the Five Emperors. The High Priest offers incense, and the assembled officials arrange themselves in ranks and bow. The steward offers incense and performs the bow. The Five Emperors are invited to descend. The Five Emperors are invited to recite the hymn. The steward offers incense, performs the bow, and presents tea. The High Priest makes an invocation. The memorial is read aloud. The covenant document is read. The memorial and covenant document are burned. The cantor leads the procession to the tent of the Heavenly Master. The High Priest offers incense, and the assembled officials arrange themselves in ranks and bow. The steward offers incense and performs the bow. The Heavenly Master is invited to descend. The Heavenly Master is invited to recite the hymn. The steward offers incense, performs the bow, and presents tea. The High Priest makes an invocation. The memorial is read aloud. The covenant document is read and then left in the tent. The memorial is burned. The cantor leads the procession to the tent of the Three Masters. The High Priest offers incense, and the assembled officials arrange themselves in ranks and bow. The steward offers incense and performs the bow. The Scripture Master is invited to descend. The Scripture Master is invited to recite the hymn. The Register Master is invited to descend. The Register Master is invited to recite the hymn. The Ordination Master is invited to descend. The Ordination Master is invited to recite the hymn. The steward performs the bow and presents tea. The High Priest makes an invocation. The memorial is read aloud. The memorial is burned. The cantor leads the procession to the tent of the Three Officials. The High Priest offers incense, and the assembled officials arrange themselves in ranks and bow. The steward offers incense and performs the bow. The Heavenly Official is invited to descend. The Heavenly Official is invited to recite the hymn. The Earthly Official is invited to descend. The Earthly Official is invited to recite the hymn. The Water Official is invited to descend. The Water Official is invited to recite the hymn. The steward offers incense, performs the bow, and presents tea. The High Priest makes an invocation. The memorial is read aloud. The covenant document is read. The memorial and covenant document are burned. The cantor leads the procession to the tent of the Supervising Steward. The High Priest offers incense, and the assembled officials arrange themselves in ranks and bow. The steward offers incense and performs the bow. The Supervising Dharma Master is invited to descend. The Supervising Steward is invited to recite the hymn. The steward offers incense, performs the bow, and presents tea. The High Priest makes an invocation. The memorial is read aloud. The memorial is burned. The assembly processes in grand circuit back to the altar and stands in order. The High Priest, leading the six ritual officers and assembled officials, holds willow branches and water vessels, recites the *Purification of Heaven and Earth Mantra*, ascends the altar, circumambulates, sprinkles the purification, and returns to their positions. The altar is consecrated according to the rite. The concluding dedication and recitation of merits follow, and the assembly bows and retires.

**Sequence for Inviting the Light and Distributing the Lamps**
First, a single torch is lit before the Three Treasures, and the Daoist assembly arranges itself in ranks before the ritual altar. The steward offers incense and performs the bow. The Dharma Master, accompanied by the incense and scripture attendants, ascends the altar and invokes the invitation of the light. The Dharma Master holds the talismanic torch in hand and recites the *Divine Brilliance Mantra*. The Dharma Master takes the torch and, before the Three Treasures, invites the light into hand, reciting the *Mantra of Distributing the Lamp of Wisdom*. The incense and lamp attendants each take paper torches and receive the light from the Dharma Master’s talismanic torch. The Dharma Master invokes the distribution of radiance. The *Heavenly Worthy of the Dharma Realm’s Flowing Light* is intoned. The incense and lamp attendants light the lamps on the altar. Each official holds a paper torch, receives the light from the Dharma Master’s hand, and lights the lamps throughout the ritual space, ensuring all are illuminated. The Dharma Master visualizes and performs the ritual. The Daoist assembly chants the *Hymn of Radiant Returning Light*. The Dharma Master makes two prostrations, performs the concluding dedication, recites the merits, and descends from the altar. The lamp attendant recites the lamp ritual according to the regulations. Once the altar is established, mantras may also be recited.

**Sequence for the Preliminary Rites and Establishing the Altar**
First, the Daoist assembly gathers in the Hall of Serene Silence, performs the ablutions with fragrant water, and stands in their respective positions. The High Priest is invited into the oratory. The steward offers incense and performs the bow. The *Heavenly Worthy of the Golden Portal’s Transformative Body* is intoned. The grand circuit procession leads to the tents of the Five Emperors, the Three Masters, and the Supervising Steward. The High Priest and steward offer incense. The procession leads to the tents of the Three Officials and the Heavenly Master. The High Priest and steward offer incense. The procession leads to the tent of the Mystic Master, where the assembly stands in ranks. The High Priest offers incense. The steward offers incense, holds the ritual petition before the Mystic Master, states the purpose of the fast, and makes two prostrations. The High Priest offers incense, makes three prostrations, and kneels. The steward turns, holds the petition, kneels, and presents it to the High Priest, then makes two prostrations and retires to the right. The High Priest places the petition on the memorial tablet and invokes the fast. The *Hymn to the Dao* is sung. The Dharma Masters proceed to the altar and stand in order to the left and right. The High Priest and steward offer incense and perform the bow. The High Priest consecrates the incense and invokes the deities. The petition to establish the altar is read aloud. The petition is burned. The bronze bell, chime, and jade chime are sounded. The grand circuit procession leads the High Priest to ascend the outer altar. The steward ascends the altar. The assembled officials ascend the altar in order and circumambulate. The grand circuit procession arrives at the earth gate. The High Priest recites the secret mantra, enters the gate, and leads the officials to ascend the central altar. If the ritual decorum does not permit entry to the central altar, they remain at the outer altar and circumambulate. The High Priest and steward ascend the celestial gate to enter the inner altar and offer incense to the ten directions. The steward offers incense to the ten directions, returns to position, and makes two prostrations. The High Priest offers incense at the imperial desk, returns to position, and begins the hall hymn. The chief cantor intones the respective salutations, and the assembly visualizes and recites as prescribed. The High Priest recites the *Guardian Spirit Mantra*. The chief cantor intones the sounding of the Dharma drum twenty-four times. The High Priest kindles the incense burner. The High Priest offers incense at his station, and the incense attendant leads the steward to offer incense to the ten directions. The chief cantor intones the respective Dharma titles. The High Priest invokes the deities. The *Salutation to the Ten Directions* is chanted according to the rite. The High Priest confesses the three karmic offenses. The chief cantor intones, *"We, with utmost sincerity, take refuge in the Most High Three Treasures and the saints of the ten directions."* The *Salutation to the Scriptures* is performed according to the rite. The *Three Invocations* and three hymns are each followed by one prostration. The chief cantor intones the *Threefold Salutation*.

Next, the High Priest proceeds to the east to offer incense. The High Priest holds the eastern *True Writ*, fumigates it with incense, and recites the *True Writ*. The assembled officials echo the incantation in unison, and upon its completion, each performs two prostrations. The High Priest then proceeds to the south to offer incense and reveals the southern *True Writ* in the manner of the eastern rite. The High Priest proceeds to the west to offer incense and reveals the western *True Writ* in the manner of the eastern rite. The High Priest proceeds to the north to offer incense and reveals the northern *True Writ* in the manner of the eastern rite. The High Priest proceeds to the central altar to offer incense and reveals the central *True Writ* in the manner of the eastern rite. The High Priest then recites a general incantation over all the *True Writs*, and the assembled officials echo the incantation in unison. Upon its completion, the High Priest returns to his station.

Next, the *Memorial to the Ten Directional Spirit-Officials* is proclaimed. The chief cantor intones the respective Dharma titles once more. The High Priest performs the second invocation. The oration is proclaimed. The steward is led to offer incense and stands at ease. When the oration reaches the words *"We humbly invoke..."*, the steward performs two prostrations, kneels, and holds the censer. The High Priest enters the ritual section. Three hymns of *Wisdom* are chanted, and the procession circumambulates once. The High Priest proceeds to the chief cantor’s station and stands. The *Silent Salutation to the Ten Directions* is chanted.

Next, the cantor intones the *Dignified Rites for the Precept Assembly*, and the assembled officials sit at ease to receive the precepts. The precepts are expounded. The *Hymn of Receiving the Precepts* is chanted, and the procession circumambulates once. Upon completion, the *Threefold Salutation of Receiving the Precepts* is performed, and the High Priest returns to his station. The High Priest performs the *Rite of Reinstatement*. The High Priest performs two prostrations to receive his mandate. The chief cantor and those below, in order, perform two prostrations before the High Priest, kneel to receive their mandates, and perform two prostrations upon completion. The chief cantor intones, and the assembled officials sit at ease for the *Proclamation of Prohibitions and Dignified Rites*. The High Priest proclaims the *Ritual of Prohibitions*. The *Three Prostrations for the Steward’s Pledge and Penalty* are performed. The High Priest replenishes the incense burner. The *Hymn of the Immortal’s Ascent* is chanted to escort the High Priest out—whether to the *Void* or to the *Precept Assembly*. The High Priest proceeds to the eastern triple curtain to offer incense. The High Priest proceeds to the western triple curtain to offer incense and arranges the curtains of the *Mystic Masters* in order. The *Hymn of Dedication* is chanted. The High Priest offers incense and secretly petitions to redress transgressions. The chief cantor intones, and the *Steward’s Rebuke for Transgressions* is proclaimed. The *Hymn of Return to the Hall* is chanted. The steward offers incense and prostrates to express gratitude to the Dharma Master. The *Hymn of Taking Refuge in the Supreme Dao* is chanted. The chief cantor announces, *"The rites of establishing the altar are complete,"* and the assembled officials return to their stations.

---

**Rite of Breaking the Prisons**
First, proceed to the prison lamps and arrange the assembly in order. The ritual begins. The High Priest and the steward offer incense. The High Priest petitions and presents the talisman. The *Proclamation of Breaking the Prisons* is read. The assigned Daoist officiant recites the *Rite of the Nine Prison Lamps*. The High Priest, following the rite, proceeds to each prison, wields the ritual staff, and dispatches the talisman to break the prisons as prescribed. The *Dedication of Merit* is recited.

**Rite of Summoning the Spirits**
First, proceed to the summoning site and arrange the assembly in order. The ritual begins. The High Priest performs the rites, and the assigned Daoist officiant summons and gathers the departed spirits according to the rite. The spirits are guided by cryptic verses to the bathing site. The assigned Daoist officiant recites the *Rite of Ablution*. The spirits are welcomed to pay homage. The spirits are escorted back to their stations, and the *Rite of Feeding the Spirits* is performed according to the rite.

*(If delayed, the rites may also be performed at night.)*

**Rite of the Main Offering**
First, the Daoist assembly gathers in the Hall of Silence, performs the incense offering, washes, and rinses, and stands in their respective stations to invite the High Priest into the hall. The steward offers incense and performs prostrations. The *Heavenly Worthy of the Golden Portal, Transformed Body* is invoked. The *Hymn of the Hua-Xia* is chanted to escort the High Priest in paying homage to the curtains of the *Five Emperors, Three Masters, and the Steward*. The High Priest and the steward offer incense. They pay homage to the curtains of the *Three Officials and Heavenly Masters*. The High Priest and the steward offer incense. The assembly lines up before the curtains of the *Mystic Masters* in order. The High Priest and the steward offer incense. The High Priest silently petitions the intent of the offering. The *Hymn of the Dao* is chanted. The *Hymn of the Hua-Xia* is chanted to ascend the altar according to the rite. The High Priest enters the hall, offers incense to the ten directions according to the rite, and returns to his station. The steward offers incense to the ten directions, returns to his station, and performs two prostrations. The chief cantor intones, and each pays homage to the masters while contemplating them as prescribed. The High Priest recites the *Guardian Spirit Incantation*. At midday, the procession is conducted without announcement. The chief cantor intones, and the Dharma drum is sounded twenty-four times. The High Priest kindles the incense burner. The chief cantor intones, and the Dharma drum is sounded twenty-four times again. The *Rite of the Martial Officials and Soldiers* is performed, and the assembled officials kneel in unison. The High Priest kneels and presents the officials as prescribed. The chief cantor intones the respective Dharma titles. The scriptures are presented with tea. The assigned Daoist officiant escorts the banner of the departed spirits to the foot of the altar for homage. The High Priest petitions. The oration is proclaimed, and the steward kneels with the censer. The High Priest offers incense to the ten directions thrice, reciting the vows as prescribed. The incense attendant leads the steward to offer incense to the ten directions thrice. The assembled officials stand to the west of the altar, facing east, and chant the *Salutation to the East* with three prostrations. Thereafter, the same is done for the other directions.

The High Priest and the steward offer incense to the east. They kneel to recite the *Eastern Repentance*, and the steward kneels with the censer. The same is done for the other directions. The assembly stands in the northwest, facing southeast, and chants the *Salutation to the Southeast*. Incense is offered, and repentance is performed as in the previous rite. The assembly stands in the north, facing south, and chants the *Salutation to the South*. Repentance is performed as in the rite. The assembly stands in the northeast, facing southwest, and chants the *Salutation to the Southwest*. Repentance is performed as in the rite. The assembly stands in the east, facing west, and chants the *Salutation to the West*. Repentance is performed as in the rite. The assembly stands in the southeast, facing northwest, and chants the *Salutation to the Northwest*. Repentance is performed as in the rite. The assembly stands in the south, facing north, and chants the *Salutation to the North*. Repentance is performed as in the rite. The assembly stands in the southwest, facing northeast, and chants the *Salutation to the Northeast*. Repentance is performed as in the rite. The assembly stands in the northwest, facing southeast, and chants the *Salutation to the Lower Realm*. Repentance is performed as in the rite. The assembly stands in the southeast, facing northwest, and chants the *Salutation to the Upper Realm*. Repentance is performed as in the rite. The assembly stands in the southwest, facing northeast, and chants the *Salutation to the Palace of the Sun*. Repentance is performed as in the rite. The assembly stands in the northeast, facing southwest, and chants the *Salutation to the Palace of the Moon*. Repentance is performed as in the rite. The assembly stands in the south, facing north, and chants the *Salutation to the Palace of the Stars*. Repentance is performed as in the rite. The assembly stands in the west, facing east, and chants the *Salutation to the Eastern Marchmount*. Repentance is performed as in the rite. The assembly stands in the north, facing south, and chants the *Salutation to the Southern Marchmount*. Repentance is performed as in the rite. The assembly stands in the east, facing west, and chants the *Salutation to the Western Marchmount*. Repentance is performed as in the rite. The assembly stands in the south, facing north, and chants the *Salutation to the Northern Marchmount*. Repentance is performed as in the rite. The assembly stands in the northeast, facing southwest, and chants the *Salutation to the Central Marchmount*. Repentance is performed as in the rite. The assembly stands in the south, facing north, and chants the *Salutation to the Water Palace*. Repentance is performed as in the rite. The assembly returns to their stations and chants the *Salutation to the Treasured Scriptures*. Repentance is performed as in the rite.

Then the High Master proceeds to the left and stands at the Ghost Gate, facing west; the Precentor stands at the Heavenly Gate, facing east. The Precentor chants, and each visualizes the nine-colored circular image, swallows saliva, and recites the secret incantation to command demons. Then the High Master recites the secret incantation to invoke the spirits. Next, the Precentor chants the *Step of Emptiness* and circumambulates, followed by the recitation of ten *Dong* hymns of the *Step of Emptiness*, circling three times. At the end of each hymn, flowers are scattered, and the assembly chants the *Shan* and bows once. Then the Precentor chants the *Salutation to the Scriptures* according to the rite. Next, three *Qi* odes are recited, each followed by one bow. The Precentor then chants the *Three Salutations*. The scripture attendants present the offering of broth. The Precentor chants the repeated invocation of the dharma ranks. The High Master offers profound thanks. The *Ten Recitations of the Ancient Rite* and the *Twelve Vows* are proclaimed: recited at dawn, midday, and the quiet of night. The High Master then replenishes the incense burner. The disciples of immortality sing the *Eulogy* and lead the High Master out the door. The High Master exits the altar and proceeds to the eastern tent to offer incense, then to the western tent to offer incense, standing in order before the tent of the Mystic Master. The *Hymn of Dedication* is chanted. The High Master offers incense and makes a secret offering of thanks. The Precentor chants the *Supervision of the Fast* and admonishes transgressions. The *Eulogy of Vast Return to the Hall* is sung, and the altar officers are dismissed to raise the invocation of the Heavenly Worthy and escort the spirit banner back to its place. The fast officers offer incense and bow in gratitude to the Dharma Master. The *Hymn of Refuge in the Supreme Dao* is chanted. The Precentor chants, and with the fast concluded, all officers return to their stations.

For three days, the proper fast is observed, and the Dao is practiced at the nine hours. All follows this sequence.

On the first day, following the establishment of the fast and the offering of incense at the furnace, the officers prostrate in long obeisance and withdraw. Each morning at dawn, they pay homage to the Master, after which the *Mantra for Guarding the Spirit* is recited. On the third day, after the evening ritual of pacing the Dao and offering incense at the furnace, they bow to the Celestial Officials and present the *Petition for Ascension*, proceeding directly to the petition rites. Upon completion of the petition, the documents are distributed and submitted according to the prescribed protocol. The remainder follows as before.

For the summoning of departed souls and the arrangement of the *hú* ritual, the sequence is as follows: First, proceed to the *Universal Summons* station and stand in order. Next, conduct the Dharma rites. The Dharma Master then performs the *Rite of Dispelling Darkness and Opening the Path*. Following this, enter the ritual protocol. Next, issue the *Universal Summons Petition*, and the Dharma Master submits the documents while the assigned Daoist priests perform the invocation as prescribed. The Dharma Master then takes his seat, chants the *Middle Scripture*, and guides the departed souls to stand below the dais. The Dharma Master performs the ritual, restoring the departed souls to wholeness. The *Vast Salvation of the Sunken and Lost Heavenly Worthy* is intoned. The Dharma Master then invokes the *Great Cavern Jade Talisman* to summon the spirits. Next, the Dharma Master issues the *Talisman of the Merit-Officials for Healing*. The *Heavenly Worthy of Universal Life through Brahma-Qi* is intoned. The Dharma Master then issues the *Talisman for Summoning the Five Spirits and Merging Qi*, performing the ritual as prescribed. The *Heavenly Worthy of Boundless Wondrous Action* is intoned, followed by the Dharma Master’s ritual performance. The *Heavenly Worthy of Transformation through Eons* is intoned. The Dharma Master then summons the three *hún* and seven *pò* for the departed souls. The *Heavenly Worthy of Transcendence and Liberation* is intoned. The Dharma Master recites the *Jade Clarity Mantra for Nurturing the Hún, Cultivating the Pò, and Preserving the Spirit*. The *Heavenly Worthy of the Golden Countenance Emerging into the World* is intoned. The Dharma Master performs the ritual, sprinkling water upon the departed souls to prepare them for ascension. The *Heavenly Worthy of Universal Moistening from the Numinous Source* is intoned. The departed souls are then guided through the *Rite of Ablution* as prescribed. Next, the departed souls are led in the *Hymn of Radiant Light from the Reed Enclosure*. The Daoist assembly stands in order at the *hú* banquet station, and the Dharma Master offers incense. The *Hymn of Universal Offering* is chanted. The Dharma Master performs the ritual and enters the protocol. The area is purified with sprinkled water. The *Hymn of Reverent Devotion* is intoned. The *Dao-Treasure* is invited, and the *Hymn of the Dao-Treasure* is chanted. The *Scripture-Treasure* is invited, and the *Hymn of the Scripture-Treasure* is chanted. The *Master-Treasure* is invited, and the *Hymn of the Master-Treasure* is chanted. The Dharma Master makes a formal announcement, inviting the *Heavenly Worthy of Great Unity*. The *Four Invocations of the Heavenly Worthy of Salvation through Suffering* are chanted, followed by the recitation of the *Scripture of Salvation through Suffering*. The Dharma Master formally invites the Thirty-Two Celestial Emperors. The *Hidden Words* are recited, followed by the *Mantra of Sweet Dew Penetrating the True*. The *hú* food is sprinkled. The *Mantra for Breaking Open Fengdu and Opening the Path of Karma* is recited. The *Heavenly Worthy of Salvation in the Ten Directions* is intoned. The Dharma Master takes his seat and presents the *hú* offering. The Dharma Master performs the ritual, and the assigned Daoist priests empower the *hú* food as prescribed. The *Heavenly Worthy of the Numinous Treasure in the Ten Directions* is intoned. The Dharma Master delivers the Dharma discourse. The rite concludes with the *Dedication of Merit*.

For the refinement and ascension of departed souls, the sequence is as follows: First, proceed to the *Refinement and Ascension* station. The Dharma Master offers incense and makes a formal announcement, invoking the descent of the *Spiritual Roots of Yin and Yang*, the *True Water*, and the *True Fire*. The *Hidden Words* are recited. The Dharma Master paces the *Dang* to the *Water and Fire Pool* and performs the ritual as prescribed. The remainder follows the standard *Ascension Protocol*.

Upon completion of the refinement, the *Precepts are Expounded*, the *Talismans are Conferred*, and the *Ascension Rites* are performed as prescribed.

For the refinement of the departed spirits, the sequence is as follows: First, the Daoist assembly stands in order at the *Refinement Station*. The *Hymn of Incense Offering* is chanted. The Dharma Master makes a formal announcement. The deities are invited. The *Three Offerings* and *Bowing to the Memorial* are performed as prescribed. The memorial is burned. The *Dedication of Merit and Recitation of Goodness* follows. The Dharma rites guide the Dharma Master to the *Fire Pool* to invoke the descent of the *True Fire* as prescribed. Next, proceed to the *Water Pool* to invoke the descent of the *True Water* as prescribed. The Dharma Master then proceeds to the *Refinement Station*. The Dharma Master approaches the dais, offers incense, and makes a formal announcement. The Dharma rites are chanted. The Dharma Master performs the ritual to summon the spirits. The *Heavenly Worthy of Universal Transformation across the Three Realms* is intoned. The Dharma Master proclaims the *Rite of Refining the Fire Pool to Deliver Lives*. The *Talisman of True Fire Unification* is issued, and the *Mantra for Invoking True Fire* is recited. The Dharma Master directs the officials of the *Fire Refinement*. The *Heavenly Worthy of the Cinnabar Realm Refined by Fire* is intoned. The *Hidden Text of the Fire Bureau* and the *Mantra of Fire Refinement* are recited. The *Talisman of Fire Refinement* is issued. The *Heavenly Worthy of Jade Eyes Refining the Substance* is intoned. The Dharma Master summons the spirits to transform the departed souls, generating the *Twelve Qi* as prescribed. The *Heavenly Worthy of Numinous Transformation of Great Clarity* is intoned. The Dharma Master summons the spirits and petitions the *Jade Bureau of the Five Emperors* to refine the substance of the departed souls and transform them into immortals. The *Heavenly Worthy of Deliverance from the Vermilion Mound* is intoned. The *Talisman of Fire Refinement into Immortality* is issued, and the *Mantra of Cinnabar Heaven’s Fire Refinement* is recited. The *Heavenly Worthy of Fire Refinement into Perfection* is intoned. The *Talisman of the Perfected Lady for Refining the Body* is issued, and the *Mantra of Returning to Life* is recited. The *Heavenly Worthy of Deliverance for the Innumerable* is intoned. The *Talisman of Merging Form and Transforming Shape* is issued, and the ritual is performed as prescribed. The *Great Brahma Hidden Words* from the *Precious Weft* are recited. The *Heavenly Worthy of Responding to Conditions and Attending to Karmic Affinities* is intoned. The Dharma Master proclaims the *Rite of Flying Refinement in the Water Pool for Ascension*. The *Talisman of True Water Unification* is issued, and the *Mantra for Invoking True Water* is recited. The Dharma Master directs the officials of the *Water Refinement*. The *Heavenly Worthy of Pure Salvation of Souls* is intoned. The *Talisman of Yellow Qi and Yang Essence Illuminating the Cavern* is issued, and the *Great Mantra of Cinnabar Yang Refinement and Ascension* is recited. The *Talisman of Water Refinement* is issued. The *Heavenly Worthy of the Yellow Flower Dispersing Form* is intoned. The Dharma Master summons the spirits to perform the *Nine Refinements* for the departed souls, releasing their transgressions as prescribed. The *Heavenly Worthy of Compassionate Deliverance of Lives* is intoned. The Dharma Master summons the spirits and petitions the *Nine Heavens’ Treasure Talisman of Life-Generating Spirits*, specially refining the spirit of the departed souls to return to life. The *Heavenly Worthy of Celebration in the Nine Heavens* is intoned. The *Talisman of the Jade Essence of the Stone Well’s Water Mother* is issued, and the *Great Mantra of the Eastern Well* is recited. The *Heavenly Worthy of the Lofty Perfected and Wondrous Fruit* is intoned. The *Talisman of the Spirit Bureau for Refining the Body* is issued, and the *Mantra of Gathering Form* is recited. The *Heavenly Worthy of the Golden Portal Transforming the Body* is intoned. The *Talisman of Golden Liquid Refining the Form* is issued, and the *Mantra of Refining the Form* is recited. The *Heavenly Worthy of the Wheel-Turning Holy King* is intoned. The *Talisman of Dividing, Refining, and Nurturing the Form* is issued, and the ritual is performed as prescribed. The *Heavenly Worthy of Following Wishes for Rebirth* is intoned. The *Talisman of the Numinous Treasure for Ascending to Perfection and Delivering Lives, Departing from Birth and Death* is issued. The *Heavenly Worthy of the Precious Flower’s Perfect Completion* is intoned. The Dharma Master burns the talismans, summoning the *Generals of the Six Ding and Six Jia*, the *Golden Lads and Jade Maidens*, to guide the departed souls.

For the transmission of precepts and deliverance of spirits, the sequence is as follows: The assigned Daoist priests guide the departed souls to the *Precepts Station*. The Dharma Master approaches the dais and offers incense. The *Three Hymns of Wisdom* are chanted. The Dharma Master takes his seat and expounds the Dharma. The *Three Refuges* are proclaimed. The *Nine Perfected Precepts* are proclaimed. The *Talisman of Longevity* is conferred. The *Precious Declarations of the Nine Heavens* are proclaimed. The *Yellow Register for Longevity and Deliverance of Lives* is proclaimed. The *Great Contract for Ascension to Heaven* is proclaimed. The *Flying Heavenly Divine Kings* are summoned. The *Universal Announcement to the Three Realms* is made. The departed souls pass through the barriers of the various heavens. The earth deities are commanded and restrained. The *Mandate of the Primordial Beginning* is issued. The memorial is burned. The *Heavenly Worthy of Deliverance for the Innumerable* is intoned. The *Merit Record* is proclaimed. The Dharma Master summons the spirits. The *Three Wretched Realms and Five Suffering Gates* are delivered. The *Divine Lads of the Five Directions* are invited to escort the spirits. The spirits are guided to express gratitude. The spirits are led to the *Ascension Station*. The *Eulogy Tablet* is burned, and the memorial is incinerated. The Dharma Master performs the *Rite of Supernatural Deliverance*. The rite concludes with the *Dedication of Merit and Hymn of Goodness*.

**Dismantling the Altar Rite**

First, the *Hall of Serene Silence* is arranged and established. The officiating officials ascend to offer incense and prostrate. The *Celestial Worthy of the Golden Portal’s Transformed Body* is intoned. The *Hua-Xia* acolytes lead the procession to the western triple curtain, where the *High Functionary* offers incense. They then proceed to the eastern double curtain, following the *Altar Establishment Rite*. They stand in order before the *Mystic Master’s* curtain. The *High Functionary* offers incense and silently presents the intent of the fast. The *Hymn to the Dao* is sung, followed by the *Hua-Xia Hymn*, which escorts the *High Functionary* to ascend the altar, enter the chamber, offer incense to the Ten Directions, and return to position. The officiating officials offer incense and return to their places. Each recites the *Guardian Spirit Mantra*. The *Dharma Drum* is sounded, the incense burner is kindled, and the ritual ranks are announced. The *Opening and Closing Rites of the Ten Directions* begin at dawn from the east and at dusk from the north. The *Repentance of the Three Karmas* and the *Veneration of the Scriptures* proceed in three invocations and three prostrations, following the sequence of the *Vigil Inauguration Rite*. The *High Functionary* circumambulates, gathers the *True Writs of the Five Directions*, and reads them aloud according to the *Spreading the Dew Rite*. Upon completion, the attendant scripture-holder fumigates the *True Writs* over the incense. The *High Functionary* recites the *Great Mantra of the True Writs*. The assembled officials echo the mantra, then place the writs upon the altar table and burn them along with the memorial. The *Chief Cantor* intones the ritual ranks once more. The *High Functionary* offers incense, and the officials kneel in unison. The memorial is proclaimed, and the officiating officials kneel before the incense burner as prescribed. The *High Functionary* bows to the memorial, which is then read aloud, displayed, dispatched, and sealed. The *Dignitaries* escort the memorial down from the altar, and the *Fast Supervisor* oversees its conveyance. The memorial, *Green Petition*, and *True Writs* are burned at the *Celestial Gate*. The *High Functionary* prostrates before the memorial, then chants its words for all to hear. The *Petition Eulogy* is burned. The officials are dismissed, and the *High Functionary* offers incense. The *Chief Cantor* intones the ranks, and the officials kneel to return the precepts as prescribed. The *High Functionary* returns the precepts, followed by the *Precept-Returning Hymn*. The *Mountain Petition* is announced, and the assembled officials bow twice. The disciples hold the petition horizontally over the incense while the *High Functionary*, facing east, recites the mantra. The officials join in unison. The *Water Petition* follows the *Mountain Petition* rite, and the *Earth Petition* follows the same. The *Dragon Petition Eulogy* is recited. The *High Functionary* kneels, and the *Chief Cantor* intones the ranks. The officials, kneeling before the *Three Treasures*, each bow once and receive their petitions. The *High Functionary* bows three times and retreats. After conferring the petitions, he bows twice and returns to his position. The *High Functionary* rekindles the incense burner, offers incense, and stands facing east to bid farewell to the *Three Treasures*. The *Hymn of the Three Wretched Realms and Five Suffering Gates* is sung as he circumambulates and descends the placards. The officiating officials are led to ascend the *Celestial Gate* and exit the *Earth Portal*, then circumambulate once with the assembly before returning to their positions. The *Hymn of the Three Powers and Myriad Beings* is sung as the eastern and southern placards are descended. The *Hymn of the Great Worthies’ Reverence for the Precepts* is sung as the western and northern placards are descended. The *Hymn of Sin and Fortune Not Attributed to Others* is sung as the southeastern and southwestern placards are descended. The *Hymn of Lust as the Foremost Calamity* is sung as the northwestern and northeastern placards are descended. The *Hymn of Past Lives’ Certainty* is sung as the upper and lower placards are descended. The *Hymn of Human Life’s Fleeting Dissolution* is sung as the *Celestial Gate* and *Earth Portal* placards are descended. The *Hymn of the Great Worthies’ Joy in the Scriptures and Precepts* is sung as the *Sun Gate* and *Moon Gate* placards are descended. The *Dismantling the Altar Hymn* is sung, followed by the *Hymn of the Aspiring Immortal* as the altar is exited. They proceed to the *Five Thearchs’ Curtain*, where the *High Functionary* offers incense to bid farewell. The officiating officials offer incense and prostrate. The *Hymn of Sending Off the Five Thearchs* is sung. They proceed to the *Three Masters’ Curtain*, where the *High Functionary* offers incense to bid farewell. The officiating officials offer incense and prostrate. The *Hymn of Sending Off the Three Masters* is sung. They proceed to the *Fast Supervisor’s Curtain*, where the *High Functionary* offers incense to bid farewell. The officiating officials offer incense and prostrate. The *Hymn of Sending Off the Fast Supervisor* is sung. They proceed to the *Three Officials’ Curtains*, offering incense and bidding farewell as before. The *Hymn of Sending Off the Three Officials* is sung. They proceed to the *Celestial Master’s Curtain*, bidding farewell as before. The *Hymn of Sending Off the Celestial Master* is sung. They proceed to the *Mystic Master’s Curtain*, where the *High Functionary* and officiating officials offer incense. The *Merit Dedication Hymn* is sung. The *High Functionary* expresses gratitude to the *Mystic Master*. The *Mystic Master* is sent off, followed by the *Hymn of Sending Off the Mystic Master*. The *Hymn of Escorting the High Functionary* leads him back to the hall. The assembled officials bow three times and kneel to express gratitude, while the *High Functionary* bows three times in return. The officiating officials perform nine prostrations and three kneelings to express gratitude, while the *High Functionary* exchanges congratulations on the rite’s completion. They bow to the host and return to their positions.

---

**Setting Up the Offering Rite**

First, the *Offering Banquet* is arranged as prescribed. The Daoist assembly gathers in the *Chamber of Serenity*. A *Dharma Master* is dispatched to perform the *Altar-Prohibiting Rite*. The *Hua-Xia Hymn* escorts the *Dharma Master* into the chamber. He circumambulates the *Offering Altar*, offering incense once, then stands in order with the assembly. The officiating officials offer incense and prostrate. The *Hymn to the Dao* is sung. The *Dharma Master* opens the rite, followed by the *Opening the Hall Hymn*. The *Hymn of Venerating the Masters* is sung as each recollects the precepts as prescribed. The *Dharma Master* recites the *Guardian Spirit Mantra*. The *Dharma Drum* is sounded twenty-four times. The *Dharma Master* kindles the incense burner. The *Hymn of Kneeling to Assume Office* is sung as prescribed. The *Dharma Master* assumes office. The *Hymn of Announcing the Ritual Ranks* is sung. The *Dharma Master* makes the initial invocation. The *Descending Saints* are summoned, and the officiating officials offer incense and prostrate.

The *Dharma Master* bows and intones:
*"The Three Clarities’ Sagely Worthies descend to the Dao场,
The assembled offering spirits array themselves in ranks to pay homage."*

The *Dharma Master* intones again:
*"The Ten Directions’ True Saints and the Three Realms’ Mighty Spirits,
Having completed their homage, ascend to their offering seats."*

Tea and wine are presented. The *Dharma Master* circumambulates the *Offering Altar* with incense, then stands before the altar table. The *Long Chant* is performed. The *Hymn of Announcing the Ritual Ranks* is sung. The *Dharma Master* enters the rite. The proclamation is read aloud. The officiating officials kneel before the incense burner as prescribed. The *Dharma Master* enters the rite. The *Dharma Master* and officiating officials offer incense and present the *First Libation of Wine*. The *Dharma Master* circumambulates with incense, following the *First Libation Rite*. He makes the invocation. The *Dharma Master* and officiating officials offer incense and present the *Third Libation of Wine*. The *Dharma Master* circumambulates with incense, following the *First Libation Rite*. The *Chariots, Palanquins, Paper Money, and Horses* are presented. The *General Merit Memorial* is proclaimed. The *Dharma Master* makes a second invocation. The *Hymn of Sending Off the Spirits* is sung. The officials kneel to resign their offices. The incense burner is rekindled. The *Dharma Master* proceeds to the *Burning Site*. The *Petition Eulogy* is burned. The *Merit Dedication and Goodness Invocation* are recited. The *Hymn of Completing the Offering Rite* is sung, and the officials return to their positions.

The *Supreme Yellow Register Grand Fast: Ready-Made Rites* concludes Chapter Thirty-Seven. #1 Originally marked "一" (One), an error; now corrected to "二" (Two).

**The Supreme Yellow Register Grand Fast: Ready-Made Rites, Scroll Thirty-Eight**
Revised by Jiang Shuyu, *Celestial Enforcer of the Supreme Dao* and *Perfected Transmitter of the Three Caverns*, as transmitted by Master Liu Yongguang, *Master of the Three Caverns* and *Master Chongjing*

To the right of the *Three Treasures’ Position*, arranged at the center of the altar, place the *Divine Scriptures* at the front, adorn with a *Precious Canopy* above, set up a *Canopied Seat*, and make offerings according to the rites.

These refer to the originally invited overseers of the fast. During the main fast, whenever offerings are presented to the Fast-Overseeing Great Dharma Master, offerings of fast food are also made to them.

Thirty-six sacred positions in all, which may be separated or combined as appropriate. Where the altar space is narrow, during the night of refinement and liberation, offerings may also be arranged for the ritual. All sacred positions pertain to the refinement and liberation liturgy and must not be altered; they are grouped by category and combined accordingly.

**Diagrammatic Section: The Petition Banner of the Sacred Alliance**

A banner of yellow silk is to be made, forty-nine feet in length. At its top, in black ink, inscribe: *"Your servant humbly presents this petition,"* five characters. Upon its body, write: *"The Supreme Boundless Dao of the Utmost Real, the Thirty-Six Divisions of the Most Revered Scriptures, the Sacred Writs and Treasured Talismans, the Three Supreme Honored Ones, the Saints of the Ten Directions, the Great Dharma Masters of the Mystic Realm, the Officials of the Three Realms, and all mighty spirits—may your radiant grace deign to witness this rite of purification,"* forty-nine characters.

On the two side panels, inscribe: *"The disciple of the Three Caverns of Highest Clarity, [Rank] Minister [Surname], of [Native Place], now enters this retreat with reverent intent. For the blessings and protection of the living, this servant, unable to suppress his devotion, has assembled a ritual altar of ordained Daoist priests. Following the divine standards of the Lower Prime Yellow Register’s Immortal Ranks, a sacred altar is established. A propitious day is chosen to conduct the Supreme Yellow Register Grand Retreat, observing three days and three nights of ritual, with nine periods of circumambulation. In due order, the true precepts are proclaimed, petitions and memorials are presented, and talismanic decrees are issued. The sinful and wayward are delivered, the imprisoned and forsaken are released. Lamps are kindled to perpetuate light, and their radiance shatters the prisons of the damned. Universal alms of unstinting sustenance are bestowed, and the summoned souls of the departed are offered salvation. They are bathed and robed anew, to attend the Perfected and hear the Dharma. Talismans are transmitted, precepts conferred, and through refinement and deliverance, transcendence is achieved. Upon completion, the merits are declared in memorials, and dragon tablets are cast into the waters. A pure offering is solemnly prepared, with three hundred and sixty divine stations. In profound gratitude for boundless grace, all accumulated virtues are dedicated to ascension and deliverance. Humbly beseeching your merciful favor, may all—living and dead—be universally saved. With utmost sincerity, this petition is respectfully submitted."*

**Diagram of the Banner for the Transference of Spirits** follows.

A banner of great yellow silk is to be made, forty-nine feet in length. At its top, in black ink, inscribe the four characters: *Banner for the Transference of Spirits*. Upon the body of the banner, write: *In the Eastern Ultimate Palace, the Greatly Compassionate and Benevolent One, who vows to universally save all beings, responds to cries and attends to prayers, bestowing mercy—His Eminence the Most High Savior from Suffering, the Heavenly Worthy of the Limitless Numerals, descends this sacred text. By the precious banner’s transference of spirits, the departed receive deliverance and ascend as perfected beings.*

On its two hands and feet, inscribe separately:
- *Heavenly Worthy of the Jade Treasure, Supreme Lord of the East*
- *Heavenly Worthy of the Mysterious Truth, Lord of Myriad Blessings of the South*
- *Heavenly Worthy of the Great Mystery, Lord of Ultimate Perfection of the West*
- *Heavenly Worthy of the Mysterious Supreme, Jade Dawn Lord of the North*
- *Heavenly Worthy of the Ascended Immortals, Supreme Sage of the Northeast*
- *Heavenly Worthy of the Life-Nurturing Deliverance, Lord of the Southeast*
- *Heavenly Worthy of the Great Numinous Void, Sovereign of the Southwest*
- *Heavenly Worthy of the Boundless Great Splendor, Lord of the Northwest*
- *Heavenly Worthy of the Jade Void, Radiant Sovereign of the Above*
- *Heavenly Worthy of the True Sovereign, Cavern Spirit Lord of the Below*
- *Greatly Compassionate Savior from Suffering, Perfected One*
- *Greatly Compassionate Remover of Sins, Perfected One*
- *Greatly Compassionate Deliverer, Perfected One*

On the left foot, inscribe the *Dhāraṇī for Shattering Fengdu*. On the right foot, inscribe the *Divine Dhāraṇī of Sweet Dew*.

**Taiyi Precious Banner**
A long banner of yellow silk is to be made, forty-nine feet in length. Upon its body, inscribe the *Nine Dragons Talisman*. On its two hands and feet, separately inscribe the *Taiyi Precious Incantation*. The talismans are found in the *Gate of Talismanic Commands*. If the great *Nine Dragons Talisman* cannot be inscribed, a smaller version may suffice.

**Banner for the Summoning of Spirits**
A banner of yellow silk is to be made, twelve feet or twenty-four feet in length. Upon its body, in black ink, inscribe the two characters *Zhuling* and *Duming*, along with *Taiwei’s Yellow Banner of Return* and *Wu Ying’s Banner for the Summoning of Spirits*. It reads: *Summoning the long-night abode, opening deliverance for the souls to receive rebirth.* On its two feet, separately inscribe: *Delivering the departed so-and-so, may their spirit ascend to the celestial realms.*

**Precious Banner of Deliverance**
A banner of yellow silk is to be made, twelve feet or twenty-four feet in length. Upon its body, inscribe the three characters *Deliverance, Transformation, Ascension* and *Heavenly Worthy of Transcendent Mercy*, with the words: *Auspicious light descends in shelter. The Nine Dark Prisons suspend their punishments; all souls are delivered.* On its two feet, separately inscribe: *Offering deliverance for the departed so-and-so, may their spirit ascend to the celestial realms.*

**Luminous Return Banner**
A banner of crimson silk is to be made, nine feet in length. At its top, apply gold paste to inscribe the form of the *Central Dipper*. Upon its body, in black ink and great seal script, inscribe the four characters *Luminous Return Banner*, leaving space for three characters, followed by *Heavenly Worthy of the Wheel-Turning Sage King*. On its left hand, paint the form of the sun and inscribe the six characters *Imperial Lord of the Sun’s Resplendent Radiance*. On its right hand, paint the form of the moon and inscribe the six characters *August Sovereign of the Moon’s Coagulated Brilliance*. On its two feet, separately inscribe the *Hymn of Luminous Return*:
*Luminous return to the Purple Tenuity Palace,*
*Its light bending to illumine the Nine Dark Doors.*
*Towering mounds and frigid pools,*
*Its radiance pervades the frozen shores.*
*The scorching flames of hell,*
*Bathed in the cascading Dharma rain.*
*Delivering the long-night souls,*
*They ascend to the Vermilion Numinous Abode.*

If a poor scholar uses a single shaft, paper may be used instead.

**Nine Prisons Lamp Banners**
Nine banners of blue paper are to be made, each nine feet and nine inches in length. At their tops, inscribe the *True Talisman for Shattering Prisons and Saving from Suffering* (see *Gate of Talismanic Commands*). Upon their bodies, inscribe the title of the *Heavenly Worthy Savior from Suffering* of the respective direction. On their two hands, separately inscribe talismanic incantations and incantatory texts. On their two feet, separately inscribe the *True Talisman of the Upper Clarity Precious Register*, with the proclamation: *Announcing to the prison of such-and-such direction.* For each prison, use a mound of yellow clay and plant one banner of blue bamboo. Additionally, make nine banners of yellow paper, inscribing the *Nine Heavens’ Talisman of Life-Generating Spirits* (see *Gate of Talismanic Commands*). When shattering the prisons, burn the blue banners first, then replace them with the yellow banners.

**Thirty-Two Heavens Banners**
- **East**: eight azure banners.
- **South**: eight crimson banners.
- **West**: eight white banners.
- **North**: eight black banners.

Each three feet two inches in length, or two feet four inches. Alternatively, following the *Durenjing* method, they may be made in nine alternating colors: yellow, green, azure, red, dark green, black, jade-green, purple, and white. Another method arranges them by heaven: Grand Yellow for *Huangceng Tian*, Grand Brightness for *Yuwantian*, and so on in sequence, concluding with dark green for *Jiayi Tian*.
**Obverse side** inscribed with the name of the heaven; **reverse side** inscribed with the *Thirty-Two Heavens Talismans*. These talismans derive from the *Lingbao Da Jie Jing*. In all Lingbao fast altars, they are used to bind the four directions and establish the ritual space—indispensable for proper observance.

The *Thirty-Two Heavens Talismans* also appear in the *Dongzhen Shanggong Taizhen Keyuan Dong Jiu Tian Shengshen Baoming Zhai Yi*, each differing in form.

**Nine Hells Lamp Diagram**
The Dark Master states: *"Model heaven, emulate earth—square and round form the pattern. The Nine Nether Yins’ Courts, where sin is judged and punishment meted out, lie in Fengdu of the southeast."* According to the *Taiyi Shengzhen Ke*, nine altars of earth or stone are constructed, each two feet square. The nine altars together span six feet, symbolizing earth’s yin extremity and the image of two sixes. Each altar is surrounded by three curved walls, shaped like a prison. One lamp is lit per altar, three torches per altar—nine altars in all, totaling twenty-seven lamps. At the center of the nine altars, a placard is erected, its **obverse side** inscribed with the *Jade Clarity Earth-Prison-Breaking True Talisman*, its **reverse side** with the name of the hell. Beside it stand nine green bamboo poles, each nine feet tall, each bearing a small banner inscribed with the sacred titles of the *Ten Directions Lingbao Heavenly Worthies*. At the top of each banner is written the *Fengdu Talisman*. When the time comes to break open the hells, the lamp-attending Dharma Master recites the *Earth-Prison-Breaking Rite*, proceeding direction by direction. The Dharma Master, holding the *Lingbao Staff*, chants the *Earth-Prison-Breaking Incantation*. The assembly responds with *"Ten Directions Savior-from-Suffering Heavenly Worthy!"*, then burns the talisman over the hell-lamp. The Dharma Master strikes the prison with the staff, burns the green banners, and replaces them with yellow ones. Thus the earth-prisons open in radiance, and the deceased souls ascend to truth.

**Nine Nether Lamps Diagram**
The *Dongxuan Lingbao Yuanshi Tianzun Shuo San Tu Wu Ku Ba Du Miao Jing* states: *"To deliver and rescue the dead, lighting lamps is supreme. The Five Directions and Eight Extremities, the earth-prisons and dark dungeons, lie in the land of utmost yin, the realm of eternal night. The souls of the dead are imprisoned, cut off from the Lord’s light. In the gloom, they endure every torment and torture. Therefore, erect a lamp-tree and light nine lamps, from the day of death through the seven sevens. Let the lamp-light continue unbroken, illuminating the Nine Nether. Upon seeing this radiance, they shall be liberated."* Now, plant a pole at the center and light nine lamps in sequence, totaling eighty-one lamps, to universally illuminate the profound darkness and deliver the suffering souls.

**Revolving Radiance Wheel Lamp Diagram**
The Dark Master states: *"The covenant of alliance with the true has the pattern of revolving radiance and descending light, repenting the Five Accumulations and opening the karmic gates of life and death, shattering the sin-courts of black darkness."* The method employs catalpa wood to fashion a wheel in the likeness of a chariot axle. The **upper tier** holds twelve lamps; the **middle tier**, sixteen lamps.

The **lower tier** holds twenty-one lamps, totaling forty-nine lamps. At the center, inscribe the names of the Five Accumulations’ suffering gates and the various hells upon plaques, following the *Revolving Radiance Lamp Rite*. Further, craft forty-nine small banners, alternating in yellow and white, upon which are written the sacred titles of the Heavenly Worthies from the *Luminous Canons*. At the top of each banner, inscribe in vermilion the talisman to shatter Fengdu. The attendant lamp-master recites the repentance lamp liturgy, while the grand master, holding a ritual staff, follows the repentance rite to each hell, planting the staff and intoning the great Brahmanic incantations. Sprinkling water with a willow branch, they burn the small silk banners upon the lamps. Thus, all sinful souls in the hells, riding the yang radiance, shall be liberated from their sufferings in that very moment, severing the roots of the Five Accumulations’ afflictions and directly departing from the karmic bonds of worldly toil.

As per the original liturgical manual, this method has long fallen into disuse. It is fitting to follow the rites of Cai Zhixu and Lu Shizhong, constructing the wheel from sand: square without, round within, nine feet in diameter, arranged in three tiers resembling a chariot wheel. The **first, outer ring** has twenty-four spokes; the **second, middle ring**, fifteen spokes; the **third, inner ring**, nine spokes. At the center, erect one *Revolving Radiance Spirit Banner* and light ten lamps. On the nine spokes of the inner ring, place nine lamps, and behind each lamp, set plaques marking the Three Evil Gates, the Three Corpse Paths, and the Three Wretched Realms. On the fifteen spokes of the middle ring, light fifteen lamps, and behind each, set plaques marking the Five Accumulations, the Five Paths, and the Five Suffering Gates. On the twenty-four spokes of the outer ring, light twenty-four lamps, and behind each, set plaques marking the Twenty-Four Hells. Again, craft forty-nine small banners in alternating yellow and white, arranging them beside the lamps. Upon completing the repentance lamp rite, burn all banners and plaques upon the lamps. The inner ring’s nine banners and plaques...

In the *Great Rites of the Numinous Treasure*, the Edict of Longevity is addressed to the couriers of the Golden Dragon Post, while the Edict for Salvation from Suffering is directed to the riders of the Jiaolong Cavalry. Thus, though I have corrected their graphic forms in this manuscript, I have not had time to incorporate them fully. Nevertheless, as these talismans have been employed by successive generations of masters, they cannot be abandoned. Here, I append the versions revised by Lin Huiling.

*Life-Prolonging Destiny-Delivering Supreme August Yellow Register*

On the [day] of [month], in the year of [cyclical year] under the reign of [Tai Sui], [name], of [native place], humbly petitions on behalf of deceased kin [name], offering a Green Petition to express utmost gratitude to Heaven’s grace. At the Yellow Register Retreat altar, [name] beseeches the transmission of the *Most High Cavernous Mystery Numinous Treasure Life-Prolonging Destiny-Delivering Supreme August Yellow Register* of the first rank, to be conferred upon the soul of [name], that it may traverse the Three Realms and ascend to the Nine Heavens.

As the scriptures state: Of old, the Primordial Heavenly Worthy, abiding in the Wondrous Realm of the Nine Purities and the Palace of the Three Primes, expounded the most profound teachings amidst the sacred assemblies of the heavens, enlightening humans and devas, marking meritorious deeds, and inscribing names upon the Yellow Register—golden tablets and jade slips arrayed within the Three Clarities. In every hell, the Ten Directions’ Savior-from-Suffering Heavenly Worthy was beheld, descending into the Nine Glooms to deliver all from torment.

The Heavenly Worthy universally proclaimed to the four assemblies: "If you can receive and uphold the Golden Register and White Slips, the Nine Perfected Wondrous Precepts, the Life-Prolonging Numinous Talismans, and the Savior-from-Suffering True Talismans, you shall dissolve the great sins of the Nine Glooms and have your names inscribed in the Nine Palaces. The Youths Who Examine Destiny, the Mighty Spirits Who Guard the Precepts, the Direct Talismans of the Five Thearchs, and the Clerks of the Six Palaces shall naturally follow the talismanic writ to shelter and protect those who receive the precepts."

"Now, disciples, I shall clearly expound for you the Nine Perfected Wondrous Precepts and the Golden Register White Slips. The merit of their reception and upholding, the deliverance from calamity and salvation from suffering, are of unfathomable spiritual power."

The assembled spirits bowed their heads, prostrating to receive the teachings.

The Heavenly Worthy declared:

First, uphold reverence and deference, honoring and nurturing father and mother.
Second, be diligent and steadfast, loyal to your lord and sovereign.
Third, do not kill, but with compassion deliver all beings.
Fourth, do not commit adultery, but rectify the body and dwell rightly among things.
Fifth, do not steal, but extend righteousness and diminish the self.
Sixth, do not harbor wrath, lest fierce anger drown others.
Seventh, do not deceive, lest flattery and treachery harm the good.
Eighth, do not be arrogant, lest pride and contempt slight the Perfected.
Ninth, do not waver, but uphold the precepts with single-minded devotion.

The Mighty Spirits Who Guard the Precepts,
the Youths Who Examine Destiny,
and the Savior-from-Suffering True Talismans proclaim this writ:

By the Primordial Talismanic Mandate, the Golden Register White Slips, and the Savior-from-Suffering True Talismans, let it be decreed to the boundless worlds of the ten directions, the Three Bureaus and Nine Offices, the One Hundred Twenty Courts, the Examiners of the Five Thearchs, the Nine Glooms of Hell, the Mighty Heavenly Enforcers, the Punitive Divine Soldiers, the Lords of Destiny and Record-Keepers, the Ministers of Merit and Execution, the Ox-Headed Jailers, and the Great Demons of the Three Realms:

Deliver the soul of so-and-so, extricating it from hell, forever parting from the eternal night, to behold the light. May all sins be swept away, all enmities dissolved. By the merit of upholding these Nine Perfected Wondrous Precepts, ascend to the heavens above, all in accordance with this decree.

Proclaimed on the [day] of the [month] in the [year] at the Yellow Register Retreat Altar.

The One Hundred Twenty Court Officials,
the Talismans of Longevity,
proclaim this writ.

By the Primordial Mandate of the Origin, the Golden Register and White Tablet, the Talismans of Longevity proclaim this writ to the Cinnabar Heavenly Realm of the South, the Vermilion Tomb of Fire, the Southern Prosperity Upper Offices, the Great Lord of Longevity, the Venerable Han and Sima, the Lords of Destiny and Record-Keepers, the Divine Extenders of Lifespan and Augmenters of Years, the Exalted Spirits of Deliverance from Calamity, the Restorers of Bones and Raisers of the Dead, and the Great Divine Overseers of Life:

Deliver the soul of so-and-so, ascending to the Vermilion Palace and the Flowing Fire Courtyard. May the jade eyes refine the essence, the yellow blossoms purify the form. Inscribe the name upon the purple tablets, receive transformation and rebirth. By the merit of this Golden Register’s deliverance of life, ascend to the heavens above, all in accordance with this decree.

Proclaimed on the [day] of the [month] in the [year] at the Yellow Register Retreat Altar.

The Exalted Spirits of Restoring Bones and Raising the Dead,
The Great Divine Overseers of Life,
The Mandates of the Thearchs,

Receive the delivered and transgressed soul of so-and-so, who this day reverently approaches the Yellow Register Retreat Altar to receive the Supreme *Tai Shang Dong Xuan Ling Bao* Unsurpassed Yellow Register of Longevity and Deliverance of Life, First Rank.

As the ritual prescribes, uphold and maintain it, that the waters may fully aid in deliverance. Between heaven and earth, let all honor and faithfully practice it, in accordance with the Mysterious Statutes and Ordinances.

Given on the [day] of the [month] in the [year] at the Yellow Register Retreat Altar of the [prefecture], [county], [abbey/temple].

[Seal of the] Sponsoring Master, [Dharma rank and name]
[Seal of the] Supervising Master, [Dharma rank and name]
[Seal of the] Delivering Master, [Dharma rank and name]

The *Tai Shang Dong Xuan Ling Bao* Unsurpassed Yellow Register of Longevity and Deliverance of Life:

This Yellow Register of Longevity and Deliverance is solely for the deliverance of the deceased; no other registers shall be issued. Write upon yellow paper in vermilion ink, or upon jade hall paper in gold ink. Once the figures are fully painted in colors, inscribe the name of the delivered soul as "Delivered Soul of So-and-So" in six characters. Only after completion shall the Flowing Fire Pavilion and Fire-Refining Talisman be made. After the seals and signatures are affixed, mark the reverse with blue, purple, yellow, or red. Use a scripture ribbon and scroll ends.

Nowadays, in the registers and proclamations of ancestral altars, the figures within the pavilion are the Fire-Refining Talismans. All shall be written in dispersed form.

The above follows the *Yellow Register Rites* of Cai Zhixu. The Jade Hall calls it the Golden Register, though not as fully detailed. The *Purple Radiance Numinous Writ* contains the *Unsurpassed Alliance of the True Jade Casket of the Southern Prosperity Upper Offices Yellow Register*, but only includes the register text and the officials of the Southern Prosperity Offices. Suspected omissions and errors therein are not corrected here.

The talismans and registers of the Numinous Treasure tradition have long suffered from widespread errors in transmission. Here, the transmitted secret texts are collated with the *Supreme Lord’s Jade Chapters* and the *Three Caverns Talisman Formulae*, verified through careful examination to approximate the highest principles. Those who cultivate the Dao must first master the incantations and study the forms of the talismans in detail. Only then may the written talismans be correctly executed, their application evoking resonance and response.

**Talisman Petitions**
**Petition of the Salvation-from-Suffering Talisman**

Handle of the tablet: two *cun* and four *fen* in width, nine *cun* in length. The petition text occupies four lines, with the date on a separate line.

By the *Primal Beginning Talismanic Mandate*, the *Golden Register White Tablet*, and the *True Talisman of Salvation-from-Suffering*, this petition is issued to the Three Officials and Nine Bureaus of the Hundred Twenty Offices across the Ten Directions’ Boundless Worlds; to the Five Thearchs’ Examiners, the Nine Dark Hells’ Mighty Heavenly Enforcers, the Punitive Divine Soldiers, the Register-Keepers of Destiny, the Officers of Merit and Execution, the Ox-Headed Wardens, and the Great Demons of the Three Realms: may you deliver the departed souls of so-and-so (某乙) and all others as if by universal salvation—thus liberating the six paths and four births, the orphaned souls and stagnant spirits, from the Hells of the Nine Dark Realms. May they forever depart the eternal night, behold the light, have their myriad sins dissolved, and their grievances resolved. By the merit of this deliverance through the Nine Perfected Wondrous Precepts, may they ascend to the Heavenly Halls. Let it be as commanded.

Issued on the [day] of the [month] of the [year], by the [named] tablet at the Yellow Register Fast Altar.
