**Petition of the Longevity Talisman**

By the *Primal Beginning Talismanic Mandate*, the *Golden Register White Tablet*, and the *Longevity Numinous Talisman*, this petition is issued to the Cinnabar Heaven World of the Southern Quadrant, the Vermilion Mound Fire Bureau, the Southern Palace, the Great Lord of Longevity Han, the Officers of Destiny and Records, the Venerable Deities of Life Extension and Calamity Aversion, and the Great Divinities of Resurrection and Life-Monitoring: may you deliver the departed souls of so-and-so (某乙) and all others as if by universal salvation—thus universally delivering the six paths and four births, the orphaned souls and stagnant spirits, and all beings of the Ten Directions and Nine Dark Realms. May they ascend to the Vermilion Palace’s Flowing Fire Court, where their jade pupils refine their forms and yellow blossoms purify their bodies. May their names be inscribed on the purple tablets, and may they receive transformation and rebirth. By the merit of this Golden Register life-deliverance, may they ascend to the Heavenly Halls. Let it be as commanded.

Issued on the [day] of the [month] of the [year], by the [named] tablet at the Yellow Register Fast Altar.

**Text of the Jade Clarity Talisman for Delivering Stagnant Souls**
Tablet dimensions: 3.6 *cun* in width, 0.3 *cun* in thickness. Four lines of talismanic text, with two additional lines for date and ritual rank.

By the authority of the *Jade Clarity Treasure Register*, this true talisman for delivering stagnant souls is issued to the Ten Directions and Three Realms, the Boundless Divine Realm, the Yellow Springs’ Courts, the Northern Capital’s Fengdu Bureaus, the Nine Offices, and the Twelve River Sources. May it absolve the transgressions of the deceased [Named] and their ancestral kin across kalpas, universally extending to the six paths and four births, the orphaned souls and stagnant spirits, the Ten Directions and Nine Dark Realms, and all sin-laden souls.

Swiftly erase their sin-registers, sever their evil roots, and forbid their detention. May they ascend without delay, escorted by the myriad spirits, and proceed directly to the realms of humans and heavens. According to their karmic station, may they receive transformation and rebirth in the blessed lands.

As the decree commands, transmitted by wind and fire couriers.
In the year of the Great Year [X], the month [X], the first day [X], the hour [X], the decree is issued.
The officiant of dharma rank, [Named], respectfully receives and executes the command.
Outer envelope: blue paper with vermilion script.

**Vermilion Decree of the Jade Clarity Talisman for Shattering Hell**

The format for issuing this decree follows that of the Talisman for Delivering Stagnant Souls.
The Jade Clarity Precious Register illuminates the Nine Springs.
Hell is shattered, the Iron City opened.
By the primordial talismanic decree, ascend without delay.
In the Cold Pool of the Northern Capital, the guardian spirits of the deceased [Named]’s form-soul are commanded to suppress demons and sponsor their promotion, delivering them to the Southern Palace by rank.
The dead souls undergo refinement, transformed into immortals.
Those reborn in the living realm endure across kalpas.
Revolving through kalpas, they merge with the Dao.
Forever delivered from the Three Wretched Paths, the Five Sufferings, and the Eight Difficulties, they transcend the Three Realms and roam freely in the Upper Clarity.

As the decree commands, transmitted by wind and fire couriers.
In the year [X], the month [X], the first day [X], the hour [X] of the [X] day in the sexagenary cycle, the decree is issued.

**Precious Register for Ascending to Heaven**

The Precious Register for the Most High’s Salvation and Pardon for Ascending to Heaven is issued to the masters of the Ten Directions, Three Realms, and Nine Dark Realms.
The dharma master of rank [X], [Named], now, on behalf of the [X] village and district’s supplicant seeking blessings for the living, petitions this bureau. As the plea cannot be denied, beginning on the [X] day of the [X] month, a sacred altar shall be established at [X] location to conduct the retreat rites, promulgate talismanic decrees, open pardons for the Nine Dark Realms, and amass vast merit for universal deliverance.
Having already memorialized the Celestial Emperor to request an imperial mandate for implementation, and having petitioned the Heavenly Thearchs for their sagacious decrees, we now notify the true bureaus of the Three Realms and their subordinate offices to trace the souls of the deceased [Named] and others. At the appointed time, they shall personally attend the altar steps, repent their sins, and reverently receive the merit of the retreat. Yet we fear the multitude of recommended souls, bound by karmic retribution, may be detained in hell courts and unable to approach the retreat altar, attend the true rites, or hear the Dharma.
We beseech the promulgation of the Most High’s Imperial Pardon Precious Register for Ascending to Heaven to absolve their transgressions and deliver them from suffering.

Now, in accordance with the imperial mandate, the decree is issued.

All above written in vermilion on yellow paper.
This space reserved for talismanic registers.

**Right Side: The Most High’s Precious Register for Ascending to Heaven is issued to pardon the deceased [Named] and others, as well as the six paths, four births, orphaned souls, stagnant spirits, the underworld’s hell courts, dark prisons, and all imprisoned, suffering sin-laden souls.**
From past kalpas to this day, due to the three karmic actions and six senses, they have committed myriad sins:
- Murdering rulers or fathers, being unfilial to parents.
- Slandering the Great Dao, forsaking truth for falsehood.
- Harming siblings, plotting against masters.
- Conspiring with relatives to commit incest.
- Being bandits, taking lives.
- Slaughtering beings for personal gain.
- Oppressing the weak with strength, abusing the lowly with power.
- Feigning devotion to the Three Treasures while harboring insincerity.
- Disrespecting Dharma masters, defiling sacred texts.
- Harboring malice, cruelty, and jealousy.
- Engaging in slander and gossip to disrupt the virtuous.
- Killing beings for sacrifices, exposing the Three Luminaries.
- Sins of the mind, speech, or self-commissioned, or taught to others—all sins accumulated across kalpas—are hereby swiftly erased from their sin-registers, their evil roots severed.
They shall not be detained; they shall ascend without delay.
Thus, the deceased [Named] and all sin-laden souls: their seven *qi* shall become true, their six rites shall move through emptiness, their five spirits shall reconnect the severed, the two luminaries shall support the weak, they shall turn the Big Dipper and leap through the void, striding upon cloud palaces.
From the beginning of gestation to the endless kalpas, their golden city nurtures their essence, their jade cavern congeals their spirit.
The true *qi* nurtures within, forming the true person.
Above, they enter the Great Void; below, they penetrate the dark springs.
Within the cloud palaces’ jeweled towers, their true souls reside.
They come and go in blessed lands, revolving through the gates of life.
Chewing divine mushrooms, rinsing with golden springs.
Sweet dew flows like rivers, showering their cinnabar fields.
Purple auroras dawn, the three *qi* condense into mist.
Jade chambers transform into immortals, seated upon golden lotuses.
Their true forms eclipse the sun, kalpas become years.
As the decree commands, transmitted by wind and fire couriers.

**The Yellow Register of the Numinous Treasure for Long Life and Deliverance of Destiny**

**The Supreme Numinous Treasure Yellow Register for Long Life and Deliverance of Destiny**

On this [day] of the [month] in the year of the [Celestial Stem-Branch] [Year], in the district of [Place], [Name], humbly petitions on behalf of their deceased kin [Name], offering the Green Petition’s words to express gratitude for Heaven’s grace. At the Yellow Register Fast Altar, they beseech the transmission of the *Supreme Numinous Treasure Yellow Register for Long Life and Deliverance of Destiny*, to be bestowed upon the soul of [Name], that they may traverse the Three Realms and ascend to the Nine Heavens.

As the scriptures state: Once, the Celestial Worthy of Primordial Beginning, dwelling in the Wondrous Realm of the Nine Purities within the Three Primordial Palaces, expounded the most subtle and profound teachings among the assembly of great sages, enlightening humans and gods. He marked meritorious deeds and inscribed names upon the Yellow Register, recording them upon golden tablets and jade slips, arrayed before the Three Clarities. In every hell, the Celestial Worthies of Salvation from Suffering of the Ten Directions were revealed, entering the Nine Dark Realms to deliver all from torment.

The Celestial Worthy universally addressed the four assemblies: “If you can receive and uphold the Golden Register and White Slips, the Nine Perfected Wondrous Precepts, the Talismans of Long Life, and the True Talismans of Salvation, you shall eradicate the great sins of the Nine Dark Realms and inscribe your names in the Nine Palaces. The Youths Who Examine Destiny and the Guardian Spirits of the Precepts will protect you. The Direct Talismans of the Five Thearchs and the clerks of the Six Palaces shall follow and attend you. The scriptural texts shall shield and guard you, the precept-receiving disciples.”

Now, on your behalf, I shall clearly expound the Nine Perfected Wondrous Precepts and the Golden Register with White Slips, along with the merits of their reception. Their divine power is beyond thought, delivering from suffering and aiding in distress.

The assembled spirits bow their heads and reverently heed the teachings.

The Celestial Worthy proclaimed:
1. Be respectful and yielding, and honorably serve your parents.
2. Be diligent and loyal to your sovereign.
3. Do not kill; compassionately save all beings.
4. Do not commit adultery; rectify your body and conduct.
5. Do not steal; promote righteousness and diminish the self.
6. Do not harbor anger; do not vent fury upon others.
7. Do not deceive; do not slander or harm the virtuous.
8. Do not be arrogant; do not disdain the Perfected.
9. Do not be duplicitous; uphold the precepts with singular devotion.

**True Talisman of Salvation**
By the Talismanic Command of Primordial Beginning, the Golden Register and White Slips, and the True Talisman of Salvation, proclaim to the boundless worlds of the Ten Directions, the Three Palaces and Nine Bureaus, the One Hundred Twenty Offices, the Examiners of the Five Thearchs, the Nine Dark Hells, the Mighty Heavenly Warriors, the Divine Soldiers Who Execute Punishment, the Directors of Destiny, Records, Merit, and Execution, the Ox-Headed Wardens, and the Great Demons of the Three Realms: deliver the soul of [Name], liberate them from hell, forever parting from eternal night to behold the light. Let all sins be eradicated and enmities resolved. By the merit of upholding these Nine Perfected Wondrous Precepts, ascend to rebirth in Heaven. As this edict commands.

**Section on the Sequence of White Declarations**
**Initial Petition Prayer upon Submission of the Document**
The fast’s sponsor presents the written petition along with ritual offerings and submits them at the altar, bowing to request the preceptor’s acceptance.
The preceptor, having received the petition, then leads the sponsor to stand before the Great Dao, where they bow twice, offer incense, and present the document while stating their intent in undertaking the fast.
Next, they bow twice more, stand to the side, and hand the petition to the preceptor.
The preceptor receives the document, places it upon the memorial tablet, takes the incense of sincerity, and burns it while making the following declaration:

By the duly ordained ritual officer [Name], I reverently burn incense and memorialize:
The Jade Clarity Highest Emperor, the Primordial Heavenly Worthy of Original Commencement;
The Supreme Clarity Great Emperor, the Numinous Treasure Heavenly Worthy;
The Grand Clarity Great Emperor, the Heavenly Worthy of Dao and Virtue;
The Jade Emperor of the Vast Heaven;
The Great Emperor of the Purple Tenuity Heavenly Sovereign;
The Great Emperor of the Purple Tenuity Northern Culmen;
The Great Emperor of the Grand Tenuity Southern Culmen of Longevity;
The Heavenly Worthy of the Eastern Culmen, the Great Unity Savior from Suffering;
The Numinous Treasure Heavenly Worthies of the Ten Directions;
The Five Elderly Lords;
The Thirty-Two Heavenly Emperor Lords;

**Petition to Open the Altar**

On the [day], the [day of the sexagenary cycle] of the [month] of the [year] of the [reign title], the Daoist disciple of the Great Way, [Name], of such-and-such rank, residing in [location], together with their household, having purified themselves with fasting and ablutions, bow twice with utmost reverence and humbly address the Most High Three Caverns Master, the Venerable [Name]:

We observe that since the primordial *qi* first divided, all things have been nurtured under its sheltering embrace; since the Dao’s origin first unfolded, its true lineage has manifested through successive generations. Yet only the perfected may fully propagate the Great Teaching. With sincere devotion, we dare to present our plea before your wisdom.

We, the undersigned, petition on behalf of the departed soul of so-and-so, who in life was bound to the true repose and dwelt in the human realm. Long entangled in the delusions of the Six Dusts, their Three Actions remained uncleansed. Fearing the inescapable retribution of the unseen and the accumulated wrongs of mortal transgressions, they have sunk into the abyss of night, forever severed from the light of the sun. Without the subtle and wondrous rites, how may their submerged suffering be alleviated? Thus, we have sought a master of the highest order to establish this sacred altar.

We reverently recall that the Venerable Master, the Perfected One, embodies the Dao in its purest essence, dwelling in profound tranquility. Having awakened to the essence of the Three Caverns and Four Supplements, you serve as the teacher of the Ten Directions and Three Realms. You open the gates of the Mysterious Portal and act as the vessel across the sea of suffering. Heaven and humanity revere your virtue; the hidden and the manifest alike receive your grace.

We humbly beseech you to extend your boundless compassion and heed our earnest prayers. May your spirit soar, guiding the reins across the Three Realms of the unseen; may you bestow talismanic commands to uplift the souls from the Nine Springs. As auspicious clouds descend, may the breath of life be inexhaustible; as the divine wind gathers, may the bones of the dead emit fragrant smoke. May this soul, once subject to judgment, attain the fruit of ascending to the true. Further, may the lingering consciousness of the Nine Ancestors and the hidden spirits of the Six Paths all ascend to the realm of liberation, together reaching the shore of the Inaudible and Invisible.

Our devotion is most earnest, our words inadequate to express it. We dare to intrude upon your august presence with this plea. This petitioner’s heart is filled with fervent supplication beyond measure.

**Response to the Petition to Open the Altar**

When the officiant concludes the deliverance prayer, the supervisor of the fast addresses the master:

"The Great Yellow Register Fast is a secret rite of the Purple Clarity. Its merit surpasses all dharmas, its grace extends to the Nine Netherworlds. We humbly implore the master’s compassion to ascend the altar and perform the ritual."

The master responds:
"The precious fast is of profound subtlety, its mysteries deeply hidden. Without mastery of its majestic forms, how may its canonical rites be proclaimed? My talents are unworthy; to accept this request is beyond my capacity."

The supervisor of the fast again addresses the master:
"The Jade Emperor’s transformation descends; the Three Caverns’ teachings are proclaimed. The Yellow Register’s rites are perfected, and the Nine Netherworlds are opened to peace. This is not merely the heartfelt plea of one, but the yearning gaze of all four assemblies. We beseech you to embody Heaven’s grace, to heed the desires of humanity. Should the departed souls attain deliverance, it will truly be the master’s boundless compassion."

The master responds:
"To deliver the dead and save the living relies entirely on the wondrous rites. To act on Heaven’s behalf requires the perfected. I am but a humble and unworthy vessel; how dare I accept such a great request?"

The supervisor of the fast again addresses the master:
"The departed spirits have gathered at the sacred altar. Banners of color and tassels of splendor attend the ritual seat. We humbly beseech you to proclaim the teachings and broadly deliver the submerged. This is not only the compassion of the Great Dao, but also the fortunate convergence of all the deluded."

The officiant and all present bow with utmost reverence.

The master responds:
"The true heart is easily obscured; the supreme Dao is difficult to know. With bodies stained by the Six Dusts, dwelling in the floating vanity of the Five Turbidities, karmic retribution binds the spirit, causing it to sink and drown. Without the gate of my dharma, there is no means of deliverance. Though I have been honored with this great request, how dare I neglect its execution? The canons have their eternal principles; I shall now proclaim them."

The officiant and all present prepare to bow in gratitude, but the master raises a hand to stop them. The master of ceremonies escorts the master to the seat, and the invocation of incense begins.

**Invocation of the Covenant**

The High Priest ascends the seat; the ritual assembly stands in order. The ritual proceedings commence. After the supervisor of the fast kneels and reads the disciple’s petition, the High Priest holds the incense and intones:

"Within the Land of Floating Radiance, upon the Jade Capital Mountain, for myriad years the *qi* has congealed into mist, and countless multitudes have communicated their sincerity and faith. Roots entwine the towering trees below; leaves fill the sandalwood groves. A single stick of precious incense burns in the censer, and the Three Realms and Ten Directions all bow in reverence."

Having spoken, the incense is placed in the censer.

The incense is offered to the Three Clarities and Three Realms, the Ten Poles and Ten Flowers, the Most High Perfected, the Dao, the Scriptures, the Masters, the Treasure, the Ten Directions and Three Realms, the Thousand Perfected and Myriad Spirits, the Great Yellow Register Fast, and the True Sovereign of Responses.

We humbly pray that you ride dragons and phoenixes, soaring through the void. Descend upon this ritual arena and witness the merit of this covenant.

The master takes the seat, and the invocation of the subtle and wondrous covenant begins:

Before the One True was yet manifest, the mechanisms of auspiciousness were already unified, for the Three *Qi* had first divided. The ultimate source of the serene and formless, the vast and spontaneous transformation, born at the inception of the Image Emperor, hidden within the empty and cavernous. The Primordial Beginning unfolded the chart, spreading the Five Scripts across the azure heavens; the Cavernous Mystery revealed its secrets, revolving the Ten Transformations within the original canon. The principle of ceaseless generation is inexhaustible; the origin of endless transformation is unfathomable. It set in motion the unfolding of the Two Modes, enabling the myriad beings to be transformed and completed. Its virtue is rooted in the love of life, standing alone as the Way of eternal life; its power lies in non-interference—who knows the essence of the True Sovereign? It is neither the ordinary Dao nor the ordinary name; it does not flee from humanity nor from things.

From the beginning of the Three Sovereigns, the Dao was complete within humanity. By the end of the Five Emperors, humanity had drifted far from the Dao. Private deceit prevailed, and Heaven’s principles faded; illusory realms deluded, and the awakened nature dimmed. Unable to preserve life and cherish the spirit, they turned ever further from the true and embraced the false. Thus, life arises from this, and death arises from this; emerging from the mechanism and returning to the mechanism. The true mind is drowned in joy, anger, greed, and wrath; the eternal truth is discarded like dreams, illusions, bubbles, and shadows. They bring death upon themselves, severed from their root. Assailed by both human transgressions and ghostly retributions, the blades of frost and snow converge upon them."

Amidst the raging flames of scorching hells, beside the towering peaks of icy pools, all arise from a single perverse thought, self-inflicting the torments of the Nine Dark Realms. Their cries of sorrow echo in vain, for they know only too late the errors of past lives; though the Savior manifests in myriad forms, they have not yet encountered the boundless grace that might reach them. The ceaseless currents of countless sins surge like unrelenting winds—only the Most High can lift them by the nape, delivering all without limit.

Expounding the vast scriptures of the Yellow Register, flourishing the sacred canons of the Covenant of Perfection, harnessing the chariot of nine phoenixes and eight simurghs to seek and save the ten directions, proclaiming the talismans of nine dragons and two tigers to open the path for the six destinies. Transforming the fires of torment into the sweet dew of cloud-milk, dispelling the shadows of flame with the radiant light of the Numinous Treasure. The blades of sword-trees shatter, the waves of cauldrons still. When the universal summons concludes, the fair ones of Li Hua attain deliverance; when one soul stands fearless, the Northern Emperor petitions in reverence. This is the supreme cause, a fruit beyond all measure.

For the Primordial Sovereign spread transformation, and the successive sages disseminated its flow. The scriptures divide into thirty-six sections, yet none surpasses the *Duren* in liberating beings; the fasts array in twenty-seven ranks, yet the Yellow Register stands foremost. Lord Ge Xuan transmitted the essence of the *Great Cavern*, while Zhang Jing responded with the *Rectified Unity* texts. The wellsprings of immortality flow boundlessly, and the lineage of truth transmits endlessly. Not only are its merits vast and universal, but its precepts command solemn awe. Without single-minded sincerity and utmost purity, how could one glimpse or hear of its great model?

Now, the officiant of the Yellow Register Grand Fast, so-and-so, pledges devotion to the Ten Poles and petitions the Three Heavens. Honoring ancestors with filial reverence, they seek to deliver countless generations; cultivating goodness and establishing merit, they universally succor all beings. With utmost sincerity and pledged faith, they gather a host of the pure and serene to solemnly convene the Covenant of Perfection. It is fitting that an exalted adept be chosen to proclaim and enact these rites.

As for myself—a mere drifter in the Dharma-sea, a humble student of the Mystery Gate—I have presumptuously taken my place among the robed, undeservingly inheriting the transmission of my masters. My body has not yet penetrated the true, how could it attain the wondrous union of form and spirit? My virtue is meager and shallow, how could it harmonize heaven and earth as one? I ought to cast off limbs and dull the senses, dwelling in mountains and marshes. How then has the dust of the world soiled me, burdening me with these ornate words? Yet, reflecting on the lingering embers of imperial favor, I recognize the depth of my devotion. Fortunate indeed that karmic conditions align, and worthy assistants are found. Together, we pledge our oaths, striving to perfect the fast’s affairs.

Moreover, the regulations are fully set forth, merits and transgressions clearly distinguished. The records of the Three Officials and Five Emperors, the registers of the Nine Bureaus and Four Offices—every minute detail is accounted for, not a speck overlooked. Let no negligence or carelessness arise, lest the blessings of cultivation be lost. We must swear before heaven and earth, pledge before gods and spirits, each pouring forth a sincere heart, harboring no stray thoughts. Then shall our merits be inscribed on azure tablets, elevating seven generations to ascend to heaven; let no sins be bound in black writ, lest nine lineages fall to earth.

At the moment of ascending the altar, at the outset of receiving office, all shall uphold the sworn words and together propagate the great teaching. Now, as the fast’s solemnity is established and the covenant’s proclamations complete, the jade pendants chime in harmony, resounding to the ten directions; the majestic rites stand in full array, observed by the myriad sages above. With unified sincerity, we raise the sublime affair, establishing the pure assembly—may all hold this in reverence.

**Invocation to the Mystic Master**

**Invocation to the Five Emperors**

From the Dharma-rank so-and-so, we reverently address:
The Azure Emperor of the Nine *Qi* of the East, Lord of the Verdant Dawn, Elder of the Azure Spirit, residing in the Jeweled Forest of Peace;
The Vermilion Emperor of the Three *Qi* of the South, Lord of the Flourishing Yang, True Elder of the Cinnabar Spirit, residing in the Jewel of Brahma’s Prosperity;
The White Emperor of the Seven *Qi* of the West, August Elder of the Radiant Spirit, residing in the Seven Jeweled Golden Gate;
The Black Emperor of the Five *Qi* of the North, Mystic Elder of the Five Numinous Ones, residing in the Solitary Darkness of the Northern Wilderness;
The Yellow Emperor of the One *Qi* of the Center, Primordial Elder of the Original Spirit, residing in the Jeweled Mystery of the Jade Treasure.

We have heard that when the Primordial Beginning unfolded the chart, the true scriptures manifested in the world; when the Three Origins established their positions, the Five Emperors governed the directions. May all within the household and the realm alike be encompassed by this blessed repose.

Your servants, with utmost sincerity and earnest supplication, bow in reverence and devotion, offering this retreat in solemn invocation.

**Opening the Retreat Altar**

**Three-Day Grand Retreat: Six Sessions of Invocation and Sutra-Chanting**
The methods of visualization, sutra-recitation, and circumambulation are fully set forth in the *Ritual for Ascending the Altar and Circumambulating with the Sutra*. Only the opening and closing invocations are adjusted according to the occasion.

**First Day – Morning Invocation for Sutra-Chanting (Traditional Text)**
The Jade Writs of the Purple Palace bestow blessings upon the ten directions and all beings; the Jade Tablets of the Mystic Capital subdue the hundred demons to deliver the multitudes. Above, they enable ascent to the heavens and descent to observe the world; below, they refine the souls of the dead. Their boundless merits defy full praise.

Today, on behalf of [Title] [Name], dedicating the merits for [Deity/Spirit], we have established the Unsurpassed Yellow Register Grand Retreat. The assembled pure assembly has reverently recited *The Wondrous Upper Chapter of the Numinous Treasure’s Limitless Salvation of All* once through, completing the full cycle. By this merit, we dedicate and offer to the Most High Primordial Heavenly Worthy of the Jade Capital and Golden Portals of the Seven Treasures in the Purple Tenuity Palace of the Great Luo Heaven; the August Lord of the Void and Supreme Dao; the Most High Lord Lao; the multitude of honored ones of the Dao and its Power; the sacred scriptures of the Three Caverns, the jade texts and mystic characters; the host of sages of the ten directions; the masters of past kalpas; the Perfected Ones who uphold the teachings; the Dharma Lords of the Mystic; and all the Perfected Ones gathered at this retreat altar.

By this sublime cause, we first adorn and dignify the deities of all heavens and earths, the sun, moon, and stars, the sacred mountains and rivers, the lords of wind and clouds, the ancestral spirits and former sages, emperors and empresses, crown princes and kings, civil and military officials, all peoples of Hua and Yi, and the multitudes of beings. May the Two Modes endure forever, and the Three Luminaries shine brightly. May the six qi harmonize and cold and heat balance, the eight seasons align and rain and sunshine be timely. May the jade charts be steadfast, the precious mandate prolonged. May the realm be illuminated, wars cease. May the nine provinces share a common path, the four seas unite in culture.

May the departed soul of [Name], once inscribed in the Black Register, have their name expunged and be ranked in the Crimson Palace. May their true heart remain undimmed, their awakened nature perfectly luminous. May the retreat’s sponsor, [Name], have their misfortunes averted and calamities extinguished. May their household thrive in peace, all ascending to the land of benevolence and longevity. May their seven ancestors ascend and directly attain the realm of carefree wandering. May all beings receive blessings, the darkness of the netherworld be illuminated. With bowed heads, we take refuge and reverently offer praise.

The above invocation is already recorded in the *Ritual for Ascending the Altar and Circumambulating with the Sutra*. This text is now composed anew only because the *Ritual for Circumambulation* in one fascicle was compiled by Master Du Guangcheng, and to avoid altering the ancient rites. Yet, lest modern practitioners grow overly familiar, this version is provided as an alternative.

**First Day – Evening Invocation for Sutra-Chanting**

May the field of blessings grow, securing peace for body and kin; may the grace of wisdom suffuse all, bringing prosperity to both the living and the departed.

The grace extends equally to state and family, the blessings reach both the living and the departed.

May golden perfection dissolve karmic knots, and the primordial Dao sever the roots of death’s domain; may jade tablets inscribe their names, and celestial mechanisms petition to extend their register of life. **On the Third Morning: Opening the Sutra**
The Great Dao divides its radiance, first expounding the teaching of wordless silence;
The Heavenly Worthy spreads transformation, gradually bestowing texts of wondrous creation.
Condensing qi into scripture, congealing clouds into celestial seals,
It encompasses the myriad dharmas, universally delivering all beings.

Today, we humbly act on behalf of [Name], universally dedicating this to the deceased kin [Name], and all assembled souls, as we reverently perform the Supreme Yellow Register Grand Retreat. We now gather the pure assembly before us to recite the *Most Exalted Wondrous Sutra of the Numinous Treasure of the Cavernous Mystery: The Upper Chapter on the Limitless Salvation of Humankind*.

May we rely on the true vehicle to dissolve karmic filth, the Dharma’s power to ferry them across, together severing the bonds of worldly defilement;
May sacred wisdom attain perfect penetration, equally attaining the fruit of true enlightenment.

May the departed souls receive deliverance, and all under heaven be blessed with grace.

It dispels the Three Calamities, delivers from the Nine Perils.
It orders the Five Qi, harmonizes the hundred spirits.
Treasured in the heavens above, not transmitted to the world below—
This is called the profound mystery, difficult to fathom in full.

**Text for Inviting the Spirits to the Altar**
After the departed souls have bathed, the reciter of hidden verses leads the banner-bearer to the altar’s base, facing south and standing northward to intone:

"Through karmic entanglements, they drift; their awakened nature obscured.
Once fallen into the dark paths, they cannot transcend the realm of the living.
Now, by the power of the Dao, they arrive at the numinous altar.
They should purify themselves, rectify their bodies, and incline their hearts.
Silently recite the refuge, bow to the Three Treasures in gratitude."

All the immortals reverently approach before the Dao, humbly receiving deliverance.

**First Day’s Offering of the Purification Feast:**
The honor due the boundless is beyond all measure;
The utmost reverence of our offered sincerity is wordless.
We humbly present this precious feast,
Solemnly arraying its fine viands.
We emulate the otter’s and jackal’s gratitude,
And aspire to the offerings of water-plants and ferns.
Daring to offend your luminous majesty,
We are deeply remiss and transgress.
We prostrate ourselves, awaiting punishment.

---

**Second Day’s Offering of the Purification Feast:**
Reverently upholding the mystic model,
We humbly open the Yellow Altar.
Invoking the command of the Venerable Masters,
We pray for the radiance of your grace to descend;
Offering sincerity with water-plants and pondweed,
We hope for the divine response to draw near.
Looking up, we rely on your supreme benevolence;
Looking down, we implore your compassion for our humble offerings.
We prostrate ourselves, awaiting punishment.

---

**Third Day’s Offering of the Purification Feast:**
The Nine Dragons suspend their imperial presence,
Their resplendent light shining brilliantly;
The Three Qi congeal in majesty,
Their awe-inspiring countenance looming near.
We have prepared pure and fragrant offerings,
Humbly striving to express our devotion.
Our rites have profaned the divine,
And we willingly accept the axe’s punishment.
We prostrate ourselves, awaiting punishment.

---

**Invitation to the Deceased to Receive Deliverance:**
After the nine audiences are completed, on the night of the deliverance of the soul,
The feast officers and family members proceed before the numinous altar,
Offer incense, and take leave of the deceased.

The Dharma Master for the Invitation of the Deceased intones:
The paths of life and death diverge; the living never forget the dead.
The destinies of immortals and mortals differ; the Dao of immortals can transcend the mundane.
This soul has traversed worldly entanglements,
Deeply dwelling on the true path.
Yet, lost in the distant dark,
It has not yet attained rebirth in the night.
Now, we establish the Yellow Register,
Proclaiming the Purple Model.
We have eradicated karmic burdens,
And released the roots of suffering.
It is fitting to compose oneself, quiet the heart,
Reflect on the true, and contemplate the Dao.
Reverently receive the refining and deliverance,
Humbly await ascension.
Behold the precious flower of the Three Qi,
Listen to the wondrous precepts of the Nine Perfected.
Receive the transmission of the white writ,
And ascend to the Vermilion Palace.
The assembly, with utmost sincerity,
Chants the hidden verses to welcome and guide.

---

**Farewell Prayer for the Departed:**
The Dao is but a forced name; the four elements are but a temporary union.
The body is not one’s own; which of the six relations can truly be called kin?
Moreover, the dream realm is illusory,
And the kalpa’s dust is defiled.
It cannot bear attachment or delight,
But should be swiftly abandoned.
Now, the purification feast is concluded,
And the audience with the Perfected is imminent.
With fluttering feathered sleeves,
Step swiftly upon the cloud thoroughfares.
Refine the soul in the Heaven of the Three Qi,
Bow in reverence to the realm of the Ten Flowers.
Ever heed the true Dharma,
And eternally attend the Compassionate Honored One.
Deeply comprehend true emptiness,
Without lingering attachments.
Go well.
Go well.

**Farewell Prayer to the Five Emperors:**
In full ritual rank and surname, so-and-so humbly invokes:
The Azure Emperor of the Nine Qi, Heavenly Lord of the East, Lord of the Origin and Elder of the Azure Spirit in the Jeweled Forest of Peace;
The Vermilion Emperor of the Three Qi, Heavenly Lord of the South, True Elder of the Vermilion Spirit in the Flourishing Yang of the Brahma Treasure;
The White Emperor of the Seven Qi, Heavenly Lord of the West, August Elder of the White Spirit at the Golden Gate of the Seven Treasures;
The Black Emperor of the Five Qi, Heavenly Lord of the North, Mysterious Elder of the Five Spirits in the Dark Solitude of the Northern Wilderness;
The Yellow Emperor of the One Qi, Heavenly Lord of the Center, Primeval Elder of the Primordial Spirit in the Jade Treasure.

When the Great Beginning first divided, the Five Elders became the progenitors of creation; their profound efficacy unfathomable, they oversee the Three Heavens and the offices of judgment. The precious purification feast now concluded, the celestial steps are no longer traceable. Though we perform the rites of offering and reverence, we cannot escape the transgressions of corpse defilement and contamination. For our missteps in ritual deportment and our lapses in audience protocol, we acknowledge all as faults and humbly beg for your compassion and absolution. May the living and the dead alike receive your blessings, and may your grace extend universally to households and kingdoms. The jade altar is now cleared, and your jade chariots ascend. The nine phoenixes sing, the eight simurghs cry, the myriad perfected gather, and all heavens rejoice. Our gaze is fixed in longing, yet we cannot follow. We are overwhelmed by the radiance of your grace.

With reverence, we bow twice and take our leave.

---

**Farewell Prayer to the Three Masters:**
In full ritual rank and surname, so-and-so humbly invokes:
The Perfected Lord of the Scripture Master of the Numinous Treasure,
The Perfected Lord of the Register Master of the Numinous Treasure,
The Perfected Lord of the Salvation Master of the Numinous Treasure.

The vermilion memorial has reported our merits to the Ten Poles; the golden dragon soars in splendor, bearing our offerings to the Three Primes. By the luminous protection of the venerated masters, the purification feast has reached its perfect fruition. The unseen and the manifest are opened to prosperity, a joy beyond words. We have been favored by your divine presence and graced by your radiant majesty. Having attended your cloud-palace, you now return to your bejeweled chariots. As your immortal retinue ascends, we gaze afar toward the crimson heavens. We beseech your boundless compassion to bestow your vast grace universally.

Overwhelmed by longing and devotion, we bow twice with reverence and take our leave.

---

**Farewell Prayer to the Inspector of the Purification Feast:**
In full ritual rank and surname, so-and-so humbly invokes:
The Perfected Lord, Great Dharma Master and Inspector of the Numinous Treasure.

The ranks of the enlightened are resplendent, revealing the scriptures of deliverance; the yellow registers and their statutes fully set forth the precepts of dignity. We have followed the codes in reverence, yet in proclaiming the prohibitions, we may have transgressed. We fear that the heavens may lack records of our good deeds, while the Five Emperors hold ledgers of our faults. How can the departed soul ascend? Our special karma is tainted. We look to your vast compassion to grant us great forgiveness, to announce it to the Three Realms, and to inform the Ten Heavens. Together, we attest to the merit of the feast, that its blessings may flow widely. May the rotting bones be clothed anew in flesh, and the withered skeletons rise as living beings. The jade altar is now dispersed, the incense burners’ embers fade, and the sacred talismans are spent. We turn our gaze to your wind-borne chariot, already returned to the jasper heavens.

Overwhelmed by longing and devotion, we bow twice with reverence and take our leave.

---

**Farewell Prayer to the Three Officials:**
In full ritual rank and surname, so-and-so humbly invokes:
The Heavenly Official of Bestowed Blessings, First Rank of the Upper Prime, the Great Emperor of the Purple Tenuity;
The Earthly Official of Pardoned Sins, Second Rank of the Middle Prime, the Great Emperor of Pure Emptiness;
The Water Official of Released Calamities, Third Rank of the Lower Prime, the Great Emperor of Dark Solitude.

We have established the sacred altar of Brahma qi and conducted the purification feast with solemnity; we have humbly summoned the radiant chariots of the Three Primes to witness our covenant. By fortune, the Daoist rites are now complete, and we have been graced by your luminous presence. Yet we fear our profanations have violated the statutes. The registers will record our faults in the Four Offices, and the Nine Treasuries will inscribe our transgressions. We cannot escape the dark decrees, and our errors may reach the unseen realms. We beg for your great mercy to pardon our unforgiven faults. May the earthly records be severed, and the watery covenants dissolved. May all sentient beings in the Dharma realms equally bathe in the wisdom and grace of the Profound Mystery.

Overwhelmed by longing and devotion, we bow twice with reverence and take our leave.

---

**Farewell Prayer to the Heavenly Master:**
In full ritual rank and surname, so-and-so humbly invokes:
The Heavenly Master of the Three Heavens, Great Dharma Master of All Heavens, Perfected Lord of the Orthodox Unity and Serene Response.

The Primordial August One established the teachings, inscribing the three registers; the Master and Treasure bestowed compassion, becoming the lords of the Profound Mystery. We have opened the yellow altar to make our vows and humbly summoned your crimson chariot to descend. The sublime fruit is now perfected, and the true merit shines forth. We reflect that our learning of the Dharma is incomplete, and our observance of the precepts is often flawed. We have presumptuously undertaken the grand rites and conducted the purification feast. We have issued talismanic commands and summoned the spirits. Our devotion was not single-minded, and our reverence was at times negligent. All these are counted as transgressions, and we cannot escape the dark punishments. We pray for your pity and beg for universal pardon. May the imperial transformation be proclaimed, and the Emperor’s compassion be further extended.

We gaze toward the layered heavens, where your true chariot is already prepared. Unable to follow in your radiant train, our spirits strain in longing.

Overwhelmed by longing and devotion, we bow twice with reverence and take our leave.

---

**Farewell Prayer to the Profound Master:**
In full ritual rank and surname, so-and-so humbly invokes:
The Perfected Lord, Great Dharma Master of the Profound Center, Transformative Lord of the Three Heavens.

The rites at the yellow altar are now complete; by fortune, we have roughly performed the grand ceremonies. The white memorial has ascended, and we trust it has silently conveyed our gratitude for your radiant favor. Your celestial chariot has turned back to witness the covenant of the feast. Our sincerity is exhausted, yet we cannot repay the profound grace bestowed. We reflect that our understanding has not yet grasped the Dao, and our bodies have not penetrated the truth. We have presumptuously worn the sacred talismans, yet remain indistinguishable from the demonic and the vulgar. Our duty is to deliver and save, our office to proclaim and transmit. Unmindful of our defiled and insignificant bodies, we have presumptuously undertaken the sacred rites of the enlightened. We have issued talismanic commands and wielded the dew-writing brush. For five days, we have made petitions; for nine mornings, we have offered thanks. We have dispatched generals and officers, wearied the spirits and gods. Our learning of the Dharma is incomplete, and our observance of the precepts is lacking. Our devotion was not single-minded, and our dignity was often deficient. All these profanations are counted as transgressions. We fear the unpardonable punishments and the karmic retributions of both seen and unseen realms. We can only hope for your great pardon and universal compassion. May the sincerity of the feast’s sponsor in seeking the Dao be acknowledged, and may the faults of the Dharma assembly be absolved. May your grace extend to both the unseen and the manifest, bestowing blessings upon the state and its households. May the winds of compassion be greatly stirred, and the teachings of the Dao be forever exalted.

The feast is now dispersed, and the crane-borne chariot cannot be detained.

Overwhelmed by longing and devotion, we bow twice with reverence and take our leave.

With hands bowed to the celestial thoroughfare, our spirits race toward the highest heavens. Overcome with longing and devotion, we reverently kowtow twice and take our leave.

**Document for the Supervising Officials:**
The precious fast has concluded, and the altar rites are complete. Merit has been presented to the Three Heavens, and grace flows to the ten directions. We now beseech the divine chariots to return, each to their sacred abodes. The fast’s sponsor, with utmost reverence, kowtows in farewell.

**Text for the Dharma Assembly Gathering in the Hall:**
The assembly arranges itself in proper order. The cantor leads the faithful in three bows of reverence. They sit in accordance with the ritual.

**First Offering of Food:**
The High Priest recites the incantation for the offering of food:
All fields of merit begin with the offering of sustenance. May the living find joy, and the departed ascend to heaven. May those yet to come dwell in pure lands, where clothing and nourishment arise naturally. Thus, we make offerings universally to all deities. From the fragrant kitchens, exquisite offerings are presented—first to the Heavenly Worthies, then to the Perfected Sages, and finally to all sentient beings, that all may partake equally. May blessings flow to the living and the dead, as waters return to the sea.

**Upon Completion of the Fast:**
The leftover rice is gathered, and the text for offering to all beings is recited:
Diligently cultivating the great Dao’s teachings, with focused minds we move the darkest mysteries. The true descends, and demonic illusions scatter; all malevolent spirits vanish. May the seven generations of ancestors ascend to the heavenly halls, soaring into the highest purity. Since blessings extend universally, this food is offered to all beings.

**Next, the Cantor Proclaims:**
For all future lives, may this create good karmic conditions.

**Dedication of Merit:**
Boundless compassion grants every wish. The great Dao gathers in emptiness, and all prayers are answered. The merits of this fast are limitless, the most excellent of causes. We pray for the fast’s sponsor, their seven generations of ancestors, and the departed souls they commend—may they emerge from eternal night and enter the light. May disasters vanish and blessings descend, that in life and death they may ascend as immortals.

We invoke the great sagely **Yuanshi Tianzun**, the **Most High Lord of the Dao**, the **Most High Lord Lao**, and the **Lingbao Heavenly Worthies of the Ten Directions**. Unfathomable are their merits.

**Chapter: Essential Knowledge for Conducting the Fast**

**Standards for Observance and Offering**
When establishing a grand fast, it is paramount to select a grotto-heaven, blessed land, or Daoist abbey as the superior site.

The altar must be positioned with precise orientation: facing south, with its back to the north, adhering to the original directional alignment of the abbey’s existing altar. If constructed in a separate hall, the altar should be erected according to the prescribed form. Once the altar’s position is correct, even if the hall’s orientation is irregular, the rites may proceed unimpeded.

The fast’s sponsor must cultivate utmost sincerity and reverence. The preparation of dragon-silk and jade-knotted seals must prioritize refinement and excellence. Incense, flowers, oil, and candles—every requisite item—must be pure and immaculate, avoiding any defilement or deficiency at the time of use.

The scriptures state: In performing a grand fast, single-minded devotion is foremost, with dragon-silk as the highest offering. Fragrant candles and reverent purity follow thereafter. Any lapse, however minor, mars the fast’s perfection. Those who uphold these rites must observe these precepts with utmost care.

When establishing a fast, one must act within one’s means. The wealthy may furnish all necessities; the poor may adapt accordingly. The procurement of fast requisites must not involve ill-gotten wealth or disputes over prices. Excessive frugality despite ample means, or forced expenditure beyond one’s capacity, both betray insincerity and hinder divine resonance.

If the fast’s sponsor hails from a family of loyalty and filial piety but lacks resources, the master may provide dragon-silk and other essentials, simplifying all matters as needed.

Documents such as memorials, petitions, and offerings should be categorized appropriately, ensuring propriety in their arrangement.

When the fast’s officiant submits a memorial, those with official rank shall list their titles; those without shall be styled "Devoted Daoist Disciple." If the sponsor is in mourning for parents, they shall be styled "Solitary Child" or "Grieving Child."

If the deceased remains unburied within the household, the dwelling’s dimensions must be measured. If the deceased lies elsewhere, the fast may still be conducted. However, those afflicted by death’s defilement or who have not undergone purification rites may not establish an altar within their home.

The visualization techniques and incantations employed during the fast are recorded in the *Chapter on Fast Rituals and Their Application*. The protocols for chanting and ceremonial deportment are detailed in the *Chapter on Requisites for Observance*. These will not be reiterated here.

**Documentary Procedures**
For memorials to the Celestial Worthies, use a *zou zhuang* (memorial petition); for other matters, use a *shen zhuang* (submission petition). Communications with divine bureaus shall employ *gong die* (official missives).

Memorial petitions shall be styled "Your subject petitions," with the recipient designated as the "Heavenly Pivot Institute," the "relevant bureau," or prefaced with the bureau’s seal. Notices, notes, and missives shall be titled "This Bureau."

For memorials and submissions, leave one hand’s breadth of space at the top and two at the bottom. Paper should measure approximately one *chi* and four *cun* in height; extended scroll paper is preferable. Petitions for offerings and invocations shall use standard petition paper.

Within memorials, the names of sacred entities shall be inscribed on yellow labels and affixed at the appropriate time.

At the top of memorials, affix a yellow strip (*tie huang*), measuring either three *cun* and two *fen* in height by two *cun* and four *fen* in width, or three *cun* and six *fen* in height by three *cun* in width, as the standard. Write in single columns. After affixing the yellow strip, inscribe the officiant’s name at the seam, apply the seal, or follow the imperial court’s format for yellow strips.

Within memorials and submissions, use small yellow labels (*yi huang*) for marginal notes, affixing them beside the year’s cyclical sign.

For memorials and submissions with a single sacred entity, affix a yellow label to the side. For two or four entities, use a slightly wider yellow label affixed centrally. For three or five entities, the central position denotes precedence. For two or four entities, the right side denotes precedence.

Within sacred contexts, write "Before the Throne" or "Before the Sacred." Alternatively, only the foremost entity may be listed. For petitions to terrestrial deities, use white labels.

For square envelopes (*fang han*) containing memorials or submissions, omit the yellow strip on the exterior and do not style the text as "Your subject." Inscribe only the title and the phrase "Memorial Tablet" at both ends. The outer envelope follows the same rule.

If a submission contains multiple sacred entities, the square envelope shall list only the foremost. For example, if the Wood Virtue of the East and the Eastern Dipper’s Seven Mansions are addressed in a single petition, title it: "Before the Sacred, the True Lord Jupiter, Wood Virtue of the East," and the like.

**Stylistic Conventions for Memorials and Submissions**
Memorials to the Supreme Deity shall invoke the "Edict of the Dao’s Compassion"; those to the Celestial Worthies, the "August and Wise Decree." Memorials to the Two Empresses shall invoke the "Sacred Decree of the Celestial Palace."

The Three Clarities and Four Emperors shall be addressed as "Your Majesty"; the Two Empresses as "Your Highness." Celestial Worthies shall be addressed as "Before the Throne"; the Perfected as "Before the Sacred." Terrestrial deities shall be addressed as "Before the Divine."

**Offerings**
Celestial Worthies shall be presented with dragon chariots. Earthly Sovereigns and Lords shall be offered palanquins.

**Protocols for Missives and Notices**
All missives and notices shall be endorsed in vermilion. Official missives shall bear the officiant’s name and signature. Notices and notes shall bear only the signature.

On the front of a missive’s cover, inscribe "Respectfully" at the top, the ritual rank’s seal in the center, the officiant’s name and signature below, and "Sealed" at the bottom, using three seals. On the reverse, inscribe the bureau’s seal, "For the Attention of the Director," using two seals.

For notices, on the front, imprint the ritual rank’s seal, sign, and inscribe "Sealed" at the bottom, using one seal at the front and two at the back.

For memorials and submissions sealed at the half-year mark, inscribe the officiant’s name and affix one seal, with another below the perforation.

Square envelopes shall bear three seals on both front and back.

All missives, notices, placards, and the like shall be signed and sealed. For official missives and placards, the cyclical year’s line shall bear four seals, with three at the front. Notices shall bear one seal at the half-year mark.

All seals shall be applied starting from the back.

**Talismans, Bamboo Slips, and Announcements**
For talismans, bamboo slips, and announcements, affix one seal to the date. For perforated documents, use two seals on the front and one on the back.

Talismanic documents sent in square envelopes shall follow the envelope’s sealing protocol.

Memorials and submissions to celestial entities shall use the *Three Qi Flying Mystery Jade Seal* or the *Seal of the Lord of the Great Dharma of All Heavens*. Square envelopes shall bear the same seal at both ends or the *Seal of the Universal Chapter*, with the *Seal of the Great Dharma Bureau of the Numinous Treasure* on the front.

Submissions to middle and lower celestial entities shall use the *Seal of the Great Dharma Bureau of the Numinous Treasure*.

Longevity talismans shall bear the *Primordial Qi Seal of the Yuan Shi*. Salvation talismans shall use the *Azure Mystery Salvation Seal*. Jade missives shall bear the *Seal of the Lord of the Jade Chief Bureau*.

For talismanic documents belonging to the Jade Clarity realm, use the *Seal of the Primordial Beginning*. For those belonging to the Eastern Ultimate, use the *Salvation Seal*. For those belonging to the Highest Clarity, use the *Seal of the Three Heavens and the Most High*. This seal may also be universally applied to all talismans. Memorials and petitions shall use the *Seal of the Nine Elder Immortals of the Immortal Capital*. Green petitions shall use the *Three Qi Jade Seal*. Outer envelopes shall follow the protocol for memorials: the central seal shall be the *Three Qi Jade Seal*, while the seals at both ends may use either the *Seal of the Three Heavens and the Most High* or the *Universal Chapter Seal*.

For written memorials, each line shall contain seventeen characters, spaced two cun and four fen apart, forming a single line. The paper shall be one chi and two cun in height. For memorial tablets, each line shall contain twenty-four characters as the standard, with the number of sheets and lines preferably being odd. Leave two blank lines at the beginning and three at the end, following the usual format. Green petitions shall follow the same format as memorials and tablets, without restriction on the number of characters. Leave a space of one palm’s width at the beginning and two palms’ width at the end. For documents requiring perforation, use a three-cun yellow paper strip, and enclose the outer envelope in a square case.

All memorials, petitions, and tablets shall be written in a dedicated chamber, where an incense table shall be set. No outsiders shall be permitted entry. The scribe must bathe, change clothes, and enter the chamber. When writing memorials or petitions, cover both ends of the paper to prevent contact with clothing. In writing memorials or petitions, do not begin with a person’s name or place a ghost character at the head. Do not invert characters for life or death or mutilate a person’s name. When burning incense, do not use ashes or fire from the stove. For burning paper money and other offerings, do not use oil lamps or candles to ignite them. For vegetarian offerings, do not use dairy products. Do not consume alcohol before the ritual.

The High Priest must have received the *Register of the Three and Five Capital Offices*, the *Zhengyi Alliance Register*, the *Middle Alliance Five Dharma Registers of the Numinous Treasure*, the *Ten Sections of the Wondrous Scriptures of the Numinous Treasure*, and be practiced in the *Great Dharma of the Numinous Treasure* before conducting rituals according to the regulations. If only the *Register of the Capital Offices* and the *Alliance Register* have been received, along with the *Numinous Treasure Scriptures* and the practice of the *Celestial Pivot* and *Celestial Heart* refinement and deliverance methods, they may also be permitted to perform the rituals. In memorials and petitions, where the *Great Dharma Bureau of the Numinous Treasure* is mentioned, and in ritual protocols where the *Alliance of the Three Caverns’ Treasure Scripts and Golden Characters of Jade* is referenced, the text must be adjusted accordingly.

If a Dharma Master has only received the *Register of the Capital Offices* and the *Registers of Ascending Mystery, Yang Radiance, or Cavern Abyss*, but not the *Alliance Register*; or only the *Register of the Capital Offices* and the *Middle Alliance Five Dharma Registers*, but not the *Alliance Register*; or only the *Register of the Capital Offices* and the *Highest Clarity Register*, but not the *Alliance Register*; or only the *Register of the Capital Offices* without the *Alliance Register*; or only the *Alliance Register* without the *Register of the Capital Offices*—none of these shall be permitted to conduct rituals. The Numinous Treasure ritual protocols originate from the officials of the *Three and Five* and *Zhengyi* registers; without both registers, the officiating ranks are incomplete, and no ritual may be performed.

The five roles below the *Chief Lector* must also have received the *Three and Five*, *Zhengyi*, *Numinous Treasure*, and *Yang Radiance* registers before they may participate in the altar. When inviting fellow Daoist participants, they must be those who endure kneeling and bowing, embrace simplicity, dedicate themselves to incense and rituals, and do not covet wealth and property, before they may form a sworn alliance. They shall ascend the altar and, together with the ritual patrons, devote themselves sincerely to beseeching the celestial realms, thereby invoking divine response. If they merely focus on the beauty of sounds and rhythms without concentrated devotion, not only will they waste their energy and squander resources, but they may also incur blame and achieve nothing. The success of the ritual lies entirely in the selection of participants; this must not be taken lightly.

Twelve *Ritual Attendants* responsible for maintaining decorum must first master the *Scripture of Pacing the Void* and the *Ten Great Pacing the Void* chants. During the circumambulation of the main ritual, they shall accompany the chanting with their voices. Scribes assigned to write documents must bathe and wash their clothes upon arrival, ensuring cleanliness before commencing work. Scribes and all personnel involved in the bureau shall first make a covenant not to return home for meals or lodging. A separate person shall be assigned to provide them with food and accommodations. Another person shall be designated to manage the paper and writing materials, distributing them by count. If errors occur, no corrections or alterations are permitted; instead, the entire sheet must be rewritten, and a new sheet of paper shall be provided. The erroneous sheet shall be collected for verification of the paper count and to assess the scribe’s accuracy.

The quantity of paper and writing materials allocated by the *Office of Ritual Expenses* is a fixed amount. When purchasing paper, acquire several dozen extra sheets to replace those with errors. The forty-ninth scroll of the *Complete Ritual of the Supreme Yellow Register Great Fast* concludes here. The fiftieth scroll begins.

Compiled by Supreme Enforcer of the Dao, Immortal Scholar Jiang Shuyu

Each 9 cun in width, 5 cun in height as standard.

**The above are calculated according to the original liturgical manual. Should any items remain unlisted, prepare them as appropriate.**

**When establishing a grand vegetarian feast, abundant ritual offerings are ideal, yet this is only feasible for those of great means. If a filial descendant, moved by deep devotion, lacks the resources to fulfill all requirements, the master should assess their contribution and reduce the scale of offerings—such as incense, candles, spirit money, memorial paper, and other ritual necessities—without demanding perfection, lest even a trace of reluctance arise.**

**As for altar linens, the scriptures provide no fixed measure. The master’s share of ritual donations should be distributed among fellow participants and the poor, for “not coveting is the true treasure.” Yet in this age, such principles are often reversed, their essence lost.**
